name: Strathlyn Coach House Barossa
summary: Please note there is a minimum stay of 2 nights. Make use of the new Gymnasium and Guest Laundry on the property. Enjoy the location set among the vineyards. Conveniently close to the town of Angaston, cafes, restaurants, wineries and  bike track.
space: Strathlyn Coach House is an independent building located at Strathlyn Estate, a privately owned 5 acre historic property located on the fringe of Angaston in the Barossa Valley. The coach house was constructed circa 1905 was restored in 1995 as comfortable accommodation for two. Built of local stone with 30 centimetre walls, the coach house is quite an historic landmark, testifying to life of a bygone era. The outside of the building remains much the same as it was in 1905, but the interior has been finished with extensive use of timber. A mezzanine level bedroom has been created from the original loft floor. A large balcony area, reached from the attractive bedroom, has panoramic views across the width of the valley to the Greenock Ranges. Guests can sip a glass of wine while watching the setting sun, or enjoy an intimate breakfast for two on a warm, still morning. A separate driveway to the building, and secluded location away from the main residence ensure guests' privacy. The facil

Conveniently close to the town of Angaston, cafes, restaurants, wineries and  bike track. neighborhood_overview: Strathlyn Estate is a very private property surrounded by extensive gardens. It is off the main road located amongst vineyards within walking distance of Saltram Winery. The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.
notes: When first arriving check in at the Reception located on the eastern verandah of the main residence facing the tennis court. During certain times of the year (harvesting) there will be activities and some occasional noise within the vineyards.
transit: Please ask your host Heather about the local taxi service and tours of the Valley.
access: Guests can access the whole property except the main residence interior.  The coachhouse is a stand alone building 80 m from the main residence located in an old Almond Orchard.
interaction: Your host, Heather, is available to provide local knowledge and suggestions upon request. Guests should be mindful that there may be other guests staying in some of the other accommodation options on the property.
house_rules: Please leave the Coach House in a tidy condition upon departure. No smoking. No more than 2 people per room.  No extra guests permitted.
host_location: Barossa Wine Region of South Australia
host_about: I have been a long time resident of the Barossa Valley.I would be happy to provide you with information about local points of interest.

name: Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa  Barossa
summary: Enjoy the charms of the Barossa Valley in this self contained cottage on the beautiful Strathlyn Estate located just out of Angaston. If you are on an extended holiday, you have the convenience of a guest laundry on the property and a new Gymnasium.
space: The Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa Apartment is a self contained free standing cottage located at Strathlyn Estate, a privately owned 5 acre historic property located on the fringe of Angaston in the Barossa Valley.  The cottage provides quality accommodation for one couple, features a large 2 person spa at one end of the bedroom in a tiled area. A spacious living area and TV/DVD and comfortable large sofa encourage relaxation. The well equipped kitchenette is supplied with ample provisions for breakfast. A separate bathroom has a shower/toilet and vanity. There is an outdoor table setting in a walled area near the pond and garden allowing for outdoor relaxation or meals

The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.

name: Strathlyn Spa Garden Suites Barossa
summary: The spa garden suites are located on the eastern side of the main residence at Strathlyn Estate. They are very private with their own access from the garden. They are tastefully and comfortably furnished. Each features a luxury bathroom with spa.
space: Strathlyn Residence was constructed in 1905 from local Angaston marble.  It graces the top of a hill overlooking surrounding vineyards next to the historic Saltram Winery. Originally comprising of 6 bedrooms the house has been extensively renovated. The Strathlyn Spa Garden Suites are tastfully furnished suites in the main residence with their own private entrances from the garden.

name: Shea-Oak Log Studio Shed
summary: Our converted shed is a cozy and comfortable one bedroomed studio with glossy kitchen, granite bench tops, timber floors, shiny bathroom and large carpeted bedroom with a comfy queen bed. The studio has everything you could possibly need to have a wonderful and comfortable stay. Located in western Barossa, just off the Sturt Hwy, minutes away from Barossa attractions and 50 minutes from Adelaide. Be Consumed-In the Barossa.
space: The Shea-Oak Log Studio AKA The Shed, is a lovely space. A large double glass sliding door lets the morning sun stream in onto the timber floor. There is 2 leather lounges which seats 5 people with ease. The extra large bedroom has a queen bed and room for a portacot, if needed. The Studio is set up to fit 2 people with comfort.  The Studio is full insulated and very comfortable in any weather, with 2 air conditioners, portable heater and a fan. The Studio is located at the southern end of our property, which is only around 200 metres off of the Sturt Highway. You will hear some road noise from time to time.
description: Our converted shed is a cozy and comfortable one bedroomed studio with glossy kitchen, granite bench tops, timber floors, shiny bathroom and large carpeted bedroom with a comfy queen bed. The studio has everything you could possibly need to have a wonderful and comfortable stay. Located in western Barossa, just off the Sturt Hwy, minutes away from Barossa attractions and 50 minutes from Adelaide. Be Consumed-In the Barossa. The Studio is located at the southern end of our property, which is only around 200 metres off of the Sturt Highway. You w
neighborhood_overview: The Studio is located in a very unique area. There are no close by neighbouring houses, you are moments off of the Sturt Highway which leads you to the heart of the Barossa in 10 minutes and to Adelaide in 50 minutes. The studio is situated at the southern end of our property which is close to the Sturt Highway, this is great for access but you can hear the road noise from the studio. You are surrounded by the Barossa Ranges, vineyards and broadacre crops. No one will bother you here! Only our little miniature schnauzers Hugo and Alfie, who likes to come and say hello from time to time!
notes: The Studio is located on an old vineyard. We are in the middle of rebuilding the vineyard as the Pinery Fire in 2015 destroyed the majority of our lovely vines.  Also, it is good to remember that this a farm and we are surrounded by broad acre crops and vineyards. Occasionally you may see some of the local wildlife like mice and snakes around the place, but we do do our best to keep them at bay. Its all a part of country living! Our property was burnt out in the Pinery Fire in 2015, destroying the majority of our vineyard, all the fences, gardens and a lot of the trees. We are gradually rebuilding and replanting. It's a very slow process but we will return the property back to its former glory soon enough.
transit: A car is a must if staying at the Studio. There is no public transport available. Your car has its own double carport! Taxi's are available. The Airport Flyer also is available. The closest public transport is in Gawler, only 10 minutes away, with trains and buses available.  Tour buses pick up guests regularly from the The Studio.
access: The Studio is a converted shed. With half of the shed converted into living quarters and the other half remains an implement shed for the vineyard equipment. There is a door joining the two areas but this remains locked at all times.  Guests will have access to all the living areas, bathroom and bedroom and are also very welcome to wander through the orchard and vineyards around the Studio. The Studio does not have a washing machine. But there are laundry mats in Gawler and guests can use the clothes line out the back of the studio.  Please be conscious that this is a working vineyard and machinery does move around the vineyard from time to time. Also, we are very rural and have numerous wildlife come to visit including foxes, mice, kangaroos, emus, snakes and endless birds.
interaction: The Studio is totally self contained with access to the property via a locked security key box. The code is given to guest prior to arrival. We understand that guests like to be independent and not disturbed, so we leave you to your own devices. But, as we are only 500mt away, if there are any problems, we are close by to lend a hand or offer some advice on where to go and what to see. The Studio also has a wide array of local brochures and maps.
house_rules: Check-in time is from 2PM onwards unless with prior arrangement. Check out time is by 10am unless with prior arrangement. No smoking inside the property. If smoking on the deck, please dispose of all butt. Be very careful with smoking outside as we live in a high fire risk zone and were severely effected by the Pinery Fire in 2015. Two people maximum sleeping in the property, unless with prior arrangement. A portacot can be arranged if a baby is required to stay. Feel free to pat the ponies but be aware that the fence is electrified. The ponies love apples and carrots but nothing else please. Please be aware that this is a rural property and we coexist with little creatures such as rabbits, lizards, mice and the odd snake. Please take care. Our property was severely impacted by the Pinery fire in November 2015. We lost everything besides our house and the studio. The vineyard along with all fencing, sheds, equipment and gardens were destroyed. It was devastating. We are slowly bring th
host_about:
We are a family of 4 who live, work and play in the Barossa Valley. We live on a small vineyard and make our own wine. We love the big outdoors, camping, the Murray river and doing things as a family. 
We are true locals and know the Barossa inside and out.
We live on the property but are far enough away to not bother you at all and let you enjoy yourselves but close enough if you have any problems.

name: Barossa Valley Apt 1 offers 2 bedrooms 2 bathroom
summary: Luxury apartment on offer right in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Tanunda. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms, FREE WIFI, full kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, access to laundry, own spa bath, double shower, 1 King bed which can split to 2 singles and 1 queen. Access to swimming pool. Let us tour you as well. Great location to walk to restaurants, cafes and some wineries. We are also Tour Barossa so would love to help with all your wine touring needs, airport transfers and restaurant.
space: Our luxury apartments are locate in a fantastic location right in Tanunda, the heart of the Barossa Valley. Children are very welcome to stay at our property, and can provide cot's and highchairs, also a pram if needed (upon prior request) Tanunda has some wonderful restaurants, cafes and some great wineries to walk to, too. We have 4 apartments to choose from, 2 downstairs offering their own enclosed rear courtyards and 2 upstairs with balconies overlooking the garden and swimming pool.
description: Luxury apartment on offer right in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Tanunda. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms, FREE WIFI, full kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, access to laundry, own spa bath, double shower, 1 King bed which can split to 2 singles and 1 queen. Access to swimming pool. Let us tour you as well. Great location to walk to restaurants, cafes and some wineries. We are also Tour Barossa so would love to help with all your wine touring needs, airport transfers and restaurant. Our luxury apartments are locate in a fantastic location right in Tanunda, the heart of the Barossa Valley. Children are very welcome to stay at our property, and can provide cot's and highchairs, also a pram if needed (upon prior request) Tanunda has some wonderful restaurants, cafes and some great wineries to walk to, too. We have 4 apartments to choose from, 2 downstairs offering their own enclosed rear courtyards and 2 upstairs with balconies overlooking the garden and swimming pool. Complimentary Wi-Fi
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Valley is a beautiful community of people.
transit: we can arrange our award winning tours along with airport transfers and pickup from Adelaide CBD for an extra charge
access: Complimentary Wi-Fi and access to swimming pool, walk to shops, cafes and wineries and brewery, also access to our facilities of arranging our award winning tours to complete the package. We can also arrange onsite relaxation massages. We also have a strict No Party Policy no access to the swimming pool area after 9pm and not to be used by people who are not paying guests to Barossa Dreams and Barossa Valley Apartments. We are located in a neighbourhood and need to respect our community with excessive noise levels.
interaction: We also operate our own award winning tours of the Barossa, Adelaide Hills, Clare, McLaren Vale and Adelaide, so we love to help our guests organise special touring options. We can also organise wine tours, restaurant transfers and airport transfers. Also advising travellers on local restaurants, cafes and attractions.
house_rules: We have a no party policy and please respect the conditions and times for the swimming pool area for the comfort of all guests.
host_about: love travel, love creating wonderful experiences, love wine, love food, love my 3 children

name: Gawler River Farm B and B.
summary: The comfortable, stylish, large one bedroom apartment is situated on a working sheep farm. Enjoy country life, night stars, birds at dawn. 30 min. to the Barossa Valley, 60 min. Clare Valley, 40 min. Adelaide CBD. 10 min. Gawler Gliding club.
space: Experience a country stay. Beautiful country outlooks, no traffic noise, clean fresh air. Very comfortable for 3 adults, with a Queen double and a single bed. Also a three seater lounge and en suite bathroom. A cot is available on request for  small children.
description: The comfortable, stylish, large one bedroom apartment is situated on a working sheep farm. Enjoy country life, night stars, birds at dawn. 30 min. to the Barossa Valley, 60 min. Clare Valley, 40 min. Adelaide CBD. 10 min. Gawler Gliding club. Experience a country stay. Beautiful country outlooks, no traffic noise, clean fresh air. Very comfortable for 3 adults, with a Queen double and a single bed. Also a three seater lounge and en suite bathroom. A cot is available on request for  small children. Guest have access to the garden and veranda areas. Tea, coffee and continental breakfast is provided. In room fridge facilities. Microwave, Kettle and toaster. Washing machine available upon request. We live nearby and will be available to provide information and assistance if required. Tours of the farm and sheep viewing may be available if requested. The Gawler River area is the closest flat farming area to Adelaide. Studded with gum trees the farm land is park like. The view to the East is
neighborhood_overview: The Gawler River area is the closest flat farming area to Adelaide. Studded with gum trees the farm land is park like. The view to the East is of the blue Mt Lofty ranges sweeping round to the Barossa Valley.
notes: We are centrally placed to Adelaide, Virginia and the Barossa Valley, Clare Valley wine areas. Angle Vale, Gawler and Two  Wells are our nearest towns. The Gawler Gliding club is nearby for flights and training.
transit: A car is required, although metropolitan trains run from Gawler (10kms away) to Adelaide CBD. We are situated 3km from the Northern Expressway. Parking is available at the apartment. Space is available for a trailer or caravan. Adelaide airport is 45min. by car.
access: Guest have access to the garden and veranda areas. Tea, coffee and continental breakfast is provided. In room fridge facilities. Microwave, Kettle and toaster. Washing machine available upon request.
interaction: We live nearby and will be available to provide information and assistance if required. Tours of the farm and sheep viewing may be available if requested.
house_rules: Guests are expected to behave quietly as other people and animals live nearby. Pets are not allowed. Smoking is not permitted in the apartment.
host_about:
We are a farming couple. Our farm runs stud sheep and we grow cereal crops. Having lived in Gawler River all our lives we have a detailed knowledge of the area, its history and attractions.
We enjoy traveling, meeting people and have many friends around the world. Especially through our long involvement with Rotary Youth Exchange.

name: The Miners Cottage Barossa Valley
summary: The Miners Cottage is beautifully restored with modern comforts and old world charm. Open fire, gorgeous bathroom, comfy bed, peace and quiet, sleeps two. The Miners Barn, right next to the cottage, can be added to your booking to sleep an extra two people. Beautiful views from every aspect.  A booking for four will be in two seperate cottages- two in the Miners Cottage and two in the Barn. They are right next to each other.
space: The Miners Cottage - sleeps 2. Beautiful stone cottage with one bedroom, open fireplace, sitting room and kitchenette. Modern bathroom with claw foot bath, double shower, underfloor heating and heated towel rail.  Deep back veranda overlooks the pool and winter creek. Lovely red gum outdoor table for eating meals. BBQ & outdoor heater. Also have access to the full kitchen and TV sitting room in the Barn The Miners Cottage Barn - sleeps 2. Old timber on the outside, modern on the inside. One bedroom with ensuite shower, (use toilet in cottage bathroom). Full kitchen facilities - oven, gas hot plates,  dishwasher, Nespresso coffee machine, TV.  Breakfast provisions included for cooked and continental breakfast, linen, towels and other luxury extras also included. A fold out bed or portacot is available.  There is only room to fit one child in the cottage.  Small inside dogs (under 15kg) are permitted with prior approval. We do ask that they don't go on the furniture or bedding.  If you k

One bedroom with ensuite shower, (use toilet in cottage bathroom). Full kitchen
neighborhood_overview: Set in rural surrounds on the edge of the Barossa, 7 mins to Lyndoch, 10 mins to Gawler, 15 mins to Tanunda, 30 mins to Angaston.  Tour the wineries, visit the farmers market, eat out, ride the Bike trail, fossick in an antique store...
notes: The Cottage and Barn are side by side.  You can enjoy time together and also have your privacy. There is no Wifi available. Telstra service is great but Optus service is patchy
transit: Local tour companies Taxi
access: Access to pool and Cabana. On 18 acres, lovely walks
interaction: Rebecca is usually on hand to greet guests and and answer questions as needed.
house_rules: Small dogs under 14kg are welcome. We ask that they do not go on the beds or furniture. Guests are required to clean up after their dogs inside and out. An additional $50 pet cleaning charge will apply. No Smoking
host_about: Rebecca lives on the property with her husband and their 3 children.  They have a dog, cat, chooks, a duck and a few pet sheep.  Chances are you'll enjoy eggs fresh from the henhouse when you stay at The Miners Cottage!

name: ~ Tranquil Private Room ~
summary: Our tranquil setting will have you relaxed the moment you arrive. With a five-minute walk in to the main street of Angaston, you have on your door step all that this beautiful little village has to offer. You will require a car to view the sights further a far, or you can hire a bike, scooter or trike within the Barossa to add to your adventure. Your private room consists of a comfortable queen bed, and shared use of our bathroom, kitchen, dining and lounge area.
space: This is a very quiet relaxing space, your room has a comfortable queen size bed. You are close to the town, that consists of many cafes, restaurants and an IGA Foodland. We ask that you do not use our kitchen space for cooking meals. Should you require to purchase any food, you are welcome to keep it in our shared fridge.
description: Our tranquil setting will have you relaxed the moment you arrive. With a five-minute walk in to the main street of Angaston, you have on your door step all that this beautiful little village has to offer. You will require a car to view the sights further a far, or you can hire a bike, scooter or trike within the Barossa to add to your adventure. Your private room consists of a comfortable queen bed, and shared use of our bathroom, kitchen, dining and lounge area. This is a very quiet relaxing space, your room has a comfortable queen size bed. You are close to the town, that consists of many cafes, restaurants and an IGA Foodland. We ask that you do not use our kitchen space for cooking meals. Should you require to purchase any food, you are welcome to keep it in our shared fridge. You have your own private room with basic amenities. You have access to our living area, dining area, kitchen area and bathroom areas. Should you wish to utilise our washing machine this can be done by prior
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet and open estate with lovely elderly neighbours, and we ask that you respect them by keeping noise to a minimum and avoid parking in their driveways. You will be provided with your own car parking space. There is no smoking in or around our home, although if you do require to smoke you will be required to do this away from the homes and estate.
transit: We have very little public transport in the Barossa Valley. You will require a car to get around. Taxi's are available at certain times. There is access to bike hire, scooter hire or trike hire should you wish to book this yourself. I do have a standard ladies bike here that you are welcome to use anytime. (We have road safety rules in SA and helmets are required when cycling. The helmet is in laundry).
access: You have your own private room with basic amenities. You have access to our living area, dining area, kitchen area and bathroom areas. Should you wish to utilise our washing machine this can be done by prior arrangement. You will be provided with your own parking space. Please note that I enjoy using essential oils, candles and occasionally incense...These can bring some strong smells that do not agree with everyone. Should you wish to book and you may be sensitive to essential oils, please be mindful of this.
interaction: We generally will be home during your stay although I do travel and will be away most weekends if you are staying at that time. You have contact to myself if needed, and a family member that will be feeding our cat will not be far away from town should you require their assistance. If I am here I am happy to provide as much information as possible and interact with you or give you as much space as you require. We are a very quiet family, so this is a very quiet space.
house_rules: This is a family home with a young child. We ask that you be mindful with respectful behaviour at all times. We ask that there are no parties or late noisy evenings with no additional guests unless it is a prior arrangement with the host. We have our beautiful, friendly cat Jester that resides with us, and you may at times require to let him in or out, if you are going in and out, if we are out and about town. We live in a quiet and open estate with lovely elderly neighbours, and we ask that you respect them by keeping noise to a minimum and avoid parking in their driveways. You will be provided with your own car parking space. There is no smoking in or around our home, although if you do require to smoke you will be required to do this away from the homes and estate.
host_about: I have a passion for self-discovery, following my heart, being inspired and meeting new people and going to new and beautiful places.

name: Barossa Peppertree Cottage - Stockwell
summary: Magically set on just under half an acre of glorious gardens in the hub of the Barossa Valley, our heritage listed cottage promises a comfortable luxurious visit. With a minimum stay of 3 nights and no maximum set, the opportunities are endless. This stunning home offers 4 main rooms including a king bedroom, queen bedroom, country kitchen with all the modern conveniences and large living/dining room with everything you need for a truly enjoyable holiday or relocation.
space: Whether you are relocating or after a well needed rest, look no further. As you walk into the cottage you can't help but feel that home away from home warmth which you will never want to end. You will have a wonderful sense of seclusion, but with the main town of Nuriootpa being only a 5 minute drive away and Angaston only a couple of minutes more, everything you may need is at your doorstep.   The rate covers provisions for continental breakfast, toiletries, the use of all linen including towels, bedding and robes and a full service/clean of the cottage and gardens every Friday. We have your entertainment needs covered with FREE unlimited wifi and an abundance of dvds, games, books and magazines. Relax while taking in the many beautiful bird species under the covered bbq area as you sip wine by the outside fireplace. Or take a stroll through the glorious secluded gardens and watch the fish entertain as they all come up for a welcome hello. Magical is the only way to truly explain the
description: Magically set on just under half an acre of glorious gardens in the hub of the Barossa Valley, our heritage listed cottage promises a comfortable luxurious visit. With a minimum stay of 3 nights and no maximum set, the opportunities are endless. This stunning home offers 4 main rooms including a king bedroom, queen bedroom, country kitchen with all the modern conveniences and large living/dining room with everything you need for a truly enjoyable holiday or relocation. Whether you are relocating or after a well needed rest, look no further. As you walk into the cottage you can't help but feel that home away from home warmth which you will never want to end. The rate covers provisions for continental breakfast, toiletries, the use of all linen including towels, bedding and robes and a
neighborhood_overview: Stockwell is a quiet and friendly town with a lot of history. From the local church built in 1904 to the once popular Stockwell Hotel, there is a lot to discover about this quaint interesting little town.
transit: Nuriootpa is only a 5 minute drive away and Angaston a couple of minutes more making everything easily accessible. You will find a lot of information in the cottage regarding transport, tours, places of interest and near by facilities.
access: The entire home/cottage itself with surrounding gardens is yours to enjoy. There is ample off-road parking.
interaction: We look forward to a meet and greet upon our guests arrival to ensure a well informed stay and will be available anytime for queries by phone.
house_rules: As well as our absolutely no pets policy, Barossa Peppertree Cottage is firmly non smoking accommodation and a cleaning fee of $200 will be charged if smoking inside the cottage is noted. Smoking outside the cottage is fine and ashtrays are provided in obvious areas. We take pride in our beautiful cottage but are fully aware that accidents do happen. If damage does take place within Barossa Peppertree Cottage estate, an appropriate fee will be charged. Cleanliness is important so our guests have the most comfortable stay, with this in mind it is up to you as guests to leave the property in a reasonably neat condition including bbq cleaned after use and dishes washed and put away. If extra cleaning is needed following your departure, a fee of $60 will be charged.

name: Trinity Cottage -  amazing vineyard views
summary: With magnificent views over the vines your cottage has queensize bedrooms, a spacious lounge room with open wood fire, large eat in country kitchen, bathroom with a 2-person spa bath you cottage has ducted cooling plus reverse cycle air conditioning.
space: It's a simple worker's cottage but the attention to detail will enthrall you - and the view - it's mind blowing!
description: With magnificent views over the vines your cottage has queensize bedrooms, a spacious lounge room with open wood fire, large eat in country kitchen, bathroom with a 2-person spa bath you cottage has ducted cooling plus reverse cycle air conditioning. It's a simple worker's cottage but the attention to detail will enthrall you - and the view - it's mind blowing! Your self contained cottage has lounge, two queen bedrooms, country kitchen, spa bathroom and laundry facilities. There are wonderful outdoor nooks for relaxation Your hosts live close by on the same property (500 metres away). They will meet you on arrival but leave you to enjoy the peace and tranquility. They are there if you need them. This is a spot to unwind and relax - your cottage is close to great restaurants and the best Barossa wineries - and the Barossa Farmer's Market is just down the road ion Saturday mornings Drive yourself or check out Barossa Taste Sensations for a personal chauffeur driven tour - tell them you a
neighborhood_overview: This is a spot to unwind and relax - your cottage is close to great restaurants and the best Barossa wineries - and the Barossa Farmer's Market is just down the road ion Saturday mornings
notes: Trinity Cottage is part of the Cottages4u group. Cottages4u is a group of long standing BnB cottage operators who have a proven track record in the local industry.  Established in 1997, the group understand what our guests are looking for and provide the best value for money, with an emphasis on Cleanliness, Quality and Facilities.  You can trust these establishments to provide the best local experience.  Two night minimum at all times - three or four on long weekends, Barossa Events or Easter
transit: Drive yourself or check out Barossa Taste Sensations for a personal chauffeur driven tour - tell them you are staying at Trinity Cottage for the best deal
access: Your self contained cottage has lounge, two queen bedrooms, country kitchen, spa bathroom and laundry facilities. There are wonderful outdoor nooks for relaxation
interaction: Your hosts live close by on the same property (500 metres away). They will meet you on arrival but leave you to enjoy the peace and tranquility. They are there if you need them.
house_rules: Trinity Cottage is strictly NO SMOKING indoors
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Lochnagar Barossa - Luxury and Space
summary: A spacious luxury self contained three bedroom three bathroom modern executive style house in a top address in Tanunda - walking distance to wineries. Air conditioned plus has log fire. Full kitchen, dining area and outdoor living.  A very generous breakfast supplies are waiting for your arrival – as is the welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Relax in the expansive gardens. Bicycles are available for guests at no additional charge. Please Note : this property is NOT suitable for children
space: Every bedroom has an en-suite bathroom, each with underfloor heating in winter. The master en-suite also has a two-person spa bath. The generous living areas create an ambiance of space and privacy. You have full access to the whole house (except the wine cellar) Lochnagar Barossa is fully appointed. It lacks nothing, with a comprehensive supply of kitchen appliances, cooking utensils, plates, glasses, cupboards and drawers filled with all you need. All bed linen and toweling are great quality ensuring total comfort for your stay.  The furniture and large beds are modern and comfortable, and with the ducted a/c this creates a relaxing ambience for tasting the fabulous Barossa wines and delicacies you’ve discovered while out exploring. There is a double garage for two cars plus a large gas BBQ and a selection of garden furniture is ready for use in the very large private garden to the back and side of the property. These is even six bicycles, all serviced and ready for use by guests. Th

notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience Two night minimum at all times - three or four on long weekends, Barossa Events or Easter
transit: For 20 years I operated Barossa Vintage Tours - but have retired my Chrysler. We recommend Jonathon from Barossa Taste Sensations as your personal tour operator of choice - tell him Kim referred you
access: The whole of the property is available for use (except the wine cellar!) This is possibly the best appointed, and value for money, luxury holiday accommodation in the Barossa – if not tell us what is missing and we will remedy it for your next visit.
interaction: Your  host in Tanunda is Tammey. She does not live on site but is available by phone if required. She lives ten minutes away.

name: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm
summary: If you long for a quiet retreat away from the crowds and close to nature, Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm could be for you. Perched on the hills above the North Para River in the south eastern ranges of the Barossa, you will be serenaded with the tweets from native birds, bleets from lambs and mesmerised by stunning sunrises and sunsets. When the riches of local food and wine are needed, wineries, markets, cheese shops, cafe's and restaurants are just a 10 minute drive.
space: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is a fully-furnished, cosy log cabin on 10 acres located in the Barossa Valley between Angaston and picturesque Eden Valley. The property has a dam, a small flock of resident sheep and a modest crop of raspberries plants.  The Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is perched on ‘Mount McKenzie’, located on the eastern edge of the Barossa Valley in the sub-region of Eden Valley famous for its Riesling. Due to the elevation of the property, there are stunning views of surrounding rolling hills, grazing land and neighbouring vineyards. Sunset is not to be missed.  The beauty of Mt McKenzie is location. It is situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley but offers the privacy and independence of a rural property.  There is an abundance of bird life, from Blue Wrens, Cockatoos, Adelaide Rosella's and migratory Swallows. Our cabin is located high on the banks of the North Para with tree canopy at eye-level. Mobs of Kangaroos are also regular visitors.  The region is known as t

neighborhood_overview: The beauty of Mt McKenzie is location. Close to all the facilities that the Barossa Valley offers while giving privacy and independence of a rural property.
transit: This property is in rural South Australia. You will need a car to get there. If you don't want to drive to wineries and restaurants, local taxi and private bus services are available for booking. Details are in the house
access: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm has a spacious log cabin with a double bedroom,  bathroom, modern kitchen and undercover parking.
interaction: We love to meet all guests on arrival however we also understand most guests like to get into the house and plan their stay, this is when we leave. For help and questions regarding our property or the Barossa Valley we are a phone call or message away.
house_rules: Water is precious in country Australia. Please use water wisely with short showers.  Water at Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is from rainfall. We do not recommend drinking tap water without boiling. Spring water is supplied for drinking.  Mt McKenzie is located in rural South Australia. Bush fires are a real risk in our summer months. Fires are not allowed  ( open, heaters) at Mt McKenzie during the period 1 November to 30 April Smoking is not allowed in the house or on property  The house is ideal for 4-6 guests. We do not accept bookings of greater than 6 guests.

name: Views for miles from your own vineyard cottage
summary: Serenity, privacy, space & beauty. Tarrah Mhor is an organic farm in the picturesque Barossa Ranges  - Self contained, fully renovated c. 1924 cottage with modern amenities - Overlooking our 100 year old vineyard - Extensive gardens - Ten to fifteen minute drive to Barossa towns - Easy reach of wineries, restaurants & Farmer's Markets - Breakfast provisions supplied - King size beds  - Fast speed internet - Air conditioning -  Wood heater in winter - 49" Smart TV with Netflix - Off road parking
space: The house is exclusively yours throughout your stay. Ideal for groups of friends, couples & families with older children (7 yrs & over).  Featuring three large bedrooms, two with king & one with queen-size beds. If you are seeking to escape to a peaceful & private setting, from which to explore the Barossa region then this an ideal base for you. We are two minutes drive to the nearest winery cellar door & twelve to fifteen minutes to Barossa townships. Surrounded by vineyards, our organic farm has uninterrupted views.   Features include:  - quality linen  - down quilts. -  air conditioning   - electric blankets   Lounge-room: -  Sofas which convert into beds if needed. - Wood-fired heater   - Smart TV with Netflix  Kitchen: - fully equipped with modern  appliances - gas stove-top  - electric oven - dishwasher  -cooking utensils.  We provide supplies for a continental breakfast - muesli, fruit juice, bread & a range of teas & coffee.  Bathroom:  - walk-in shower - heater  - towels - sha
description: Serenity, privacy, space & beauty. Tarrah Mhor is an organic farm in the picturesque Barossa Ranges  - Self contained, fully renovated c. 1924 cottage with modern amenities - Overlooking our 100 year old vineyard - Extensive gardens - Ten to fifteen minute drive to Barossa towns - Easy reach of wineries, restaurants & Farmer's Markets - Breakfast provisions supplied - King size beds  - Fast speed internet - Air conditioning -  Wood heater in winter - 49" Smart TV with Netflix - Off road parking The house is exclusively yours throughout your stay. Ideal for groups of friends, couples & families with older children (7 yrs & over).  Featuring three large bedrooms, two with king & one with queen-size beds. If you are seeking to escape to a peaceful & private setting, from which to explore the Barossa region then this an ideal base for you. We are two minutes drive to the nearest winery cellar door & twelve to fifteen minutes to Barossa townships. Surrounded by vineyards, our organic farm h
neighborhood_overview: We are two minutes drive from the nearest boutique winery, Flaxman Wines. A TWELVE to FIFTEEN minute drive takes you to the Barossa townships of Tanunda and Angaston; ideal starting points for exploring wineries, restaurants, cafes, art galleries and boutique shops.   Nearby Kaiser Stuhl Conservation Park (a 5 minute drive away) has excellent walking trails & is home to an abundance of Australian native wildlife.   Menglers Hill Lookout (a five minute drive) is an ideal spot to take in the view across the valley floor. Tanunda and Nuriootpa have large supermarkets and all three townships have excellent bakeries, butchers, cafes, pubs, and shops.
notes: As Tarrah Mhor is a working farm, from time to time there will be someone around the place, tending to the livestock, the vineyard & our small winery. For safety reasons, we only accept children over seven years of age. There is a fishpond close to the cottage, which may pose a safety hazard. There is one bathroom/toilet.  In cooler months wood is provided for the slow combustion heater & the bedrooms have radiators.  Please use power & water with respect to the environment & to help keep our accommodation cost low, ie,  turn off air conditioning while you are out. .
transit: Your own vehicle is best. Local wine tour operator's provide pick-up/drop off service to the house. Barossa Bike Hire is another great way to see the valley. Please feel free to ask for contact details.
access: You are welcome to wander through the garden & vineyard or light the outdoor fire-pit (May - October).
interaction: We'll be here to greet you on arrival, to show you through and make sure you have everything you need.   I remain contactable by mobile throughout your stay. Please ask me if you'd like recommendations regarding places to eat, cellar door tastings, walking & bike trails.  A house manual, tourist maps & local information are provided for your use.
house_rules: We aim to leave a light footprint & so a few basic rules apply. WATER: Water is precious in country Australia & the cottage relies solely on rainfall. Please help conserve our precious resource by using carefully. For this reason, the washing machine only available to guests staying a minimum of three nights. There are some rocky areas with steep drops around the property. Please take care with small children. BUSHFIRE SAFETY: Local regulations state NO FIRES, indoors or out, during fire ban season (mid November to April). RECYCLING: Please separate plastic, glass & paper from general rubbish, using the bins provided. Details are in the house manual. Please refrain from smoking inside. Dispose of cigarette ends in the container provided by the back door. We love this special place and trust you will treat it respectfully. Thanks.
host_about:
Tarrah Mhor has been home for the past eighteen years and we  now take the opportunity to offer this lovely space to guests.
We embrace the Barossa's famous food and wine culture; growing organic produce, cooking, maintaining the small, estate vineyard & making our own wine are among favourite pastimes. 
With a background in the wine industry, I'm happy to share my local knowledge with guests & offer cellar door & restaurant recommendations.
We have a passion for nature & a commitment to restoring habitat for native wildlife, reflected in the property's large garden and ongoing revegetation projects. 
We love the Barossa's physical beauty, lifestyle and sense of community.
Avid travellers, we welcome guests from all over to share and experience this beautiful part of the world.

name: Great Location @ "The Shed"
summary: At first glance, yes it's a shed. But explore further and you will find an unique Aussie experience, a fully functional self contained room. Shower, toilet and kitchenette. All private and seperate from our house. It's normally used for overnighters by family and friends. Please be open minded in your expectations, it's not the Ritz, Hilton, Taj Mahal but what it is clean, tidy, private affordable accomadation. Single or couple.
space: For the cost and facilities available here you won't find much better value. Its not the Taj Mahal but its clean tidy and compact. Queen bed. Designed for a couple or single person. Room is insulated with reverse split air conditioning. (ignore the old in wall aircon in photo)

neighborhood_overview: Our residence is in a quiet street. We have lived at the same address for over 20yrs. We have a very safe neighbourhood and we have a good relationship with our neighbour's.
notes: A continental style breakfast is supplied Toaster& kettle Hot plate and frypan for your use. If you are looking for a dinning experience the Barossa is home to a number of 5 star restaurants. Appellations, Fino at Seppeltsfield, Ferment Asian, and Hentley Farm. Bookings are essential. All are no more than a 10min drive from our home. Maggie Beers farm shop is a short drive from our accommodation of around five minutes.
transit: Our property is only a short stroll to the town centre. A laundromat is also in the town centre. There is a taxi service and a bus is available daily to and from Adelaide.
access: The floor plan shows the area which is yours during your stay. As shown this room is part of a shed for which there is an access door but this is locked when the room is in use. The room is fully insulated with air conditioning.
interaction: We are sociable but still like to give our guests privacy as required. I have lived all my life in the Barossa so have a good knowledge of the area. We don't have pets and if you smoke please do so outside. No smoking what so ever in any of the rooms.
house_rules: Smoking is fine but under no circumstances within the room. This is our place of residence and with that in mind no other guests shall be allowed without our consent.
host_about:
My wife and I regard ourselves as very sociable people. I myself am an avid home brewer and love fine wine and social gatherings. Married since 1992 and have two teenage kids. Born and lived in the Barossa all my life with strong family ties and local knowledge. I work within the wine industry. Enjoy open air concerts, having been to numerous "Day On The Green" concerts. Love all types of music 80's to current day trends.
I have a favourite saying, 
"We are on this planet for a good time not a long time"

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury  Vineyard Cottage S Australia
summary: Beautiful cottage facing vineyard.  French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park on our estate. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included. Tennis court is available to all guests at our cottages.
space: A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Surrounded by beautiful vineyard and surrounding Barossa ranges. You have your own spa and shower, fully equipped  kitchen, lounge room and front verandah to enjoy the views.
description: Beautiful cottage facing vineyard.  French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included. Tennis court is available to all guests at our cottages. A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate.
notes: Coffee ( Nespresso ) and tea is provided.

name: Winemakers Retreat Heart of Barossa Valley
summary: A beautiful bright, airy, spacious, private retreat in the Heart of the Barossa Valley, Walk to wineries. Perfect oasis from a day at the wineries. A home away from home, comfortable sofas, polished timber floors, wifi, pillowtop beds, white linen  & lush gardens. CHECKOUT OUR OTHER PROPERTY LISTINGS! Gorgeous Barossa Awaits!!

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
summary: Set on 6 private acres of manicured gardens, our Seppeltsfield Road property has amazing views across Shiraz vines from the 6 person spa and plenty of room to roam in the orchid, wineries just over the road or create a feast in the wood fired oven.
space: When you arrive, you will love, love, love the home... it is so relaxing and casual you will not want to leave
description: Set on 6 private acres of manicured gardens, our Seppeltsfield Road property has amazing views across Shiraz vines from the 6 person spa and plenty of room to roam in the orchid, wineries just over the road or create a feast in the wood fired oven. When you arrive, you will love, love, love the home... it is so relaxing and casual you will not want to leave We do have a refundable bond prior to access.  As you can appreciate you have the entire home to yourself, hence the bond. Please give me a call if you require anything.  We can orgainize an interactive pizza evening, a degustation dinner or stock the pantry if requested. Everything is very close, winery 50m across the road and 150m, amazing dining experiences 3 minutes by car.  You are surrounded in the best Shiraz vineyards in the world. name: Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast
summary: Rustic double story self-contained stone cottage. Perfect for a romantic couple getaway. Centrally located within walking distance to Angaston, or a short drive to restaurants, cellar doors and all local attractions. This cottage offers the quirky, feeling of yesteryear, yet has modern conveniences to make your stay comfortable, welcoming and relaxing.   Your stay includes breakfast daily at a local cafe - Soul with Zest in Angaston. Minimum 2 night booking is required.
space: Upstairs is an air-conditioned open plan area which contains a queen four poster bed, modern kitchenette ( limited cooking facilities, small microwave, toaster & kettle). lounge and dining area.  Downstairs features stone walls and slate floors and includes a dressing room, the bathroom with separate shower, claw foot bath and separate toilet.  We include luxuries to make your stay comfortable including, bathroom toiletries (shampoo, conditioner and soap), filtered water tap, plunger coffee, a selection of quality teas and complimentary port and chocolates.
description: Rustic double story self-contained stone cottage. Perfect for a romantic couple getaway. Centrally located within walking distance to Angaston, or a short drive to restaurants, cellar doors and all local attractions. This cottage offers the quirky, feeling of yesteryear, yet has modern conveniences to make your stay comfortable, welcoming and relaxing.   Your stay includes breakfast daily at a local cafe - Soul with Zest in Angaston. Minimum 2 night booking is required. Upstairs is an air-conditioned open plan area which contains a queen four poster bed, modern kitchenette ( limited cooking facilities, small microwave, toaster & kettle). lounge and dining area.  Downstairs features stone walls and slate floors and includes a dressing room, the bathroom with separate shower, claw foot bath and separate toilet.  We include luxuries to make your stay comfortable including, bathroom toiletries (shampoo, conditioner and soap), filtered water tap, plunger coffee, a selection of quality teas
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the historic town of Penrice, you can enjoy the picturesque walk or short drive to Angastons' cafe's, restaurants, pubs and shopping district.
notes: For those looking to indulge in the best that the Barossa has to offer, you are only a short drive away from Barossa Farmer's Market (open Sat from 7.30 - 11.30am, showcasing local produce and real food from the homes and farms of the Barossa Valley) and some of the most popular wineries, restaurants and destinations in the region.
transit: We include a Barossa Valley Touring map as part of your stay. We can assist with taxi bookings if required.
access: Private entrance from the main house with off street parking. Guest parking is on left hand side of driveway next to green fence with wagon wheel. Please use the entrance via black tube gate on left hand side of property and turn right and walk down path and you will see the B&B cottage. Cottage is fitted with a key safe, so if your check-in time will be late, please let us know so we can advise the key safe code. Cottage has stairs and may not be suitable for guests with mobility limitations. Guests have access to backyard including shared courtyard.
interaction: Our information folder includes helpful ideas including local restaurants and eateries, wineries, local attractions and things to do and see in the Barossa Valley. We are happy to help with taxi and winery tour bookings for you.
house_rules: BOOKING CONDITIONS:  Non-smoking property. If evidence of smoking is detected inside property then guest/s will be charged a $200 cleaning fee. We have a "leave it as you found it" policy. Guests will be responsible to pay for any damage caused to property during their stay. Only the 2 guests on booking are permitted to use and stay in Cottage. (Including wedding guests) Property has stairs and may not be suitable for guests with mobility limitations.
host_about:
Welcome to Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast - Penrice, Barossa Valley
We are excited that you are planning a visit to the beautiful Barossa Valley
We would love to share our part of the Barossa with you and look forward to meeting you.

name: Little Para Cottage
summary: Our  cottage is hidden away in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's little - just one cosy bedroom - but in a very handy location  just up the road from iconic Tanunda wineries. It has a private garden and undercover off-street parking.
space: Our cottage is unique because it look old and rustic on the outside but inside it has a modern kitchenette and bathroom, separate lounge with two sofas, cosy furnishings and cable TV. All linen is provided. It is hidden from the road at the back of a half acre block, with vineyards just over the back fence and local wineries in walking distance. Surprisingly its also close to the main street on the edge of the township, and just a 5 minute drive to the town centre. It also has a private garden to relax in which is fully fenced. People like our cottage because it feels like a home away from home.
description: Our  cottage is hidden away in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's little - just one cosy bedroom - but in a very handy location  just up the road from iconic Tanunda wineries. It has a private garden and undercover off-street parking. Our cottage is unique because it look old and rustic on the outside but inside it has a modern kitchenette and bathroom, separate lounge with two sofas, cosy furnishings and cable TV. All linen is provided. It is hidden from the road at the back of a half acre block, with vineyards just over the back fence and local wineries in walking distance. Surprisingly its also close to the main street on the edge of the township, and just a 5 minute drive to the town centre. It also has a private garden to relax in which is fully fenced. People like our cottage because it feels like a home away from home. You have the entire cottage and garden to yourself. As hosts we are available if you need us. We respect our guests' privacy and leave you to relax
neighborhood_overview: We are on the edge of town in a residential street that feels more rural than township. Houses are on one side, and wineries and few homes on large allotments are on the other side. We are on the winery side!
notes: The cottage doesn't have a laundry but there is a laundromat in town, just a 5 minute drive away. The kitchenette is fully equipped for self catering with a fridge, oven, hotplates and microwave. The local supermarket is easily accessible and there is also a Farmers Market every Saturday.
transit: There is a local taxi service but no local bus or train passengers service. There are many tours you can book, or you can hire bikes from our visitor centre. There is plenty to do and see in walking distance of our cottage. If you have a car, every thing is easily accessible.
access: You have the entire cottage and garden to yourself.
interaction: As hosts we are available if you need us. We respect our guests' privacy and leave you to relax and enjoy our location!
house_rules: - Note only small dog breeds are accepted - no large dogs sorry. - Usual check-out time is 10am - Relax and make yourselves at home - Treat the cottage as you would your own home - turn lights and appliances off when you are out for the day - Relax and enjoy our location! - Do your own dishes please - Smoking outside only
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity to relax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: Elderton Wines Guest House
summary: Our Guest House is located in Nuriootpa, in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Situated a short walk from the Elderton Wines Cellar Door, this is a great base for any Barossa visit, be it wine tasting, cycling the Nuriootpa to Angaston bike track or indulging in one of the Barossa’s great eateries and restaurants. Continental breakfast provisions are provided. Also included for your stay – two bottles of Elderton wine which can be enjoyed in our Riedel glassware.
space: The Elderton Guest House offers three large bedrooms, able to accommodate up to six people comfortably one room contains a king bed, one room a queen bed and one room contains two single beds. The Guest House has reverse cycle air conditioning throughout, making it cosy in winter and beautifully cool in the summer. The kitchen/dining offers a full kitchen, including oven and cooktop, microwave, dishwasher, fridge and sink. Continental breakfast provisions are provided, including Jersey Fresh milk, a selection of cereals (including a gluten free cereal), locally baked bread, spreads, fresh fruit, South Australian juice, selected teas and Barossa Coffee Roasters fresh beans. Also included for your stay – two bottles of Elderton wine which can be enjoyed in our Riedel glassware. The separate lounge offers comfortable seating and a flat screen television. The wet areas comprise of a bathroom with shower, bath, and toilet, plus an additional separate toilet and fully equipped laundry. The G

neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the Barossa experience! Elderton Guest House is ideally located within a short walking distance of: Barossa Distillery Provenance Barossa Linke’s Central Meat Store – fifth generation butcher and smokehouse Stein’s Tap House Penfolds Cellar Door Barossa Bush Gardens Nuriootpa to Angaston Bike Trail Barossa Farmers Market Ember Pizza House Barossa Co-Op Fresh Supermarket Steiny’s Traditional Mettwurst Vine Inn Barossa Community Hotel Angas Park Hotel Vintners Bar & Grill Linke’s Bakehouse The townships of Angaston & Tanunda are only a short 10 minute drive away.
transit: Onsite parking available. A bus travels around the Barossa and to Adelaide most days. More i (Email hidden by Airbnb)
access: Whole house and most of yard
interaction: Our Cellar Door is open every day, and will be your point of contact for: - tips on where to eat, things to do, wineries to visit etc - local contact information - maps of the area Our Cellar Door is about a 1 minute walk from the Guest House.
house_rules: Check in after 2pm, check out before 10am. Continental breakfast provisions provided. Mid stay service provided for stays of 6 nights or more. The Lodge is strictly a non-smoking premise inside the building. If evidence of smoking is detected, a cleaning fee will be charged to the Guest. We realise accidents happen, but any wilful damage will be charged to the Guest. Strictly a NO PARTY Policy.
host_about: Elderton Wines is a small, family-owned winery, situated in Nuriootpa, in the heart of Australia’s Barossa Valley. Established by Lorraine and Neil Ashmead in 1982 the winery is now managed by the second generation of the Ashmead family, brothers Cameron and Allister. The Ashmead family have enjoyed hosting many visitors over the years, and now offer Guest House accommodation to the public.

name: Cosy 2-bedroom Cottage in the heart of the Barossa
summary: Lovely vineyard views as well as a convenient, central Barossa Valley location. Veritas Cottage is a recently renovated, fully self-contained cottage with loads of character and furnished with unique retro pieces.  It's a private home owned and operated by winemaker, Rolf Binder and partner, Cynthia. An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping.
space: What's special about our place?? 1. The location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Privacy 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & look for kangaroos on the top of the hill around dusk!
description: Lovely vineyard views as well as a convenient, central Barossa Valley location. Veritas Cottage is a recently renovated, fully self-contained cottage with loads of character and furnished with unique retro pieces.  It's a private home owned and operated by winemaker, Rolf Binder and partner, Cynthia. An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. What's special about our place?? 1. The location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Privacy 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & look for kangaroos on the top of the hill around dusk! Staying at Veritas Cottage means you will have great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery, Peter Lehmann, David Franz, Rieslingfreak and M
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
notes: If particularly interested in wine, we love to also show guests around our winery during their stay. Drop in for a wine tasting & we'll give you 15% off any wine purchase of 6+ bottles during your stay.
transit: There isn't great access to public transport in the Barossa Valley so most visitors drive.  There is a train from Adelaide to Gawler & then bus to Tanunda. Guests can hire bikes from the Visitor Information Centre or use local taxis.
access: Staying at Veritas Cottage means you will have great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery, Peter Lehmann, David Franz, Rieslingfreak and Michael Hall Wines are all within walking distance. Our winery (Rolf Binder) is just 1.6 km north on the same road as the Cottage. - Tanunda shopping, cafes & restaurants - 2.3 km - Bike trails (rental bike drop off is available) - Seppeltsfield Road Scenic Drive - 2 km - Maggie Beer's Farm Shop and The Eatery Restaurant - 2.5 km
interaction: We leave interaction up to guests! We live 100M away on the same property & would love to share a coffee or a glass of wine over a chat but certainly don't want to intrude on any guest's privacy. We encourage guests to wander the extensive property as much as they'd like to. Plenty of wildlife and birdlife to enjoy. The sunsets are also fabulous!
house_rules: We ask that guests respect our property & leave it in the same condition at departure. If you have a booking for 2 guests, please be aware that we consider that use of one bedroom only.  If you do require the second bedroom, an additional cleaning/laundry fee of $50 will be charged.
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle with any 2 night stay! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: The Sculptors Shed
summary: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyard and just a stroll away from the Barossa Farmers Market.  This private room is separate to the main house, situated in the families back yard.  The Sculptors shed is a small, simple room with the basics on hand.  It is clean, warm, modern and comfortable all year round and a perfect place to rest your head while exploring the Barossa during the day.
space: The room is part of a shed in the garden of local metal sculptor, Tony Howard.  It is separate to the main house, looks out onto the garden and backs onto vineyard.  A family of 5 live in the house and therefore children may be playing in the backyard, near the room on occasion.
description: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyard and just a stroll away from the Barossa Farmers Market.  This private room is separate to the main house, situated in the families back yard.  The Sculptors shed is a small, simple room with the basics on hand.  It is clean, warm, modern and comfortable all year round and a perfect place to rest your head while exploring the Barossa during the day. The room is part of a shed in the garden of local metal sculptor, Tony Howard.  It is separate to the main house, looks out onto the garden and backs onto vineyard.  A family of 5 live in the house and therefore children may be playing in the backyard, near the room on occasion. The room has it's own ensuite bathroom and you also have access to a basic kitchenette in the shed next door.  The kitchen is not fancy and we don't provide any food but it has everything you should need if you wish to use it. Please note- you need to walk outside to get into the kitchen in the shed.
neighborhood_overview: We are smack bang in the middle of the Barossa Valley on the Valley floor, a short stroll from the famous Barossa Farmers Market, that runs every Saturday morning, and walking distance to one of the Barossa's top restaurants, Vintners Bar and Grill.  We are also very close to the bike track that will take you into Angaston, Nuriootpa and now all they way to Lyndoch.  Hundreds of cellar doors and resturants are also close by.
notes: There is Wifi available but it isn’t always strong inside the room. It is fine just outside the room where there is seating available for you to access the wifi.  This room is very private but you are in the back yard of a family home and family life - including children- will be happening around you!
transit: We have plenty of off-street parking and are situated close to the bike track that is very popular with cyclists and walkers alike. Public transport in the Barossa is limited and we are situated slightly out of town so a bike or preferably a car is essential.
access: The room has it's own ensuite bathroom and you also have access to a basic kitchenette in the shed next door.  The kitchen is not fancy and we don't provide any food but it has everything you should need if you wish to use it. Please note- you need to walk outside to get into the kitchen in the shed. There is plenty of secure, off street parking.
interaction: The family in the main house are happy to help any way we can during your stay, or you can have as much privacy as you like. We are happy to recommend local eateries, cellar doors and attractions.  The room is in a shed directly behind the main house, in the back yard of the family home, so we usually see our guests as they arrive and leave. We are happy to share our back verandah where there is outdoor seating and tables. We sometimes like to sit on our back verandah for a drink and the kids like to play outside so there may be people and chatter outside the room on occasion.
house_rules: No smoking inside. Please turn off air conditioner/heater and lights when you leave the room.
host_about: Food and wine lovers that love being surrounded by family and friends and meeting new people

name: Vineyard Cottage - Under the Vines
summary: Under the Vines is a self contained cottage in five acres of vineyard and native bushland, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region. Every window has a vineyard view! (This accommodation is also available with 2 bathrooms)
space: The cottage has 2 Kingsize bedrooms (1 can be split into singles) so your Barossa stay can be accommodated in comfort and convenience. Both bedrooms have reverse-cycle air-conditioning and TV with DVD player, and are set up with quality linen, doonas, mink blankets and pillow options. The spacious living area  - with comfy sofas, beanbag, cushions and snuggly blanket - is set up with complimentary Wi-Fi and Netflix, a large smart TV, PlayStation & Blu-ray DVD. The bathroom has a huge double shower and luxurious two-person spa, and a generous selection of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscreen TV/DVD (viewed from the spa). The kitchen has full facilities - oven, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher and coffee machine, and and a great range of regional provisions included for breakfast/brunch. Reverse-cycle aircondioning and a cosy wood fire provide heating and cooling whatever the season. Outdoor furniture settings on the return verandah accommodates the vi

Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region. Every window has a vineyard view! (This accommodation is also available with 2 bathrooms) The cottage has 2 Kingsize bedrooms (1 can be split into singles) so your Barossa stay can be accommodated in comfort and convenience. Both bedrooms have reverse-cycle air-conditioning and TV with DVD player, and are set up with quality linen, doonas, mink blankets and pillow options. The bathroom has a huge double shower and luxurious two-person spa, and a generous selection of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscre
neighborhood_overview: Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself! The Barossa Valley offers many unique and rich experiences - food, wine, culture, heritage. Allow time to immerse yourself in some of these....and then come back again for another bite!
notes: Local produce for a country style breakfast Quality linen and towels provided Complimetary WiFi TV/DVD/Playstation/Netflix Combustion heater R/C Airconditioning Laundry facilities BBQ / Outdoor furniture / Gas heater Earth friendly bathroom products Cot and highchair available on request
access: The cottage is yours to enjoy exclusively, along with the 5 acres of vineyard and native bushland. Multiple outdoor furniture settings on the return verandah and around the property provide great options and accommodate the views from every angle, and a portable gas heater, bbq and brazier provide extra outdoor options, weather permitting! If you visit during vintage season (late February - April) you might get a job picking grapes, helping out in the vineyard or doing some winemaking!
interaction: I don't live on the property, but I'm only a few minutes away, and can be contacted by Airbnb message, phone, SMS or email during your stay if there's anything you need assistance with.
house_rules: Make yourself at home, and have a great time in the Barossa! No smoking indoors please! There are plenty of outdoor spots - please leave butts in the pots provided, and help keep our space clean. Smoking inside will incur an extra cleaning fee of $200.

name: "The Hideaway" Tanunda
summary: "The Hideaway" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. Next to the supermarket and across the road from the restaurant 1918. Everything is at your doorstep!!
space: "The Hideaway" is a lovely, spacious unit, nestled behind a unit on the main street of Tanunda, Murray Street.  Very close to everything! There is a large queen bedroom, and a small double bedroom.
description: "The Hideaway" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. Next to the supermarket and across the road from the restaurant 1918. Everything is at your doorstep!! "The Hideaway" is a lovely, spacious unit, nestled behind a unit on the main street of Tanunda, Murray Street.  Very close to everything! There is a large queen bedroom, and a small double bedroom. Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, except garage.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, milk, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed. Small bedroom with Double bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Library with books and magazines. Lounge room with TV (no Channel 2, sorry) and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels  Iron and Iro
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda lies in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination.   Tanunda is the focal point of the Barossa. With its strong European heritage, distinctive church spiers, wineries, cafés and restaurants there is plenty to see and do in the town.  "The Hideaway " is right in the centre of Tanunda. Foodland and Priceline are right next door. There are two cafes within 100m of the unit, and a hairdresser and health food shop right opposite. 1918, one of the Barossa’s finest restaurants, is also within 100m of the unit. (Website hidden by Airbnb) Tanunda is home to the Barossa Visitor Information Centre, an ideal starting point for any visit to the Barossa, located at 66-68 Murray Street (the main street) and open seven days a week (Website hidden by Airbnb) The town also boasts a number of wineries, including Peter Lehmann Wines, Langmeil, Richmond Grove, Lambert Estate and Chateau Tanunda, with its impressive bui
notes: 1) WHERE CAN I FIND OUT ABOUT WINE TOURS, WINE CELLARS ETC? The Barossa Visitors Centre is on Murray st, not very far from The Hideaway. You can either ring or visit them. Open 7 days Monday to Friday 9am-5pm Saturday 9am-4pm Sundays and Public Holidays 10am-4pm Address: 66-68 Murray St Tanunda SA 5352 2) CAN I CHECK IN EARLY AND/OR CHECK OUT LATE? CHECK-IN: 2PM  - 9PM CHECK-OUT: 10AM or anytime before. Most of the time we only have a 4 hour window in between bookings, and there's a lot of cleaning to be done. Please forgive us if we cannot accommodate requests for late check outs/early checks ins 3) IS THERE PARKING ON THE PREMISES? Please note that there is no parking available on the premises. Street parking is free and located about 30m from the unit. Please keep this in mind when travelling in the rainier months, or if you have mobility issues.  Our other property, "The Hideaway Central" does have parking available. 4) DO YOU PROVIDE BREAKFAST? Sorry, we don't offer breakfast. In
transit: You really need a car to get to the Barossa. But once you're here, if it's nice, hire a bike and take a leisurely ride along the new fabulous bike paths that have been placed all along the Barossa.  There's really not much in the way of public transport. There is a Bus to Gawler and Angaston in front of Tanunda library.
access: Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, except garage.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, milk, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed. Small bedroom with Double bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Library with books and magazines. Lounge room with TV (no Channel 2, sorry) and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels  Iron and Ironing board Foodland, Pharmacy, Newsagent and a Laundromat are a short walk away, approx. 100m distance.
interaction: Entry is via Keyless entry so there is no key hand off. After we receive your booking for The Hideaway, we send you an email with information.  We can easily be reached by mobile if you need anything :) Please enjoy your stay and make yourselves at home!
house_rules: USE OF BEDROOMS We consider each bedroom (Queen and Double) to sleep two guests. If there are two of you, but you do not wish to share a bedroom, and wish to use both bedrooms, please enquire with us and we can work out the extra charges for you.  NOISE RESTRICTIONS "The Hideaway" is a unit, and hence part of a block of units and that carries with it noise restrictions. It's  quiet at night, and the people living in the block of flats are older people who don't make any noise themselves, so if any noise is made, it really carries. During the day is fine, but we ask all our quests to be please keep all noise to a minimum after 7pm. We ask that guests wanting to book The Hideaway to please note that we can't accept check ins later than 9pm in respect to the other units.  SMOKING AND PETS No smoking and no pets thank you. CHECK IN Check-in between 2pm - 9pm (Please see NOISE RESTRICTIONS above) Check-out by 10am. PARKING We ask guests to park on the street - its free and ample. The street
