Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard. This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer. It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary. neighborhood_overview: There is a vineyard and winery cellar door directly the house.  It is a short, two block walk to the main street, supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, restaurants, Information Centre and bicycle hire.
notes: The Writer's Studio is literally at the bottom of the garden of the main house and there is plenty of street and pavement parking at the front.
transit: You will need a car, although there is a limited taxi service and there are bikes for hire.  If you don't have a car, we can arrange to pick you up from the Gawler Central railway station 25 minutes away.  There are also some good walks and walking tracks.
access: You are free to sit in the garden or the orchard. The kitchenette has a small oven, hot plate, microwave, fridge, toaster, kettle, crockery and cutlery.  If you are cooking and need specific utensils or pots, just let us know and you are welcome to borrow them from the house kitchen. Bed linen and towels are provided.
interaction: I will usually be there to welcome you, show you around and answer any questions. On the odd occasion when I can't be there, my assistant or a close friend will do the honours.  If you have questions during your stay, you can tap on the door or send a text and we will respond quickly.
host_about:
I am a full time business coach helping business owners create businesses that work for not because of them.  My clients are mainly in Australia, New Zealand and the US, and as long as time zones are compatible I can work with them from anywhere. Thanks to (Hidden by Airbnb) I have conducted my client meetings from Jaipur (India), New York, Perth, Sydney, South Australia and San Diego.
Clearly - one of the  things I can't live without is travel.
And I can't live without my Kindle - which has lightened my travel load enormously. No more books to carry and leave as I pick up more.
I love great food and wine - I live in a wine region where the two go together.
I am a great guest. Quiet, fun, a reader and a walker.
My life motto is Stride Into Life.

name: Martinsell Cottage
summary: A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables.  The cottage is set on the estate 500m from one of SA's most significant Georgian manors, 'Martinsell', built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  This is also available for accomodation of up to four guests please log in to Martinsell Manor for further details.https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387
space: There is a lovely large lounge with cosy wood heater and split system reverse cycle air conditioner and a fully equipped kitchen. The cottage is in a very peaceful country location with the closest neighbour being a kilometre away. Shower or bath in our soft  rainwater provided to the cottage, whilst  the outside taps are  supplied with spring water. No wi fi available  Horses are welcome with secure yards and plenty of parking for horse floats. Daily permits are available nearby for horse riding in the neighbouring forests. Car enthusiasts are also extremely welcome with safe and secure space for cars and trailers. Mountain bikers or road cyclists are well catered for with plenty of secure space for bikes, and great roads - the famous Menglers Hill is just over an hour's ride away with a choice of sealed or gravel roads. Mountain bike trails abound in Mt Crawford Forest, right at our doorstep.

neighborhood_overview: The Pewsey Vale area was settled by English, Scottish and German settlers. Pewsey Vale is a part of the world-famous Barossa Valley food and wine region, famous for bold red wines, delicate Pewsey Vale Rieslings, and the finest boutique foods. The Barossa and its surroundings offer a wide variety of activities from hot air ballooning to trekking, cycling, horse riding, fishing, kayaking, wine tasting and more. Closest large stores: Gawler (25min drive / 20km nth west) has a many large town facilities and services including; •Supermarket open until 9pm mon-sat •24 hr petrol station The local town of Williamstown (10min drive / 10km west) has a small general store with limited supplies and a bottle shop. We are close to the National Motor Museum in Birdwood 18km, the famous Collingrove hillclimb circuit, and some of the best driving roads in Australia,  through the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Ranges. A Barossa Valley information guide & maps are provided for your information and convenien
notes: For longer stays cleaning and linen service is available. Extra service charges apply. ***IMPORTANT*** If this listing is unavailable, you could also check one of our other properties, "Martinsell Manor". Here's a link: https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387
transit: Martinsell is approximately one hour drive from Adelaide, bordering on the edge of the Adelaide Hills, Southern Barossa, making a unique scenic driving experience. As we are approximately 10km from Williamstown and 24km from Tanunda, you will need to come by motor vehicle, bicycle, on horseback, or in good hiking boots! Unfortunately there are no buses nearby but a taxi service is available.  There are stunning views over the rolling hills which are surrounded by forests, with walking, cycling and horse trails. Adjacent to the property is the famous Heysen Trail, and the Kidman and Mawson Trails are not far away.
access: Guests have free access over the property, but we ask that guests respect our privacy as we respect theirs. We are usually happy to arrange visits through the private gardens and to look closer at the manor house on request. As we often have friendly roaming livestock we ask that gates be closed on entry or exit.
interaction: We reside in the main residence on the property, so we are always available for our guests. We can be contacted in person or by phone/text.
house_rules: Respectfully enjoy being in gorgeous Pewsey Vale (Barossa ) by looking after our cottage as well as enjoying it!  Strictly no smoking inside. Please feel free to contact us with requests or questions concernig the Barossa Valley, the nearby Historic 1901 Manor and or anything else. :) Please note:children under 2 years of age, please request. If the hosts accepts the child is counted as a guest there is a guest charge of $45
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.
street: Pewsey Vale, Barrossa Valley , SA, Australia

name: Historic home on 65 acres in top Barossa location
summary: Premium self-contained accommodation in a fantastic central location. Hanisch Haus is a recently renovated home built in 1907. Guests have full access to the entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.  An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility of the property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. Full breakfast provisions are included with a bottle of Rolf Binder wine.
space: What's special about our place? 1. The Location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Space - A lovely spacious home ideal for longer stays and especially those who like to cook and feel 'at home' when travelling. 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & enjoy the wildlife  / birdlife. Keep and eye out for kangaroos on the top of the hill around sunset! 4. Plenty of delicious breakfast provisions and a nice bottle of Rolf Binder wine included.

Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & enjoy the wildlife  / birdlife. Keep and eye out for kangaroos on the top of t
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
notes: Staying at Hanisch Haus means great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery & Peter Lehmann Wines are within walking distance. Our winery (Rolf Binder) is just 1.6km north at 185 Stelzer Road.  - Tanunda shopping, cafes & restaurants - 2.3km - Bike trails (rental bike drop off is available) - Seppeltsfield Road Scenic Drive - 2km - Maggie Beer's Farm Shop - 2.5km If particularly interested in wine, we love to also show guests around our winery during their stay. Guests also receive 15% off any wine purchase of 6+ bottles during a stay at Hanisch Haus.
transit: Unfortunately there isn't great access to public transport so most drive to the Barossa Valley. There is a train from Adelaide to Gawler & then bus to Tanunda. Guests can hire bikes from the Visitor Information Centre or Barossa Bike Hire in Nuriootpa or use local taxis to get around.
access: Guests have access to the entire house as well as outside terrace, verandah and garden.
interaction: We leave interaction up to guests! We live close by & would love to share a coffee or a glass of wine over a chat but certainly don't want to intrude on any guest's privacy.
house_rules: - Hanisch Haus is located in close proximity to Veritas Cottage B&B so we ask that guests respect the privacy & peaceful environment of this location.
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle with any 2 night stay! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: Hill House Angaston
summary: Hill House offers unique accommodation in the Barossa Valley, South Australia's world renowned wine region, overlooking the picturesque township of Angaston. Stay in 1851 the original 2-room cottage part of this outstanding historic country mansion. Ideal for couples, 1851 is a beautifully appointed suite with private access. Take advantage of the many wineries, cellar doors and award winning restaurants nearby.
description: Hill House offers unique accommodation in the Barossa Valley, South Australia's world renowned wine region, overlooking the picturesque township of Angaston. Stay in 1851 the original 2-room cottage part of this outstanding historic country mansion. Ideal for couples, 1851 is a beautifully appointed suite with private access. Take advantage of the many wineries, cellar doors and award winning restaurants nearby. We have 3 Jack Russell dogs

name: MAGNIFICENT COUNTRY VILLA - SPACIOUS & UNIQUE.
summary: Looking for the perfect place to stay in the Barossa Valley with your friends and family?  The "Coffee Palace" is an historic property with 7 bedrooms, 5 living rooms, 3.5 bathrooms and all the amenities to be self-contained.  Your elegant and spacious home in the Barossa to relax in, enjoy and share. Conveniently located in the heart of beautiful Lyndoch village, walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries.
space: The Coffee Palace provides 7 bedrooms in total, over 3 floors.   Bedroom 1 – A beautiful and spacious bedroom on the ground floor, with elegant ensuite, claw foot bathtub and dressing room.  The bed can be configured as a king or twin room. Bedroom 2 – The bed in this room can be configured as a king or twin beds.  Bathrooms for this room are on the landing, so up a few stairs and there is also a separate toilet just out on the back veranda for convenience during outdoor activities. Bedroom 3 – Another very spacious bedroom, located on the first floor.  Complete with sumptuous king size bed and access to the front balcony via a private entrance, this bedroom enjoys a small adjacent lounge room, large rear deck and small kitchenette. The bathroom for this room is shared with one other bedroom and is just across the hallway. Bedroom 4 – A very pretty bedroom with a French décor, including 2 vintage wicker, single beds.  This room shares the hallway bathroom and also has access to the kit

Your elegant and spacious home in the Barossa to relax in, enjoy and share. Conveniently located in the heart of beautiful Lyndoch village, walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries. Bedroom 3 – Another very spacious bedroom, located on the first floor.  Complete with sumptuo
neighborhood_overview: The Coffee Palace is located in the quiet town of Lyndoch which has all the necessary facilities including a general store, fine dining restaurant, hotel with dining room, cafe, bakery, butcher, hair dresser, cellar door, post office and library.  We are a very short stroll to the main street.
notes: We live about 10 minutes away, so can help out when needed. Please feel free to call if you need assistance with managing any aspect of your stay.  We may be available to help with transport for smaller parties or to assist with other travel arrangements.
transit: We are very lucky to have a bus stop almost out the front of our house, you can catch the bus either in to the Barossa townships of Tanunda, Nuriootpa or Angaston or back to Gawler.  From Gawler there is a train service to Adelaide.
access: It's all yours, 6 bedrooms, five living rooms, 3.5 bathrooms and cellar (also a bedroom) and 1400m2 of gardens.
interaction: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cat Leonard. We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places and we have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.  Julie works in the local library and has worked in the Tanunda visitors centre, so please ask if you need assistance with booking advice or help with extended holiday information. We live close by, so assistance is always at hand should you need it, but we also value your privacy, so we are happy to have as much or little contact with our guests as you are comfortable with. Your stay and experience whilst in the Barossa is our top priority.  We run our accommodation on the basis of the our own travel experiences and treat our guests as friends.
house_rules: Latest check in is at 21:00 Room Only Please be aware that we are not a party house and although we want guests to enjoy the premises, we do have neighbours and therefore ask that rowdy behaviour and excessive alcohol consumption not be indulged. We reserve the right to request the immediate removal of any guest for bad behaviour.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cats, including Leonard, Polly and Blackie (the waif who comes for breakfast). We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

name: Country Retreat on the edge of Barossa Valley
summary: Heritage home at the edge of the Barossa Valley (wine region) in the township of Mt.Pleasant with rural land behind which has sheep,cattle and an Alpaca in our paddock. We have an oval close by, walking distance to chemist, local pubs, bakeries, butchers and coffee shop. We have the best farmers market every Saturday Morning at the oval complex. Some of our land adjoining Mount Pleasant oval complex can be available for people with horses involved in equestrian events.
space: Our place is quiet and has a beautiful outlook onto the property.
description: Heritage home at the edge of the Barossa Valley (wine region) in the township of Mt.Pleasant with rural land behind which has sheep,cattle and an Alpaca in our paddock. We have an oval close by, walking distance to chemist, local pubs, bakeries, butchers and coffee shop. We have the best farmers market every Saturday Morning at the oval complex. Some of our land adjoining Mount Pleasant oval complex can be available for people with horses involved in equestrian events. Our place is quiet and has a beautiful outlook onto the property. There is an extra TV room with a game console...another space for the children to chill out, or parents retreat Guest can email through airbnb Mount pleasant is a quiet little town with about 950 people, about an hour from Adelaide, 40mins to The quaint little german township called Hahndorf, 30mins to the historic river town of Mannum, home of the first paddle steamers, we have lots of wineries within a 45min radius of us and a lovely Farmers market every
neighborhood_overview: Mount pleasant is a quiet little town with about 950 people, about an hour from Adelaide, 40mins to The quaint little german township called Hahndorf, 30mins to the historic river town of Mannum, home of the first paddle steamers, we have lots of wineries within a 45min radius of us and a lovely Farmers market every Saturday Morning where you can get the best cooked breakfast.
notes: The house has rainwater throughout, if you prefer mains water we will turn the meter on before your arrival. If you wish to use the fire pit or the wood fire pizza oven, wood will be available at an extra cost,  you can certainly bring your own wood if you prefer.
transit: You will need your own car,  but if you would like to do a wine tour around the Barossa Valley you can book a Mini Bus, they pick you up from the house and do the round trip for a price.
access: There is an extra TV room with a game console...another space for the children to chill out, or parents retreat
interaction: Guest can email through airbnb
house_rules: There is a dish washer, so they can load the dishwasher and turn it on. Thankyou  No high heels to be worn inside the house.
host_about: Hello I'm Maureen, my husband and I love to travel, we are also Airbnb hosts and love it. We adore our 4 girls and 7 grandchildren, I  like to cook for the family, and make special memories with them and our friends.  We also like to garden and enjoy the outdoors.

name: The Chardonnay Room
summary: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. I will only let out one room at a time to consider guests safety during COVID 19 times.
space: Hand sanitiser is available for you before you enter the house. You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable modern queen bed, wardrobe, drawers, hanging space, bedside table and small table. You have your own air-conditioning for heating or cooling, as well as a ceiling fan. A key for your bedroom door assures you your belongings are secure.  There are well thought out little touches that make your stay that bit more comfortable and easy.   You are getting more than a private room, my home is organised to be very guest friendly. You can access the lounge, dining, kitchen and laundry area. The kitchen is  a full kitchen with all you need, not just a 'kitchenette'. The bathroom is for guest use only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. Due to COVID 19 guidelines and considerations, you will have exclusive access the the guest bathroom as I will only let out one room at a time.  The kitchen is available for food storage (fridge and cupboar

The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation. Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests. Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and has a new shopping mall. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops, also Aldi and Cheap as Chips. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway. Every town has a local pub which will serve great meals. The Vine Inn is a popular spot being open from 7 a
notes: I have unlimited WIFI. Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry. There is a ceiling fan in your room. Your room has split system air conditioning for heating and cooling to your liking.
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: You have access to the lounge, dining, full kitchen and your room. You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area. Parking is at the front of the house. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in my private part of the house while I am not home. You can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area. The cats are not allowed in guest bedrooms.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you.   I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose.
house_rules: - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - No visitors - Tidy up after yourself in your room and shared areas  - Eating or drinking in the dining area only, not bedroom - Conserve energy - turn off lights / air conditioner when not needed and when leaving the house - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors  - I advise I have 2 cats, they are not allowed in guest rooms - Report and pay for breakages or damage
host_about:
I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I have been local for 8 years but have a long family history in the area. I am a Christian and attend a local church, I love helping others.
I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others.  After hosting wonderful guests from around the globe, I am now planning my own overseas adventure next year! I would love insight and tips from my guests!

name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent
summary: Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land  located in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment.  Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different.
space: The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.  A large queen size bed,  kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities,  and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.   The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided. Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools.

Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools. Guests have a large paddock setting with access to creek
neighborhood_overview: Flaxman Valley is a quiet regional area with some small wineries and farms.
notes: We have a wonderful small boutique winery "Poonawatta" within walking distance. You can organise a private tasting,  enjoy your visit  and meander home across paddocks. Up the road further is Flaxman Wines where you can organise to attend a long table lunch that is held on the first Saturday of each month. They are open in cellar door from Thursday -Sunday.
transit: Private vehicle is necessary.
access: Guests have a large paddock setting with access to creek areas, a private courtyard, fire pit (seasonal)  and plenty of outdoor places to relax. Guests are welcome to have  a walk through the property and along the creek. Clients have their own entrance and car park. Outside lighting and their own outdoor kitchen with all you need for an extended stay.
interaction: Guests will be able to contact us via text messages to request any extra supplies or with any concerns or issues. We aim to provide a private luxurious and unique  accommodation where guests can initiate contact if they wish.
house_rules: - No campfires in fireban season
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

name: Miriam's Cottage self contained Bed and Breakfast
summary: This lovely 1920's cottage is located in a quiet tree lined street in the heart of Tanunda.  Miriam's is a 5 minute walk to shops and restaurants such as Ferment Asian, 1918, Musque and cafe's. Also walking distance to Langmeil winery, Peter Lehmann, Z Wines etc Breakfast provisions are there for guests to either have a cooked breakfast of bacon, eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms or continental breakfast, fruit, yogurt, milk, orange juice, tea, coffee Included is also a cheese plate and bottle of wine.
space: Bedroom one has Queen bed.  Bedroom two has the choice of two single beds or this can be a King bed. Ideal for couples or singles. Please specify this when booking if needing beds in second bedroom need to be singles.

name: Azalea Cedar-Rose Barossa Valley free breakfast
summary: Azalea Cedar-Rose has been uniquely refurbished while maintaining its period charm and is perfectly situated to explore Australia's premier wine region, the Barossa Valley.  Boasting 4 spacious and stunning queen size bedrooms,  accommodating up to 11.  Two bathrooms, spa bath, bathrobes, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi The villa is alluring, beds made, fire set, afternoon tea, free Continental Breakfast and beautiful vineyard views  Complimentary port and chocolates.
space: The moment you step inside you will love the attention to detail and the unique styling with its fine furnishings, Baltic floors, French doors, high ceilings, and lead light windows. On arrival, help yourself to pod coffee, selection of teas, milk, biscuits which is complimentary. Enjoy chocolate truffles and help yourself to the carafe of local Port wine. Enjoy the free continental breakfast of country bread, butter, milk, juice, cereal and a selection of local jams to prepare at your own leisure. You can Purchase the full Breakfast package at only $15 pp per night of eggs,  smoked bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms, baked beans, preserved fruit, pancake mix, maple syrup,  and bottle of local wine. (please let us know if you would like the breakfast package and we can adjust the Airbnb rates)   All Linen, Towels and bathrobes supplied. Enjoy the space as even with 11 guests you are not on top of each other.  There are two separate bathrooms with under floor heating, one with a toilet, vanity

neighborhood_overview: Easy stroll to bakeries, cafes, restaurants, pubs, super-market, fashion shops, cellar doors and art Galleries. Hot air-ballooning  Helicopter Scenic flights Lord Lyndoch Restaurant  Lavender farm Excellent Tourist office in Tanunda
notes: If you would like more than your continental breakfast provisions you can Purchase our Sumptuous Breakfast package at only $15 pp per from our generous provisions of eggs, double smoked bacon, tomatoes, baked beans, preserved fruit, pancake mix, maple syrup, jams, breakfast juice, coffee and teas and bottle of wine. (We can adjust your rates for breakfast on Airbnb if you would like to go ahead with full breakfast provisions)  Cottages supply complimentary coffee pods, teas, milk, Port wine & chocolates along with continental breakfast provisions. All Linen, Towels and bathrobes supplied. Next door is Jasmine's Cottage also on Airbnb and accommodates 4 comfortably in two queen size bedrooms plus two extra on the pull out couch if you need it. Next door to Jasmine's is Pioneer Park with some interesting plaques explaining the history of the Barossa Valley.
transit: Walking distance to all the local village has to offer.  A car is needed to travel the full extent of the Barossa or book a tour.  A bus service to Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston or back to Gawler. From Gawler there is a train service to Adelaide. Barossa Taxi's are a good idea as well, especially if your a group. Only charge per hour not per person. Fantastic bike riding tracks.
access: The whole house and property is exclusively yours, even if just two people book. Car parks  for up to 6 cars are available both sides of the property. You are sent a key lock code and you let your self in. If you prefer to meet and greet someone at the door we can arrange that as well. Send your preferred dates and any questions and I will answer asap.
interaction: We are just a phone call away as we live in Adelaide, our housekeeper is on call and only lives down the road.  Nothing is too small a matter to ensure your complete satisfaction. So please contact us immediately if we have not exceeded your expectations. We can recommend  wineries and restaurants for you to visit. As this property is not hosted a key lock is situated on the front porch and the code will be sent to you before arrival. Please note, you can book straight away or make an enquiry. If your group is larger than 10, why not book Jasmine's Cottage which we own located next door and can take 4 extra quests.
house_rules: We appreciate most will respect our beautiful properties but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following Terms & Conditions.  1: The person booking for themselves or on behalf of other people is responsible for the property, and for making all guests and visitors aware of house rules and these Terms and Conditions. Payment of the rental property constitutes the guests acceptance of these Terms & Conditions. 2: Functions whereby extra people are invited onto the property is not allowed without prior approval.  3: The number of guests staying at the property must not exceed the number stated on the booking confirmation.  4: Check in time is after 3pm and check out time is 11am. If the property is not vacated by the agreed time then extra charges may be incurred. 5: Early check in and late check out may be available in agreement with the owner.  6: Our properties are no-smoking properties. Please do not discard butts ANYWHERE at the property including lawns and gardens. Ther
host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.

name: Jasmine's Barossa Valley Vineyard View Cottage
summary: Drink in the grandeur of the Barossa from this gorgeous retreat. Perfect for a romantic escape or for couples to share.   Soft furnishings superbly compliment the 1880's cottage, and offer guests maximum comfort with the popular shabby chic style.  Double spa bath, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi You will find the cottage alluring, beds made, fire set, afternoon tea, pod coffee with lovely views across the vines and hills Complimentary port and chocolates.   Exclusively yours
space: For your convenience and enjoyment.. * Afternoon tea of biscuits,  Coffee pods, selection of tea and milk * Complimentary Port and Chocolates Purchase our Sumptuous Breakfast package at only $19 pp per night to be prepared at your leisure from our generous provisions of eggs, double smoked bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms, baked beans, fresh local country bread, butter, cereals, preserved fruit, pancake mix, maple syrup, jams, breakfast juice, coffee and teas and bottle of wine. (We can adjust your rates for breakfast on Airbnb if you would like to go ahead with full breakfast provisions)   * All Linen, Towels and bathrobes supplied. * Fully equipped Kitchen with cappuccino machine and pods. * Log fire, comfy sofas, TV, Free Netflix and DVD player with DVDs * Cosy dining area * Luxury underfloor heated bathroom with 2 person spa, separate shower,    Luxury toiletries and use of fluffy bathrobes. * Separate Toilet with own vanity basin. Washing machine  * Queen size beds in both bedrooms with

neighborhood_overview: A quiet neighbourhood and very safe. You can walk to the Pub or Lord Lyndoch at night without any worry at all.
notes: In all directions from our cottage it is beautiful scenery. Take a drive to Williamstown, go past beautiful vineyards, call in to the Barossa chicks and take a ride in a helicoptor for only $40. Go in the other directions and head to Tanunda and Angaston and see all the attractions that is on offer. So many wineries on the way to explore. Dont forget a visit to Maggie Beers for lunch and to purchase some of her delicious condiments. A drive to Sepeltsfield winery is amazing and in the other direction, we enjoy visiting Yalumba winery. Just around the corner from our cottages is Hemera Cellar doors, a lovely log fire in winter and a free tour on offer. Chateau Barossa just up the hill has a great gift shop, and an amazing unique antique tour. A must is the Angaston Markets on a Saturday morning! Have your breaky there, sample all the local produce, so yum.
transit: A car is preferable to visit all the wineries or you could take tours. There is a bus that leaves Lyndoch and goes to Tanunda or Gawler. Adelaide is only one hour away.
access: This unique home is exclusively yours and private. Entrance by a key code which will be sent to you once your booking has been confirmed.
interaction: We are here to help you have the best possible holiday. We can offer ideas of places to visit and where to dine. We are just a phone call away and our housekeeper lives in the same street, so if you need anything or want to to know anything, we are available 24/7
house_rules: You accept our policies and house rules on collection of the keys        We appreciate most will respect our beautiful property  but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following Terms & Conditions. The person booking for themselves or on behalf of other people are responsible for the property, and for making all guests and visitors aware of house rules and these Terms and Conditions.   1. Functions whereby extra people are invited onto the property is not allowed without prior approval.   2. The number of guests staying at the property must not exceed the number stated on the booking confirmation.  If more bedrooms are used without prior arrangements there will be a charge. 3. Check in time is after 3pm and check out time is 11am. Early entry or late check-out only available on  agreement with the owner. 4. Strictly no smoking inside. Please do not discard butts ANYWHERE at the property including lawns and gardens. There are ashtrays outside for use.  If smoke is evident i
host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
summary: The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.  There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.  The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer
space: If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Shop for lunch by the lake.
description: The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.  There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.  The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Sh
neighborhood_overview: Where are the best Barossa Cellar Doors? Well, many of them can be found along Seppeltsfield Road! These include Hentley Farm, 2015 James Halliday Wine Companion Cellar Door of the Year. Hentley Farm, Greenock Creek Wines,Tscharke’s Place, Izway, Rolf Binder, Heritage, Two Hands and Torbreck are just a few of the wineries along the nine kilometres of Seppeltsfield Road where premium Barossa wines, including many famous Barossa Shiraz wines (the variety the Barossa is most famous for) can be tasted. Whistler Wines is a fabulous spot to combine wine tasting with a platter in the gardens under a gum tree, then visit their rescued pet kangaroos! Many of the wines produced in the Marananga/Seppeltsfield/Greenock sub-region of the Barossa are world class.  We have small, single vineyard producers without cellar doors as well as iconic establishments including the historic Seppeltsfield Estate Winery founded in 1851 and Winner of the 2016 Qantas National Tourism Award for Best Tourism Winery,
notes: Having access to the best local produce in SA, you can pick up your goodies from the Barossa Farmers Market each Saturday to cook up a storm in either the large kitchen or wood fired oven. However, should you wish to relax after a long day of wine tasting or walk the trails, we are able to point you in the right direction - Rachel from Destination Dining/ Owen Andrews Catering or Ellie Beer are just a few local business which specialise in customising your dining experience. Be it a family gathering, touring wine group or mates escape we can provide a long table lunch to 8 course degustation dinner.
transit: If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Shop for lunch by the lake
access: Enviable in the extreme, this exclusive, self-catered residence comprises three King-size suites, one Queen-size suite, a self-contained studio appropriate for pilots, guides, guests or carers and three fully refurbished bathrooms. Immerse yourself and star-gaze from the six-person spa under the vines or host an old world “Tuscan style” get-together around the wood-fired pizza oven & BBQ. Drag yourself away from the fireplace in the open plan lounge and retire to stunning views of premium vines that compliment every bedroom. There are two dining areas, wine room/library, huge fully-equipped kitchen, separate laundry & boot room entry and all the “mod cons”. •Pizza Oven •Baking Oven •BBQ •6-person Spa We provide all bed linen, towels & spa towels
interaction: To make the most of your Barossa Experience, email thereser (Website hidden by Airbnb) we are more than happy to make your stay memorable. We highly recommend visiting Barossa Visitor Information Centre 66-68 Murray St, Tanunda SA 5352
house_rules: - For Events or Weddings, please contact (EMAIL HIDDEN) directly. - *conditions apply for Weddings or Events - Accommodation for the entire property is for up to 10 guests, 2 further guests can be accommodated for with 2 x hotel roll-away beds @ an additional charge of $100 per person, per night. Rollaway beds will be based in the Studio bedroom 5. 12 guests are the maximum number we provide accommodation for. We are happy to allow up to 16 guests in total (12 overnight & 4 visitors) to dine at The Reserve as we are able to seat this amount inside if it is raining. Further than this number is considered a function, please contact Simone Tanner for event and marque details. Nightly rate: $1350 incl. GST. Deposit of 50% is required at the time of booking as a pre-condition of the booking being placed. Balance due 60 days prior to arrival.  - Refundable Bond: Will be required 3-days prior to arrival - Bedroom 3 & 5 Can be made into x2 Single Beds or King/Queen Beds - The Reserve Booking F
host_about:
There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place. 

We welcome you to Barossa. The place we love. The place we call home.

name: The Pinot Room
summary: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. The Chardonnay Room, The Cabernet Room and The Pinot Room. Each can accommodate two guests.
space: The space is a clean and tidy bedroom with a comfortable modern double bed, hanging space, shelves, bedside drawers, recliner and small folding table. You have your own air-conditioning for heating or cooling. A key for your bedroom door assures you your belongings are secure.  There are well thought out little touches that make your stay that bit more comfortable and easy.  You are getting more than a private room, my home is organised to be very guest friendly. You can access the lounge, dining, and laundry area. The kitchen is  a full kitchen with all you need, not just a 'kitchenette'. The bathroom is for guest use only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. The bathroom may need to be shared with other guests if the other rooms are booked.  The kitchen is available for food storage (fridge and cupboard) and also cooking. Please let me show you how to use the appliances and stove. I supply tea / coffee / hot chocolate / water, and a light breakfas
description: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. The Chardonnay Room, The Cabernet Room and The Pinot Room. Each can accommodate two guests. The space is a clean and tidy bedroom with a comfortable modern double bed, hanging space, shelves, bedside drawers, recliner and small folding table. You have your own air-conditioning for heating or cooling. A key for your bedroom door assures you your belongings are secure.  There are well thought out little touches that make your stay that bit more comfortable and easy.  You are getting more than a private room, my home is organised to be very guest friendly. You can access the lounge, dining,
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation. Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests. Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and has a new shopping mall. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops, also Aldi and Cheap as Chips. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway. Every town has a local pub which will serve great meals. The Vine Inn is a popular spot being open from 7 a
notes: I have unlimited WIFI. Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry.  Your room has split system air conditioning for heating and cooling to your liking.  If a double bed is not your ideal size, please choose 'The Chardonnay Room' which has a queen sized bed and larger room space.
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa, with a bike shop in Nuriootpa renting bicycles. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: You have access to the lounge, dining, whole kitchen and your room. You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area. Parking is at the front of the house. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in my private part of the house while I am not home. You can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area. The cats are not allowed in the guest area or guest bedrooms.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Otherwise, key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you.  I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose.
house_rules: - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - No visitors - Tidy up after yourself in your room and shared areas  - Eating or drinking in the dining area only, not bedroom - Conserve energy - turn off lights / air conditioner when not needed and when leaving the house - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors  - I advise I have 2 cats, they are not allowed in guest rooms - Report and pay for breakages or damage
host_about:
I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I have been local for 8 years but have a long family history in the area. I am a Christian and attend a local church, I love helping others.
I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others.  After hosting wonderful guests from around the globe, I am now planning my own overseas adventure next year! I would love insight and tips from my guests!

name: Bright, Spacious Barossa Getaway
summary: Here is a bright and sunny family home in the heart of the Barossa Valley ready for you to come and enjoy. Very modern and clean, this property is perfect for the whole family or couples wishing to explore. Nuriootpa, or Nuri as the locals call it, is nestled in between Tanunda, Angaston and Greenock, and is the perfect place for your spring escape. With easy access from the highway, this home is close to all the best wineries with Wolf Blass, Penfolds and more just a short drive away.

It also offers some of the most amazing restaurants that have been celebrated world wide. Lots of cosy cafes and antique stores to while away your time.
notes: Two night minimum stay required over Fridays and Saturdays
transit: Driving is the best way to get around as public transport is almost non existent. You can organise drivers for the day or wine tours so you can sit back and enjoy. Recommend you book taxis in advance as they can sometimes be on multiple jobs over the weekend.

You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable modern double bed, hanging space, drawers, small table and a recliner. You have your own air-conditioning for heating or cooling, as well as a ceiling fan. A key for your bedroom door assures you your belongings are secure.  There are well thought out little touches that make your stay that bit more comfortable and easy.   You are getting more than a private room. My home is organised to be very guest fri
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation. Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests. Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and has a new shopping mall. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops, also Aldi and Cheap as Chips. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway. Every town has a local pub which will serve great meals. The Vine Inn is a popular spot being open from 7 a
notes: I have unlimited WIFI. Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry. There is a ceiling fan in your room. Your room has split system air conditioning for heating and cooling to your liking.  If a double bed is not your ideal size, please choose 'The Chardonnay Room' which has a queen sized bed and larger room space.
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa, with a bike shop in Tanunda renting bicycles. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: You have access to the lounge, dining, full kitchen and your room. You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area. Parking is at the front of the house. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in my private part of the house while I am not home. You can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area. The cats are not allowed in guest bedrooms.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Otherwise, key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you.  I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose.
house_rules: - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - No visitors - Tidy up after yourself in your room and shared areas  - Eating or drinking in the dining area only, not bedroom - Conserve energy - turn off lights / air conditioner when not needed and when leaving the house - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors  - I advise I have 2 cats, they are not allowed in guest rooms - Report and pay for breakages or damage
host_about:
I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I have been local for 8 years but have a long family history in the area. I am a Christian and attend a local church, I love helping others.
I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others.  After hosting wonderful guests from around the globe, I am now planning my own overseas adventure next year! I would love insight and tips from my guests!

name: Pinecone Ridge, Barossa - your own 16 acres
summary: Whether you are looking for a base from which to explore the Barossa, or a place in which to bunker down and take a break from a fast-paced life, Pine Cone Ridge is for you. The house is nestled into a ridge top amongst rolling hills and vineyards, and large windows in the open plan living area allow you to enjoy the spectacular views whether you are inside or outside.
space: The 16 acre property provides a natural habitat for kangaroos and native birds and early risers can enjoy watching hot air balloons drift across the valley. Fiery summer sunsets & sunrises; autumnal colours; misty winter mornings crisp with frost; and the blossom of spring - the outlook is constantly changing. The house is self contained with a fully functional kitchen, big comfy couches and a wide selection of games, books, jigsaws & DVDs for your entertainment. Netflix & free WiFi are also available.  Curl up by the wood fire with your favourite port in winter or enjoy a chilled white and some local cheese in the golden light of a balmy summer evening.
description: Whether you are looking for a base from which to explore the Barossa, or a place in which to bunker down and take a break from a fast-paced life, Pine Cone Ridge is for you. The house is nestled into a ridge top amongst rolling hills and vineyards, and large windows in the open plan living area allow you to enjoy the spectacular views whether you are inside or outside. The 16 acre property provides a natural habitat for kangaroos and native birds and early risers can enjoy watching hot air balloons drift across the valley. Fiery summer sunsets & sunrises; autumnal colours; misty winter mornings crisp with frost; and the blossom of spring - the outlook is constantly changing. The house is self contained with a fully functional kitchen, big comfy couches and a wide selection of games, books, jigsaws & DVDs for your entertainment. Netflix & free WiFi are also available.  Curl up by the wood fire with your favourite port in winter or enjoy a chilled white and some local cheese in the golde
neighborhood_overview: Pine Cone Ridge is 2km from the main street of Angaston.  Angaston is arguably the prettiest of the towns in the Barossa. Set amongst rolling hills it offers a well-preserved heritage streetscape lined by large leafy trees. It also sits on the border of the Barossa & Eden Valleys making a perfect base from which to explore both wine regions. It is home to the Barossa Cheese Company, Yalumba, Vitners restaurant, Taste Eden Valley, and the not-to-be-missed Barossa Farmers Market amongst many other attractions.
access: As a guest you will have full access to the house and house block. You will receive your own individual key code which will allow you to access the house for the period of your stay.
house_rules: - No camping - No outdoor fires during the fireban season (November-May) - Motor vehicles / motor bikes are only to be driven on the gravelled areas - May - October outdoor fires are allowed but are to be contained within the firebox provided
host_about:
Hi! 

Pinecone Ridge is really a family project - we are all involved: Anne, Josh, Jeb, April & Isla.

We purchased the property in Nov 2017 as a family escape & renovation project. The property had previously been owned by a 92 year old gentleman with poor eyesight & needed lots of attention but we could see the potential & loved the views & location.

Running Pinecone Ridge is a family affair. April creates the welcome signs. Isla collects the pinecones. Jeb is Josh’s right hand man when it comes to maintenance. I get the privilege of escaping to the Barossa every week to clean & prep & often Josh is able to join me. In school holidays the kids help too. And we have all contributed to the eclectic styling of the home!

We have created Pinecone Ridge to be our family getaway - cosy, comfortable, fun, creative, peaceful, surrounded by nature - a place in which to clear the head & relax into a slower pace of life, yet also close to the action & deliciousness of the Barossa. We love sharing it with you and reading your reviews together. May you have a wonderful stay!

Anne

name: Pembury Cottage ~ Angaston,  Barossa, Pet freindly
summary: PEMBURY SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ANGASTON Pembury is a charming, stylish, fully renovated three-bedroom house centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1800s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard.
space: Pembury is a luxury self-contained property, beautifully renovated, classic late 1800s cottage, with a modern and comfortable décor and secure backyard suitable for pets. Located in historic Angaston Pembury Cottage comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests with 3 king sized bedrooms and a spacious shower/wet room and 2 toilets. House trained pets are welcome.    Secure back yard, we do request you do not leave your dogs unattended as we have had issues with dogs barking all day while guests are out. Provisions are supplied for a continental  breakfast, on the first morning of your stay. Settle into the comfortable lounge with a wood burning combustion stove, or head out to the large covered pergola, complete with gas BBQ, or relax in the covered eating area under the verandah. We supply enough wood for 2 nights use.  All rooms have reverse cycle split system air-conditioners for year-round comfort. Take an easy stroll down the street to the many cafes and restaurants, no cabs required!
description: PEMBURY SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ANGASTON Pembury is a charming, stylish, fully renovated three-bedroom house centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Secure back yard, we do request you do not leave your dogs unattended as we have had issues with dogs barking all day while guests are out. Provisions are supplied for a continental  breakfast, on the first morning of your stay. Settle into the comfortabl
neighborhood_overview: Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley. Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region. Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
notes: Kate and Jonathan have lived locally for many years. They are well known characters.  Jonathan has 10 years experience running wine tours, Barossa Taste Sensation and we are pleased to offer our guests a special rate. if you are interested please let us know and we can send further details. Should any need arise they can assist with suggested itineraries. Otherwise you will have the house to yourselves and will not be disturbed Please do give us a call if you do require anything.  We can organise great local chefs to provide an' in house' degustation dinner (no need to go out after a day of wine tasting) or provisions for a picnic. Prior notice is required.
transit: There is a taxi service but no Uber available in the area. As a special offer to our guests we can arrange a private wine tour for the day guided by Jonathan from Barossa Taste Sensations and your host at Pembury Cottage. Drawing on over 10 year experience  the tour focuses on the boutique wineries that highlight the diversity of this great wine region. Inquire for availability and our 'guest' rate.
access: Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk.  Our accommodation offers fully equipped modern kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas comfortably seating 6 people. The rate is based on 2 guests (one bed) - an additional $50 will be charged per person  for the second and third  bedrooms.
house_rules: Please note that if you book for 2 people you are booked into one bedroom. If you wish to use a 2nd  or 3rd bedroom there is a fee as it then requires cleaning and fresh linen . If any extra beds have been used we will bill you for the extra room.
host_about:
Hi
We have lived in the Barossa for 25 years.
Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa taste sensations and Kate is a Physiotherapist.
we enjoy introducing our guests to the area and have a wealth of knowledge at our finger tips to help you have a fantastic stay

name: Sanctuary in the Valley 3 bedrooms 2 bathrooms
summary: This lovely modern home ideally located in the Barossa Valley. Offers 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, relax and enjoy the beautiful garden and outdoor area. Fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities available too. Free WIFI  and undercover parking for 2, and 2 in driveway. We do have minimum stays over long weekends, school holidays and Christmas time, generally a 3 night min. We also would love to offer our services for our wine touring business Getaways SA to showcase our backyard.

name: Beauchamp House B&B
summary: Beauchamp House is set on a 168 Acre farm with Splendid gardens and views of the hills around you. We welcome you to stay and enjoy the quite and peaceful nature of Beauchamp House and discover all the Barossa Valley has to offer. Our 1870 built home is open for you to use and we dont book seperate people in that you dont know so if it's just the 2 people or a group of 6 the place is entirely yours. Sit back and relax or go for a walk and check out the animlas we have around the farm.
space: Beauchamp has 3 Bedrooms 2 with queens and one with a king bed and 2 rooms come with Ensuite and the other has a bathroom not far from it. Beauchamp house is a little luxuary with the old charms of a hills home. Guests on arrival will receive a bottle of wine and a cheese platter and all breakfast provisions while staying with us. Coffee machine and easy to you wood fired pizza oven add to the many amazing things that come with Beachamp house.

neighborhood_overview: Rolling Hills, beautiful paddocks with cows and horses fill your views. Mount Pleasant is only a short 5min drive away and there is wineries every direction you can go. Saturday morning farmers markets are on in Mount Pleasant or an evening meal at one of the hotels.
access: Guests have access to everything in the house and if needing WIFI just ask and we can hook you up. We have a veggie garden you can roam through and help yourself and a wood fired pizza oven to enjoy a cooked pizza and sit back and relax with a glass of wine.

summary: Based in the heart of the Barossa Valley, 'Luxury in Langmeil Estate' is the ultimate place to stay to give the best Barossa experience, iconic Barossa wineries such as Peter Lehmann and Langmeil are only a very short stroll away  The house includes 2 bathrooms (1 with spa), 3 bedrooms (1 Kingsize, 1 Queen , 1 Double ). full kitchen facilities and laundry facilities as well as relaxing outdoor area. Just a short 15 minute walk to the heart of Tanunda a perfect spot for shopping or dining

name: Goat Square Cottages - Flaxman Cottage
summary: Goat Square Cottages comprises three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa.  Your cottage has two bedrooms - a King and a Queen. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download Escape to Goat Square
space: Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.  Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities. Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will be top rate.

There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience  Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download. The access code is provided when booking confirmed
transit: The public bus operates from the main street (250 metres away) Onsite off street parking is provided for guests We suggest one of the local tour operators to take you around the Barossa - save drink driving and you get to learn a bit about wine food and history. Our favourite tour operator is Jonathon from Barossa Taste Sensations There are two local taxi companies
access: There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus an outside clothes line There are numerous fruit trees and guests are welcome to pick fruits in season
interaction: Your host lives nearby and will usually meet you on arrival (or soon after). She is only a phone call away
house_rules: - If you arrive home late or leave early, please consider guests in other cottages. Talk quietly and don't bang doors!
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Brown Bear Woods Holiday Home
summary: Nestled away in a quiet, leafy cul de sac of Lyndoch, this gorgeous home emphasizes natural elegance, showcasing a dynamic mixture of tailored finishes and quality fixtures. Grandeur in living space, the floor plan is well designed for large families. Impressive proportions continue with the additional games room which sets the precedence for stylish entertaining. Winter chills are comforted by combustion heating and the summer afternoons cooled by ducted air conditioning.
space: The formal living quarters feature vaulted ceilings giving an additional sense of space, together with chandelier lighting and elegant window furnishings. The Master suite is generous in size featuring a large walk-in robe and ensuite with spa bath and double vanity. Bedroom 2 and 4 are also generous in size, featuring built in wardrobes. Bedroom 3 has 2 single beds, with additional pull out beds stored underneath. Large family bathroom with separate toilet and vanity. Well appointed laundry with washing machine. The open plan living comes alive with the combination of meals and family room complimented by the large kitchen. Fully appointed with copious amounts of cupboard and bench space, stainless steel appliances, dishwasher and a walk-in-pantry. All the features a distinguished home-chef needs are right here! The rumpus room is an exciting space for guests of all ages, with a table tennis table and traditional wet corner bar. There is a tabletop Arcade Machine with 60 old school ga

neighborhood_overview: A quiet family friendly environment minutes away from world-class wineries, restaurants, bakeries and local shops. Leisure activities, local crafts and markets within a short walk or drive. Close proximity to Tanunda, Nuriootpa,  Angaston and Gawler.
notes: All guests will receive a complimentary  Brown Bear Woods gift featuring local treats. Please notify us in advance of your booking if your furry friends are also wanting to stay at Brown Bear Woods.
transit: Local bus station within 10 minute walk. Wineries within walking distance.
access: All areas of the home are offered for guests, currently with the exception of the double garage space and store room.
house_rules: - Please notify if pets are staying
host_about:
My name is Sharon and I live in The Barossa South Australia. We decided to make our home a BnB when we had it for sale and then I was made redundant. When one door closes another one opens and I have always wanted to have a BnB, so I thought now was a good idea! 
The Barossa is a beautiful part of the world to live and we like exploring what it has to offer and discovering new places. 
When we go away we like to feel like we are being spoilt. That's why I am passionate about doing whatever I can to make your stay enjoyable. It's your time off and you want to feel rested and leave with good memories. My aim is to make you feel at home.
Hope you can come and stay sometime! :-)

name: Hutton Vale Farm - Hutch Hilton
summary: Experience the rhythms of farm life in the Hutton Vale Farm Hutch Hilton! Ideal for up to 4 couples or families looking for an authentic Australian experience within the rolling hills of the Barossa.
space: Think a camping holiday without having to take anything! A good make over of our staff quarters provides 4 seperate bedrooms each with a small ensuite, electric blanket, air conditioning and heating. An outdoor kitchen with adjoining (semi enclosed)  lounge area, open fire, books to read and games to play. Perfect for friends and couples bonding weekends. Fly in by private/charter aircraft landing on the farm's grass airstrip.
description: Experience the rhythms of farm life in the Hutton Vale Farm Hutch Hilton! Ideal for up to 4 couples or families looking for an authentic Australian experience within the rolling hills of the Barossa. Think a camping holiday without having to take anything! A good make over of our staff quarters provides 4 seperate bedrooms each with a small ensuite, electric blanket, air conditioning and heating. An outdoor kitchen with adjoining (semi enclosed)  lounge area, open fire, books to read and games to play. Perfect for friends and couples bonding weekends. Fly in by private/charter aircraft landing on the farm's grass airstrip. Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in) Also a great experience is to visit the Barossa Farmers market (10 minute drive) to collect a range of local produce
neighborhood_overview: Angaston township is 10 minutes away by car with specialty shops as well as all the services that might be required. The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike track, parks and 2 golf courses.
notes: Hutton Vale Farm has been in our family for 174 years, we welcome sharing an understanding of this land and the wider Barossa with you.
transit: Car is best, push bikes/scooters can be hired in Angaston, cellar door hop on/hop off bus available in the within the Barossa. Loan car available for fly in pilots (prior notice req'd)
access: Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in) Also a great experience is to visit the Barossa Farmers market (10 minute drive) to collect a range of local produce. Every Saturday 7:30am til 11am, but get in early! Hutton Vale Farm Produce currently available: Eggs $5 per doz Lamb Leg Roast (bone in) $14.50/kg (approx. 2-3kg) Lamb Leg Easy Carve $16.99/kg (approx. 2 - 2.5kg) Butterfly Leg $16.50/kg (approx. 2 kg) Lamb Racks $29.00/kg  Slow Roast Shoulder $11.99/kg (approx 2.5 - 4kg) Chutneys $10 each Website, contact details for food orders:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
interaction: We will greet you on arrival to familiarise you with the accommodation and the farm.
house_rules: - Events/Dinner parties are ok for the guests staying on farm only (no additional persons without prior agreement)
host_about: I am part of a mixed family farm in the Barossa, with a strong interest in food and wine.

name: Discovery Holiday Parks
summary: Luxury Executive accommodation nestled in the heart of the Barossa Valley. These ultra modern three bedroom villas have all the comforts of home plus more. Ideal for couples or families sleeping up to 6 guests.
space: There are very few wine lovers who have not sampled a drop from the Barossa Valley. Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination is also the home of Discovery Parks - Barossa Valley. Our caravan park is just a few minutes from the centre of Tanunda, a great place to begin your tour. Explore the vine-covered plains and hills that surround charming townships and Lutheran churches, with their distinctive square spires dotting the rural landscape. Or, enjoy our new splashtacular waterpark! 3 slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count = fun for the whole family. With so many wineries, historic buildings, museums, scenic tours, bush walks, art galleries, amazing dining experiences and fantastic park facilities, you won’t want to waste a moment.

neighborhood_overview: As noted by Barossa on line; There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.
transit: Located just over an hours drive from Adelaide Airport, the option to self drive or book a tour is yours.
access: Guest will have access to use an activity room, bouncing pillow, playground, resort style pool and water park located in the Discovery Parks Barossa Valley.
