name: Fernweh Guesthouse Bethany Room w/buffet breakfast
summary: An amazing location right in Tanunda. Walk to FermentAsian and 1918 restaurants (300m). A hosted guesthouse with exceptional full breakfast. A solid brass queen sized bed and an ensuite with underfloor heating, air-conditioner and table and chairs. Shared Formal Lounge and Dining Rooms with a wood fire heater, mahogany furniture, television and free wifi and parking. Electric bikes and our day tour available. Nibbles provided on arrival. A professionally operated Guesthouse.
space: Breakfast is included which comprises an outstanding cooked breakfast from our menu, self serve cereals, fruits, bakery and dairy options and a great range of prepared tea and coffee.  Enjoy the convenience of the shared kitchenette,which includes a fridge, microwave, washing machine, iron and ironing board.   The formal garden and BBQ facitilities are available. We also have two other rooms available for guests - Langmeil Room (amazing king size bed with double spa) and Tanunda Room (elegant and romantic) It is possible to book all three Fernweh Guesthouse rooms. Contact us for discounted rates.

neighborhood_overview: Three hundred meters from the centre of Tanunda and the Information Centre. Walk to great restaurants (including FermentAsian 300m), ten cafes, great bakery and wineries within walking distance. We live in an extremely quiet location in the centre of town, 300 meters of the main street. There is no traffic noise at night.
transit: You don't need to worry about transport. You can walk, hire a bike or book a day tour with us. We also can arrange a pickup and drop off in Adelaide / Adelaide Airport.
access: Apart from your bedroom and ensuite with underfloor heating (fully secure and lockable), you have access to the kitchenette, formal lounge room and dining room (full breakfast included) and the formal garden and BBQ areas.
interaction: We respect your privacy at all times. We are available to assist you as required to ensure that your stay at our Guesthouse is a most enjoyable and pleasant experience. You hosts live at the Guesthouse in a completely private wing of the  house to ensure your privacy.
house_rules: BREAKFAST Breakfast is an important part of your stay with us. Please fill in your Breakfast Menu and leave it on the Reception Desk near the telephone by 7.00pm or on arrival if later.   On arrival you will have a cheese platter in the fridge for you to collect at your convenience. Check on your labelled shelf.  For your safety and comfort and for the safety and comfort of others: SMOKING IS NOT PERMITTED IN ANY ROOM OR ON THE GROUNDS. A smoking fee of $500 will be charged for cleaning curtains, floor coverings and bedding. Any damage caused by cigarettes will be charged for replacement or repair. name: Jesmond Dene - Barossa
summary: Located in the Angaston heritage district, Jesmond Dene is a four to five minute stroll from award winning restaurants, delicious coffee and regional gourmet stores showcasing Barossa specialty food on the main street in Angaston. A 1921 Australian bungalow the house features timber floors, three double bedrooms, two bathrooms, lounge with open fire, fully appointed kitchen, separate dining room and is yours exclusively during your stay.
space: Enjoy short stays away with friends or family to experience all the Barossa Valley has to offer.

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery House..Get it all!
summary: Located in the historic section of Lyndoch township, the gateway to the Barossa Valley (1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD). Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable accommodation with an entire end of this unique 1850’s colonial building constructed as the Barossa Inn & licensed until 1912. Price is for 2 guests. Additional guests are $20/person/night. Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby.
space: 5 minute walk to town centre with shops, restaurants, hotel, supermarket etc. The B&B is an entire 2 bedroom house (including free wifi), with lounge, kitchen, dining, laundry, bathroom and private rear patio/pergola/garden. There is a sofa-bed in the lounge room which can possibly be used by negotiation. The building was originally the Barossa Inn. In 1912, a bakery was opened by two brothers and it became the Lyndoch Bakery. The original wood-fired oven remains at the back of the property, which we’d be happy to show you if you are interested. We will leave you alone, but if you need assistance/advice, or want to see more of the historic site, we are nearby to help. Long term stays are encouraged with great reductions in nightly price. We do not charge additional cleaning fees and the place is  thoroughly cleaning per Covid19 advice. Enjoy a happy, healthy Barossa stay!
description: Located in the historic section of Lyndoch township, the gateway to the Barossa Valley (1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD). Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable accommodation with an entire end of this unique 1850’s colonial building constructed as the Barossa Inn & licensed until 1912. Price is for 2 guests. Additional guests are $20/person/night. Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby. 5 minute walk to town centre with shops, restaurants, hotel, supermarket etc. The B&B is an entire 2 bedroom house (including free wifi), with lounge, kitchen, dining, laundry, bathroom and private rear patio/pergola/garden. There is a sofa-bed in the lounge room which can possibly be used by negotiation. The building was originally the Barossa Inn. In 1912, a bakery was opened by two brothers and it became the Lyndoch Bakery. The original wood-fired oven remains at the back of the property, whi
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the ‘Gateway’ to the Barossa Valley. The residence gives you local ambience and history, whilst providing you the opportunity to explore this vibrant tourist wine & food region. Tanunda, Nuriootpa, Angaston and other Barossa Valley towns are all an easy drive way. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the B&B.
notes: Be aware this is a gorgeous historic building, built to the lay of the land, so there are a maximum of 2 steps within the house and 2 low-rise steps to the entry. The original scotch oven (bakery) is detached from the house (accessible to guests if convenient, upon request to hosts). Continental breakfast provisions provided (juice, cereal, bread/toast, condiments, tea, coffee plus fresh eggs from our free range chooks - you can thank them personally if you like, by saving your food scraps!). A bin is provided in the kitchen with a yellow recycle bin outside the side gate, and of course a food scrap bucket for chooks! We appreciate guests helping us protect the local environment.  Parking is on the street. Thank you.
transit: Within the Lyndoch township, walking is an easy option as the house is only a few hundred metres from the centre. Car transport is easiest around the Barossa Valley and chauffeured options are available.
interaction: We are happy to meet you, provide suggestions and advice, or leave you to explore yourself - whatever your preference!
house_rules: Dishes washed and kitchen and house tidy before vacating. Whilst we will do a clean of the house, it must be left tidy and any ‘out of the ordinary’ mess, cleaned up. Cleaning products and equipment are available in the laundry if required. For any stay beyond 4 days, we will leave a spare set of bedding and towels for you to use. We would clean at 7 days on request. Guests beyond a week will receive a price-discount and this will mean you self-clean and change bedding/towels at your discretion. There is a washing machine for your use. You’d be expected to keep the place tidy & light cleaning dusting etc, or for longer than 2 weeks, thorough cleaning using the products provided (let us know if you need anything specific for cleaning). On departure, we expect the place to be left clean and tidy, similar to check-in.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

name: Martinsell Manor
summary: Private accommodation, self-contained in the downstairs section of this grand Manor. The main entrance provides  access leading into your spacious lounge and dining area. Martinsell Manor, a historical, stately, stone building is set on 77 acres in beautiful surroundings within the picturesque Barossa region.  The impressive guest suites have recently been renovated and include high ceilings, quality Georgian and Chippendale furniture, and Persian carpets on polished floorboards.
space: A magnificent piece of South Australian history, this turn of the century home has played host to some prominent Australian and international aristocrats, politicians and business people. The grand rooms and opulent architecture give glimpses of a bygone era. Adelaide's Ashburton Design has seamlessly blended the old world charm with his colours and furnishings, to make a beautiful and elegant environment. The private accommodation is rented as a whole area. A getaway for yourself, your partner, friends or family. ***VERY IMPORTANT*** Even though it is listed as an "entire place" please know that the entire downstairs of the manor is for the guests use, while the upstairs of the manor is private. For more details you're welcome to contact the host at anytime.

neighborhood_overview: The Manor is 20 minutes from Tanunda
notes: Martinsell is approximately one hour drive from Adelaide, and 8km from Williamstown, off the Springton Road. There is a general store, hotel and bakery in Williamstown - your last port of call for any provisions. The nearest large supermarket is about 20 minutes' drive. There is a small kitchenette with a ceramic hotplate, microwave, kettle, toaster and fridge for the preparation of light meals.  Shower in our soft  rainwater provided to the Manor, whilst  the outside water is supplied from our spring. ***VERY IMPORTANT*** Even though it is listed as an "entire place" please know that the entire downstairs of the manor is for the guests use, while the upstairs of the manor is private. For more details you're welcome to contact the host at anytime.
transit: Transport in the area is limited to private taxis or your own vehicle. A professional helicopter service is available direct from the property. Discover famous Barossa restaurants and wineries or enjoy a gorgeous scenic flight.
access: Guests have access to the rose gardens, sweeping lawns and nature walks among majestic old English trees and ancient Australian red gums as well as a 25 metre swimming pool. The property is set on farmland and grapevines surrounded by rolling hills and walking trails.
interaction: Always available to answer any questions.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house (slippers provided)
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.

name: Linfield Cottage
summary: Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines.
description: Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines. You'll have access to the entire cottage, terrace, and the garden parking area. Guests are more than welcome to visit our Cellar Door, located next door. The cottage is situated on the family property, 19 hectares of Linfield Road Wines Vineyard. We're just half a kilometre up the road should you need anything. Linfield is in a regional area without public transport. A car is essential. We can highly recommend a tour for you to enjoy a day of wine tasting without driving. The cottage is situated next
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is situated on the family property, 19 hectares of Linfield Road Wines Vineyard. We're just half a kilometre up the road should you need anything.
notes: The cottage is situated next to our Cellar Door, which is open Thursday - Sunday. With a separate entrance and plenty of seclusion, you are sure to have a private getaway. The property is a working vineyard, not fenced and with several dams and waterways.
transit: Linfield is in a regional area without public transport. A car is essential. We can highly recommend a tour for you to enjoy a day of wine tasting without driving.
access: You'll have access to the entire cottage, terrace, and the garden parking area. Guests are more than welcome to visit our Cellar Door, located next door.
house_rules: - Smoking allowed outside in designated areas only. - Children welcome, however property is a working vineyard and is not fenced.
host_about:
We live and work on our beautiful vineyard property. We love cooking and enjoying a bottle of our wine overlooking the property. 
Travelling is always on the list of things to do when we have downtime. 
Reading is a great passion in our family and our choices wide and varied.

name: WHISTLER VINEYARD RETREAT
summary: Set on 80acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley this private, self-contained guest wing is surrounded by vineyard and gardens. Our retreat gets you back to nature... with vineyard and scrub walks, (accompanied by at least one of our Border Collies), friendly geese, an inquisitive free-roaming peacock, hens, rescued & wild kangaroos, the occasional Koala and a myriad of birdlife. Take in the views from the verandas, sit by the campfire (during the cooler months) or relax in the hammock.
space: Our home was designed by us and built in 2002 on a hill overlooking our vineyards. A purpose-built, private two bedroom guest wing with separate entrance, offers fully self-contained accommodation for up to 4 guests. The second bedroom can be configured as a king bed or two singles. Features include a full kitchen with bar fridge and a large open space living area with floor to ceiling windows to capture the views. The living area and both bedrooms have large windows and glass doors opening out on to the verandahs. The bathroom has a separate shower and deep bath with wonderful vineyard views. There is under-floor heating throughout for the colder months, reverse cycle air-conditioning, free WiFi and a Weber BBQ.
description: Set on 80acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley this private, self-contained guest wing is surrounded by vineyard and gardens. Our retreat gets you back to nature... with vineyard and scrub walks, (accompanied by at least one of our Border Collies), friendly geese, an inquisitive free-roaming peacock, hens, rescued & wild kangaroos, the occasional Koala and a myriad of birdlife. Take in the views from the verandas, sit by the campfire (during the cooler months) or relax in the hammock. Our home was designed by us and built in 2002 on a hill overlooking our vineyards. A purpose-built, private two bedroom guest wing with separate entrance, offers fully self-contained accommodation for up to 4 guests. The second bedroom can be configured as a king bed or two singles. Features include a full kitchen with bar fridge and a large open space living area with floor to ceiling windows to capture the views. The living area and both bedrooms have large windows and glass doors opening out on to t
neighborhood_overview: Our Retreat is on the most scenic road in the Barossa with 15 wineries to discover, including the historic Seppeltsfield Winery. An exciting new addition, within walking distance, is the new Seppeltsfield Road Distillers where you can enjoy handcrafted gin on their stunning deck. We have world-class restaurants within a 5 minute drive - Appellation, Fino and Hentley Farm. Our neighbours are the famous Maggie Beer Farmshop and Eatery. The work of top SA artists can be seen at the JamFactory gallery and artisan workshops. Other coffee shops, galleries and excellent shopping can be found at the 3 main towns, all within 5km from our home. The first stage of the new Seppeltsfield Road  shared path trail runs through our property. The Barossa also has other bike trails.
notes: As we have free-range hens, we will provide fresh eggs daily if needed. On your arrival the kitchen will be well-stocked with necessary condiments including home-made jam, sauce, biscuits and savouries, as well as tea, coffee and milk. We have a choice of excellent nearby supermarkets and our weekly Barossa Farmers' Market where you can buy supplies. And of course there will be a complimentary bottle of Whistler Wine! Guests will also be able to purchase our family wines from the Cellar Door with a special discount of 20% while enjoying a free wine tasting experience.
transit: Many attractions are within walking or bike-riding distance while there are two taxi companies operating within the Barossa as well as many reputable tour companies.
access: Guests have use of their own outside verandahs and garden furniture including a hammock, their own fire-pit and are welcome to walk around the property. We also have two bikes for guests to use. We have a book exchange and board games.
interaction: As we live in the other wing of the house we will be here to greet guests on arrival, and help with any advice or touring suggestions, while respecting your privacy.
house_rules: - Check-out time is 10am.
host_about: I'm a born and bred, proud Barossan. Married to Martin for 44 years we have 3 adult children and 6 grandchildren. 30 years of teaching has kept me young at heart. I love meeting people through our family winery and I'm very involved in the local community. I'm known as 'the Green Queen', somewhat obsessed with  recycling and caring for the environment. I'm an animal and nature-lover, loving life on our beautiful property and happy to share it with others.

We are in a great location with wineries, vineyards, cafes, pubs and attractions on the doorstep. name: Archery Road Estate - surrounded by vineyards
summary: Tucked away in a vineyard setting with amazing views of the Barossa Ranges, your wine estate is in a perfect setting. With four bedrooms and two lounge areas plus two bathrooms and a well equipped kitchen you have it all. The spacious decking overlooks expansive gardens - this is great wine country lodging. Wander the trails to the River. There's even a Tennis Court so bring your racquets! Depending on the season, you may find Matt working in the vineyards or paddocks adjoining the house.

neighborhood_overview: You are in one of the most picturesque spots in the Barossa. Make the most of the walking trails down to the North Para River
notes: Archery Road Estate is part of the Cottages4u group. Cottages4u is a group of long standing BnB cottage operators who have a proven track record in the local industry.  Established in 1997, the group understand what our guests are looking for and provide the best value for money, with an emphasis on Cleanliness, Quality and Facilities.  You can trust these establishments to provide the best local experience.
transit: We suggest that you take a chauffeured tour of the Barossa. Barossa Taste Sensations run by Jonathan is fantastic. Give him a call.
access: Archery Road Estate is a working vineyard farm. There are sheds - please don't go into them. There are vineyards - again please stay out of them.  Matt may be using farm equipment - stay well clear
interaction: Matt and Lisa live nearby. While they will try to meet you when you check in, they don't normally get to spend a lot of time with guests. If you see Matt working in the vines or paddocks, give him a wave! If he has time he will come for a chat - and tell you what is happening this week in the vineyards. But remember that he is working and there are often tight time frames to get jobs done
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Barossa Valley Escape
summary: Self contained cottage located on private grounds in Lyndoch, the start of the Barossa Valley. The cottage is private and yours to enjoy exclusively. It features 2 bedrooms, 1 with a queen bed, the other a single. A modern bathroom and spacious open plan lounge/dine open to a deck where you can relax and enjoy the surrounds. The cottage can comfortably host up to 3 guests and is ideally suited to a couple or a small group or family. Only a short drive to numerous wineries and local attractions.
space: A private cottage situated among peaceful surrounds with all essential amenities situated in close proximity to world famous wineries, towns and attractions of the Barossa Valley.  Clean and comfortable with reverse cycle air conditioning, essential kitchen amenities, modern bathroom and an enjoyable deck area to relax.

neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is located at the start of the Barossa Valley and features numerous wineries and local attractions. Lyndoch township features a few small shops including Hotel, Bakery, Cafe and Restaurant. The nearby towns of Tanunda, Nuriootpa and Angaston are only a short drive away featuring stunning scenery of the Barossa along the way. World famous wineries such as Penfolds, Rockfords and Grant Burge are approx 10 minute drive from Lyndoch. The Barossa Bike trail also comes through Lyndoch and the Whispering Wall is also nearby. Guests are welcome to request a suggested list of places/wineries to visit at the time of booking.
transit: Most of the Barossa Valley is best explored by car as it is quite vast (and you need room to put all the boxes of wine you bought!). Lyndoch is located at the start of the Barossa Valley and is itself home to some great wineries.  Tanunda is approx 15 min drive and you will pass many well known vineyards along the way. The roads are easily driven and well sign posted. Gawler is an outer suburb of Adelaide and is only a 15 minute drive from Lyndoch. For those on longer stays and wishing to take a trip to the City, the metro train service operates from Gawler to the City of Adelaide on a regular basis. You can drive from Lyndoch to Gawler in around 15 minutes and park your car at the station. A taxi service also operates in the Barossa Valley.
access: Entire Cottage
interaction: The cottage is self contained and provides guests with their own privacy.
host_about: Hi everyone.  Hope to have you stay in the beautiful Barossa Valley soon.

name: Ambrosia Holiday Home 5 bedrooms 2 1/2 bathrooms
summary: Stunning 1920s bungalow located in Tanunda with beautiful gardens, 5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and swimming pool. Few doors from main street, short & relaxing walk to shops, cafes & restaurants that this beautiful town has on offer. The large rooms, high ceilings & the beautiful leadlight glass in the windows and doors.  The new kitchen provides a practical work area, with ample bench space for preparation of a feast, along with intimate window seating to sit and chat over a coffee or glass of wine.
space: Wonderful diversity of this property with main setup of bedding being 4 kings and 2 singles, but all beds can be changed to offer single bedding at an additional charge. Offers 2 bathrooms and 1 additional separate toilet, 1 bathroom has a claw bath, and the 2nd bathroom has a shower over a bath. Upon entering the home be prepared to have your breath taken away. Drawing you in to the home with the warmth of the polished floor boards, the original patterned panels to the walls and the feature timber entrance panel befitting of a quality home of this era.  There are many special features here, from the nickel taps, to the custom made Butlers sink shipped in from England, to the cabinetry with wire mesh frontage to tie in the old with new. The modern stainless steel appliances including the 900mm freestanding oven and the dishwasher make entertaining easy. Outdoor living is a delight here with shady nooks throughout the pretty gardens, small lawned areas, and plenty of hiding spots for th

name: Villa Maria Barossa Luxury Guesthouse
summary: Built in 1910, Villa Maria is an elegantly proportioned villa that has been tastefully refurbished with all modern conveniences. The villa offers three comfortable, luxurious rooms, each with ensuite. A fourth couple can be accommodated. Located in one of the truly historical precincts of Tanunda, the house is only metres from historic Goat Square, and a short stroll to the main street.

name: The Tudor House
summary: One of Tanunda’s most admired homes, The Tudor House is centrally located in the heart of the township. Stylishly updated throughout, it retains many of the features of the era with sweeping veranda, high ornate ceilings, intricate leadlight windows, polished timber floors and joinery.  Ideal for a luxury couple's getaway, a group holiday for up to four couples or a family stay.  Private rear yard with pool. Walking distance to town centre, bakery, restaurants and sporting oval.
space: This is a hallmark location in a leafy street that is one of Tanunda's most sought after residential addresses. The Tudor House is designed for gracious living, but it also has many comforts that make it a welcoming family home. We hope you will enjoy your stay and will want to return again and again to our restful haven in the Barossa.

neighborhood_overview: A wide, leafy street surrounded by other quality homes and great neighbours.
notes: Note that our 4th bedroom can be configured as 2 x Single beds or 1 x King bed. We do not supply breakfast provisions as we love the variety of cafes in town and encourage you to explore locally. We do provide a few cooking basics , tea, coffee, milk and treats. So many cafes and restaurants are in walking distance; this location is ideal.
transit: Walk, car or taxi.
access: The house is fully equipped with linen, bathroom amenities, kitchen crockery, cutley and appliances. The swimming pool and outdoor area is fabulous to use in summer, and in winter we supply wood to fuel the combustion fire.
interaction: Guest have sole use of the house. Managers are close by and accessible to assist if needed.
house_rules: Note that pricing is per person so extra guests mean your booking may be cancelled if you have not advised us of any change in numbers. All guests must be as per your booking. We accept a maximum of 8 adults for this property.  Portacot and high chair available at no extra cost.
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity to relax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: Barossa Dreams great location for up to 15
summary: Grand Victorian bluestone built in late 1890's as home and surgery of Dr Franz Juttner. Barossa Dreams offers 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, kitchen, separate dining room, & lounge area. Complimentary Wi-Fi and onsite swimming pool. Your accommodation is walking distance to restaurants, shops and some wineries. Accommodating up to 15 people, amongst beautiful gardens. Perfect for that special occasion for couples or small groups. Why not book our wine touring services
space: Barossa Dreams has great flexibility offering 4 queen beds, 3 single beds and 2 double sofa beds as standard setup. 3 of the queen beds able to split into single beds (at additional cost) 3 bathrooms, separate dining room, lounge area and use of the swimming pool. Great location to walk out to dinner. The whole house can also offer another suite if available which can provide another bedroom (queen bed can split into 2 singles) and another bedroom and 2nd kitchen (chefs kitchen) and dining table.  Our wine touring business can specifically tailor a wonderful day out for your group, airport transfers and restaurant transfers.

Complimentary Wi-Fi and onsite swimming pool. Your accommodation is walking distance to restaurants, shops and some wineries. Accommodating up to 15 people, amongst beautiful gardens. Perfect for that special occasion for couples or small groups. Why not book our wine touring services Barossa Dreams has great flexibility offering 4 queen beds, 3 single beds and 2 double sofa beds as standard setup. 3 of the queen beds able to split into single beds (at additional cost) 3 bathrooms, separate dining room, lounge area and use of the swimming pool. Great location to walk out to dinner. The whole house can also offer another suite if available which can provide another bedroom (queen bed can split into 2 singles) and another bedroom and 2nd kitchen (chefs kitchen) and dining table.  Our wine touring business can

transit: We can offer our wine touring business with our buses or luxury mercedes and chrysler vehicles to tour you around not only the Barossa, but also Adelaide Hills, Clare Valley, Riverland and McLaren Vale.
access: Guests will access all areas of the property with exception of one suite.
host_about: love travel, love creating wonderful experiences, love wine, love food, love my 3 children

name: Barossa Valley Rest, Restore and Explore
summary: Welcome  Our B&B is located in the Beautiful Barossa & available for you to come and enjoy.  Our aim is to provide you with all  that you need with comforts of home for any length of stay.  The deck area is a beautiful place to relax with your morning coffee there is a under cover Bbq area where you can sit and enjoy a perfect wine that I’m sure you will find right here in the Barossa. shops, parks & cafes within a 15 min walking distance
space: The home is situated in the town of  Lyndoch Valley consisting of 3 bedrooms with a king size master suite complete with own ensuite. Ducted  air conditioning throughout for the warmer mths. keep warm in front of the fire place during the winter mths. The home also has a split system in the living area for those in between days  The property has secure undercover parking. Please note the house has steps in and out of the property.  Our home is great for all types from couples, girls weekend, anniversaries, or just that time out looking to relax and explore with the family. Perhaps book in house massages during your stay!!  Also happy to help with tours.

host_about:
Hi Friends

My name is Crystal. 
I have a huge passion for hospitality, having owned and managed several cafes in and around Gawler this has provided me with extensive experience on what people expect from a hospitality experience I strive to deliver that experience with excellence, quality and affordability. I absolutely love being a Air B&B host and meeting new people. 
We have 2 B&B’s one of which is at our home in historic Gawler and the other in Lyndoch

I'm also a holistic practitioner and happy to offer relaxation massage to my guest.



I look forward to meeting you some time 

Much gratitude Crystal

name: Barossa Valley’s Captain Rodda’s Cottage
summary: Barossa Valley wine region Take a step back in time and stay in a piece of Australian history, this historic home is located in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Antique and country style decor in a genuine 1860's Cottage - a beautiful piece of Barossa history with many treasures to view inside. Ideal getaway for romantic weekends by the fire, with convenient location close to many Barossa attractions, wineries, gourmet dining. Your cottage is a historic treasure; a truly relaxing hideaway.
space: You’ll have the full cottage to yourself, to enjoy at your leisure.
description: Barossa Valley wine region Take a step back in time and stay in a piece of Australian history, this historic home is located in the heart of the Barossa Valley. neighborhood_overview: A piece of Australian history, this home is located in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Antique and country style decor in a genuine 1860's Cottage restored to modern convenient living. Ideal getaway for family holidays, romantic weekends with convenient location close to many Barossa attractions, wineries, gourmet dining etc. Log wood fire with generous wood supply provided in cosy lounge. TV, DVD and music for entertainment. Sleeps up to 6 guests - 3 bedrooms - two with queen beds and one with 2 single beds. Continental breakfast included in tariff with coffee and tea provisions.  Complimentary bottle of Barossa wine and gourmet snacks, chocolates and port provided with stays of two nights or longer. Modern equipped kitchen, separate indoor dining room seating 6. Laundry facilities, modern bathroom with luxurious spa, large shower, toilet and separate second toilet for guest convenience. All linen included plus essential toiletries .Outdoor covered entertainment area with BBQ. Adequa
notes: A key access code will be provided prior to check in. For same day bookings, a minimum of two hours notice is required
transit: Hire a car from Adelaide Airport. Plenty of tours available once in the Barossa, or hire a bicycle and ride to the wineries!
access: Guests have full access to all of this gorgeous historic cottage.
interaction: You are very welcome to contact us anytime for advice on great restaurants, wineries and places to visit in the Barossa valley.
house_rules: 1. Pets are welcome, but only outside and in the laundry. They are not permitted in bedrooms. 2. Our home is to be returned exactly as it was left. 3. House rules are listed in the welcome book inside the home.
host_about: My husband and I live very busy inner city lives and love quiet get-aways to beautiful, friendly places in the country. We love antiques, great food and wine.

name: The Barn - a little bit rustic, a little bit luxe
summary: Nestled on 5 acres in the Barossa Valley,  Pondicherri Village and The Barn is a private property and hosts accommodation in a village atmosphere in the separate outbuildings. The extensive rural views and privacy are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger working farms.  Combined with rural amenity,  Pondicherri Village has several historical buildings and creates a rustic oasis, yet is close to all that the beautiful Barossa Valley offers.  The Barn is one of those buildings.
space: The Barn is a single room building constructed with thick stone walls and exposed internal timber beams.  The building is aged well over 100 years.   We are not sure of its original use.   The Barn originally had the tiny window on the south side and one door many a year ago!    Today, the Barn is furnished with a very comfortable super-sized king bed complete with crisp white sheets and natural fibre quality bed linens.   In winter, you will keep very toasty with the individual dual zoned electric blankets.   The bed is so spacious, it is also perfect for travelling family members or good friends to share! For your entertainment, there is a smart TV with free access to Netflix, Stan, and (Hidden by Airbnb) Chromecast and other apps such as UTube to watch movies, videos, news - any program -  while you cozy up in bed and/or access the NBN fixed wireless network for all your modern communication needs.   Or, should you need to work (and we hope you don’t),  you can set yourself up on th
description: Nestled on 5 acres in the Barossa Valley,  Pondicherri Village and The Barn is a private property and hosts accommodation in a village atmosphere in the separate outbuildings. The extensive rural views and privacy are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger working farms.  Combined with rural amenity,  Pondicherri Village has several historical buildings and creates a rustic oasis, yet is close to all that the beautiful Barossa Valley offers.  The Barn is one of those buildings. The Barn is a single room building constructed with thick stone walls and exposed internal timber beams.  The building is aged well over 100 years.   We are not sure of its original use.   The Barn originally had the tiny window on the south side and one door many a year ago!    Today, the Barn is furnished with a very comfortable super-sized king bed complete with crisp white sheets and natural fibre quality bed linens.   In winter, you will keep very toasty with the individual dual zoned electric blankets.
neighborhood_overview: We are only 5 minutes drive to the pretty historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  numerous restaurants ranging from great takeaways/dine in options to fine dining, 2 pubs, a florist, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office, speciality Barossa food businesses and some retail therapy. We are 5 minutes drive from the famed Barossa Valley Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning.    There are many high-quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments and historic buildings to explore across the region.    If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park.    Or you could  go  ballooning or a helicopter ride for the birds eye view!     Just about everything except surfing!     We are only one hour's drive to the nearest South Australian coastline,  only one+half hour's drive into  city of Adelaide
transit: Our property is accessible by car only.
access: We will always greet you upon arrival and give a very brief introduction about the Barn.  From then on, it’s all yours!   Inside your room, a welcome folder has been provided for you to read at your leisure.  It contains our contact details,  information about us and the property and lots of information about the Barossa Valley for dining options, winery information and tourism opportunities.   We are more than happy to provide our personal tips too!   You may wish to consider to bring your own light  breakfast provisions.    There is a toaster, kettle, fridge and microwave in your room.   Sometimes it’s good to chill and not rush off to find something to eat.      That is - of course -  if the slow pace suits you :)
interaction: As much or as little as you please!  You are independent in our Pondicherri ‘village’ and we will always respect your privacy.
house_rules: Smoking is allowed only outside!   A smoke alarm is installed in the Barn and will sound an alarm if you do smoke!!   Please do not smoke under any circumstances in the Barn or the Wash House /toilet or bathroom.   Ashtrays are provided outside.
host_about: I do love to travel and for now, South Australia is a bountiful wonderful gift.   I do love to cook and share my table with family and friends.  I love the smell of a newly picked lemon and fresh bunches of garden herbs.  I love my little gentle animals and the flocks of different birds that play and swoon.     I’m social and then sometimes,  I’m a bit reclusive.   I love the stillness and promise of a dawning sunrise more than the peace and surrender of a sunset, but both are spectacular,  and I’m blessed to experience and appreciate it often.   I’m grateful for living in a place that affords space and privacy.   And I enjoy meeting people!  Welcome to Pondicherri Village - a little bit of rustic, a little bit of luxe, and a whole lot of soul comfort in the Barossa Valley.

name: 29 Jane
summary: 29 Jane is a lovingly renovated 1920s bungalow, in the heart of the Barossa. A short stroll from the main street of Tanunda and a few minutes by car to some of the best restaurants and wineries in the Barossa. The house offers 4 comfortable king bedrooms, modern fully equipped kitchen, a lovely yard and swimming pool. 29 Jane is owned an operated by one of the Barossa’s favourite chefs, Tuoi Do, who also runs fermentAsian Restaurant.

name: Goat Square Cottages - historic Menge Cottage
summary: Goat Square Cottages comprises 3 adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa. Your 1850's cottage is Menge Cottage. It has one bedroom with a King bed & a separate lounge room. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts & a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing & email download Escape to Goat Square
space: Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.  Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities. Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will be top rate.
description: Goat Square Cottages comprises 3 adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa. Your 1850's cottage is Menge Cottage. It has one bedroom with a King bed & a separate lounge room. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts & a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing & email download Escape to Goat Square Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.  Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience  Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download. The access code is provided when booking confirmed
transit: The public bus operates from the main street (250 metres away) Onsite off street parking is provided for guests We suggest one of the local tour operators to take you around the Barossa - save drink driving and you get to learn a bit about wine food and history. Our favourite tour operator is Jonathon from Barossa Taste Sensations There are two local taxi companies
access: There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus an outside clothes line There are numerous fruit trees and guests are welcome to pick fruits in season
interaction: Your host lives nearby and will usually meet you on arrival (or soon after). She is only a phone call away
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Woodland Cottage
summary: Set between the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills wine districts with many wonderful wineries within easy reach, this European style log cottage on 20 tranquil acres allows you to see abundant wildlife and native plants - kangaroos, birds, ground orchids. 1km walking track on property, through natural bush settings. Other walking tracks in adjacent Mt Crawford Forest. Nearby towns of Birdwood and Mt Pleasant offer hotel meals, coffee shops and bakeries. Perfect place for a real Aussie experience.
space: Kangaroos and a wide variety of native birds (rosellas, cockatoos, wrens, robins, honey eaters etc) surround the cottage and come close to feed.
description: Set between the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills wine districts with many wonderful wineries within easy reach, this European style log cottage on 20 tranquil acres allows you to see abundant wildlife and native plants - kangaroos, birds, ground orchids. 1km walking track on property, through natural bush settings. Other walking tracks in adjacent Mt Crawford Forest. Nearby towns of Birdwood and Mt Pleasant offer hotel meals, coffee shops and bakeries. Perfect place for a real Aussie experience. Kangaroos and a wide variety of native birds (rosellas, cockatoos, wrens, robins, honey eaters etc) surround the cottage and come close to feed. The cottage is independent of the main house and provides a private space in which to relax. Guests are free to use the walking track on the property and can access the extensive Mt Crawford Forest via the Mawson and Heysen Trails. Please note that there is no kitchen in the cottage but we do provide a kettle, toaster, fridge and microwave oven. Birdwood
neighborhood_overview: Birdwood houses the National Motor Museum, worth a visit for motoring enthusiasts. As well as wonderful wineries and restaurants throughout the region, there are other hidden gems such as the Applewood gin distillery in nearby Gumeracha and a fabulous local market on Saturdays at Mt Pleasant.
notes: We have a number of large dogs (Irish Wolfhounds) - but these are kept in their own space. Guests should not interact with the dogs without our presence.
transit: There is very little in the way of public transport available in this area.
access: The cottage is independent of the main house and provides a private space in which to relax. Guests are free to use the walking track on the property and can access the extensive Mt Crawford Forest via the Mawson and Heysen Trails. Please note that there is no kitchen in the cottage but we do provide a kettle, toaster, fridge and microwave oven.
host_about: Love living on our peaceful 20 acres of Australian bushland between the Barossa  and the Adelaide Hills wine regions. Happily married. Love dogs, bushwalks, Australian native orchids, willdlife, good wine. Love travelling, especially to Europe. My wife and I will try our best to give you a tranquil, comfortable Australian country experience.

name: Red Gum Retreat  with wood fire & free wifi
summary: Set in a scenic location, this century year old iron stone cottage provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences. The home sits on 1 1/4 acres, and you are free to enjoy the space, take in the views, have a bbq on the terrace and enjoy the gardens and local bird life. Please contact me if you have any particular requirement that you would like to explore
space: The self contained accommodation has the standard symmetrical cottage layout, with 4 main rooms, two either side of the central hallway.  The bathroom including powder room overlooking the garden are additional spaces. The king bed can be separated into 2 king singles if required and a trundle bed is also available.
description: Set in a scenic location, this century year old iron stone cottage provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences. The home sits on 1 1/4 acres, and you are free to enjoy the space, take in the views, have a bbq on the terrace and enjoy the gardens and local bird life. Please contact me if you have any particular requirement that you would like to explore The self contained accommodation has the standard symmetrical cottage layout, with 4 main rooms, two either side of the central hallway.  The bathroom including powder room overlooking the garden are additional spaces. The king bed can be separated into 2 king singles if required and a trundle bed is also available. Breakfast provisions are provided. This location is perfect for any trips to local wine options, nationals parks and walking trails. I am available and have my private separate apartment on the property and respect your privacy, I am generally contactable throughout your stay if there is any information
neighborhood_overview: This location is perfect for any trips to local wine options, nationals parks and walking trails.
notes: I am available and have my private separate apartment on the property and respect your privacy, I am generally contactable throughout your stay if there is any information you would like about the local area.
interaction: Breakfast provisions are provided.
host_about:
I will be pleased to welcome you in my former home which has great character.
As a professional who works in scientific fields who is well traveled around Australia, I have experienced a wide variety of hospitality venues and attitudes from which to draw.

name: The Dairyman Barossa .. The Chaff House
summary: Exclusive self-contained Farm Accommodation set in the foothills of the Barossa Ranges. A fusion of heritage, functional architecture & edgy style, located between Lyndoch & Williamstown in the beautiful Barossa Valley. Take in the stunning views from every direction – vineyards, rolling hills & farm life. Enjoy an abundance of traditional  breakfast provisions straight from the farm.  (Hidden by Airbnb) for more information...thedairymanbarossa
space: The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy.  This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats.  Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade o

host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury Vineyard Cottage. S Australia
summary: Beautiful villa facing vineyard.  French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park on our estate. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included.

name: Fechner Place★Barossa Studio★ 1 Bed★Breakfast★Wine
summary: The Fechner place guest suite is Located only minutes from some of the Barossa Valley's finest restaurants  and Cellar Doors and a 15 min walk to Tanunda. Dozens      of restaurants and Cellar doors are within less than 20 minutes’ walk.

You will be able to self check-in upon arrival. The studio is located on a lovely quiet street,  with its own private entrance and parking.    Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perf
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located on a lovely quiet street,  with its own private entrance and parking.    Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for easy access to many of  the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.   We are a 2 min drive from the pretty village of Tanunda that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  restaurants,  pubs,  2 breweries,  supermarket,  butcher, bakeries, specialty retail stores, a medical centre, hospital and post office for your convenience.  We are a short 10 min drive to the famed Barossa Valley Farmers market in the picturesque township of Angaston, which is open on  Saturday mornings from 7.30am.  This is on our must do list.  If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails with some easy bush walks through Kaiser Stuhl National Park.  This is best visited at dusk to do some kangaroo spotting.      Or you
notes: If you open it, close it; if you borrow it, return it; if you turn it on, turn it off; if you break it, tell us; if you use it, take care of it;  if you make a mess, clean it up; if you move it, put it back. We appreciate you respecting our home. There is strictly no smoking in the studio.  If you would like to smoke we ask that you use the courtyard area.  Please ensure that you dispose of your cigarette buts in the ashtray provided and keep the doors and windows to the studio closed.   Please remember that you're staying in a house, not a hotel. Please treat the space with respect and care. If any problems arise, we will do our best to act ASAP. .
transit: You will need a car to access the Studio.  There is no public transport in the region other than a taxi cab service and the occasional Uber.

If a guest coming in needs to be moved to another property due to the smell of smoke stil
host_about:
I've lived with my partner and 3 gorgeous children in the Beautiful Barossa Valley, South Australia for over 40 years. We enjoy spending time outdoors with our family on our 30 acre property.
We have both worked in the wine and Tourism Industry for the last 20 years and understand the importance of great guest experiences. We have travelled extensively and experienced all types of accommodation.  I have been able to use what I have learnt to create a very successful Airbnb business (Air Stay Hosting).
I have a keen interest and passion in real estate and travel and now enjoy combining both by hosting properties through Airbnb. We love creating beautiful, comfortable spaces that our guests can call "home" and pride ourselves in offering a 5 star service. Our aim is that our guests never want to leave!

name: Barossa Valley Studio
summary: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley within the beautiful township of Angaston. Our Self Contained Studio gives your privacy with views of Angastons Hills. The Studio has it's own Kitchenette, ensuite bathroom and a small bunk bed room for two kids*. On the exterior guests have full use of the guest BBQ. We are located a short 800m walk along a the beautiful trail into Angaston township. Nearby are many restaurants, cafes, wineries. *Note lower bunk is rated to 120kg and upper 80kg
space: The studio is the bottom level of our two story property. You will have full and private access to the bottom level which can only be accessed through the main door.  Due to us living upstairs, there may be some slight noise but we endeavour to keep it as quiet as possible. Outside features beautiful gardens and views, a bench to take it all in and a BBQ area to enjoy our gardens and entertain yourselves if you wish. Inside features a king bed, ensuite, sofa, dining table and chairs, TV, air conditioning and heating and a double bunk for kids* Also featuring kitchenette, with electric frypan,  microwave convection oven, kettle, toaster, sandwich press and utensils require for your stay. *Note lower bunk is rated to 120kg and upper 80kg

Inside features a king bed, ensuite, sofa, dining table and chairs, TV, air condition
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a beautiful picturesque town located in the Barossa Valley. Within the town there are services such as a butcher, supermarket, pubs, cafes,  restaurants, barossa cheese company and many more other attractions.
notes: We have a new Golden Retriever puppy, born June 2019. The dog has no access to the downstairs area and stays in the backyard or upstairs with us.
transit: Our property is located a 800m walk to Angaston main street along a beautiful trail. If you wish to explore the barossa further a car is ideal but can also be done on bicycle. Nearby our place is; Company Kitchen: 500m Walk Taste Eden Valley: 850m Walk Roaring 40s Cafe, Barossa Siam, Soul With Zest, Butcher, Sunrise Bakery, Pubs, Oanh Kitchen, Wanera Wine Bar, Barossa Valley Cheese Company, Blacksmiths, Foodland: 800-950m Walk Saltram Winery: 2.2km Yalumba Winery: 2.3km Thorn Clarke Wines: 4.4km Menglers Hill Lookout and sculpture park: 8.5km
interaction: We will be available to answer any questions via (Hidden by Airbnb) . We will try meet you upon your arrival but as we both work full time this is not always possible. There will be a lockbox available for key collection and return of we are not available. You will have your own private studio.
house_rules: If you are on the property, please be indoors by 10PM. No Parties. If you find anything not working or there are any breakages, stains or spills please report it to your hosts ASAP. Please put keys back in lock box on checkout. Please turn off air conditioning/heating when outside the room. If you use the BBQ please ensure gas is turned off (closed) Please use the loop driveway to park and following instructions given once booking is confirmed. Parking in front of garage is our private area. If you leave personal belongings behind it is your responsibility to arrange pick up or pay for postage.
host_about: I am married to my beautiful wife and live in the stunning barossa valley. While working in the wine industry we also host our studio through airbnb. I love to travel, having been to around 40 countries and all 6 continents (not antartica). The experiences travelling brings is second to none, food, culture, adventure, architecture. From travelling we have stayed in a mix bag of accommodations, local homestay, villages, to high end hotels. Meeting and greeting people all over the world has enticed us to start out own studio and airbnb on our property in the beautiful township of Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

name: The Acre - OFFER: Make it a long weekend!
summary: OFFER: Book a weekend stay (Friday and Saturday night) and we'll discount additional nights either side to $100 per night. Send us an enquiry for the two nights, add a note to let us know which additional days you'd like to say and we'll approve the enquiry. COVID-19 PREPAREDNESS: • Contactless, keyless self-check in • The property is cleaned thoroughly by professional cleaners after each guest departure • All bed linen and toweling is sent out to a commercial laundry
space: Our Barossa holiday retreat 'The Acre' is a mere 2 minute drive (or 15 minute walk) from the town centre of the Barossa's quintessential heartbeat, Tanunda. Newly renovated from the ground up 'The Acre' is a purpose-built holiday retreat. We've taken every care to address all the creature comforts a weary traveller could have, for rest and relaxation... to get back out there and enjoy every last drop Australia's world-renowned wine region has to offer. The dwelling sits on an acre block of land, hence the name. As our guests, you will have exclusive access to the first quarter of the block, encapsulated by fencing which provides a compound around the house to allow both you, and our neighbours each their own privacy. The house sleeps 6 guests across 3 bedrooms. The recent renovation has seen the interior of the house, and the backyard revitalised in their entirety. The bathroom includes a free-standing bathtub and seperate shower alcove with rainmaker shower head. Full laundry faciliti

The dwelling sits on an acre block of land, hence the name. As our gue
neighborhood_overview: So close to the town centre yet far enough away for peace and quiet.  Just a 2 minute stroll down the road is Discovery Parks Barossa Valley. The family section of the park includes a splashtacular waterpark, complete with three slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count. (day passes available for $15, family and group pricing available on request). And while the kids are playing in the water the folks can pop across the road to Barossa Valley Brewing. The brewery houses a Brasserie and stunning beer garden with live music from 4 - 7pm every Saturday and Sunday. These are just two of the many cafés, galleries, museums and within walking distance, and dotted around the main street of Tanunda.
transit: There is no convenient public transport between the towns and villages of the Barossa, however there are a few taxi providers available from 7am until late, which given the local culture, most certainly come in handy.
access: Our guests have access to the entire house and it's own enclosed and private backyard with outdoor entertaining area.
interaction: We do not live onsite, however, on occasions may require access to the sheds/gardens behind the retreat's compound. Access to the rear of the block is via the same driveway as you will use, however we'll keep out of your way - it's likely you won't even know we're there. If you have questions or need assistance during your stay we're only a call or text message away.

name: Walnut Cottage, Angaston
summary: Walnut Cottage offers private self-contained accommodation with free WiFi. It is just 5 minutes walk from Angaston's main street. The cottage features lovely garden views, BBQ facilities and an open fireplace in winter months. The air-conditioned cottage has laundry facilities and a kitchen with an oven. The living room has a flat-screen TV and a DVD player. The modern bathroom has a clawed-foot bathtub and a separate shower.
space: Walnut Cottage is only a 5-minute walk to the main street with cafes, gourmet cheeses, wine tasting and shopping and just 15 minutes drive from the Barossa Valley wine region. Adelaide is only a 60-minute drive away.
description: Walnut Cottage offers private self-contained accommodation with free WiFi. It is just 5 minutes walk from Angaston's main street. house_rules: Repect of property, keeping kitchen and areas clean. Strictly no parties. Open fire place with wood supplied May to October. Strictly NO SMOKING inside the cottage, ashtray located outside under cover.

name: 1910 Murray
summary: '1910 Murray' is situated in the main street of Tanunda, in the centre of the Barossa Valley. There is a 10 minute stroll to interesting shopping, many cafes, and award winning restaurants. Wineries are nearby. '1910' Murray' is a blue stone fronted cottage, built in 1910. The interior has been totally renovated and modernised. The fun of the Vintage Festival Parade, can be enjoyed from the cottage.   Be welcomed with a grazing platter of local products,  and a bottle of Barossa wine.
space: Enjoy luxury Belgian linen on all beds, and Aveda products in the bathrooms. Original paintings by Jacob Logos. Under floor heating in winter. Wide verandah with a hammock, and outdoor eating space in summer. Barbecue Lawned area, gum trees, and bird life. Two modern bathrooms, one with a deep, freestanding bath. Eco cleaning products.
description: '1910 Murray' is situated in the main street of Tanunda, in the centre of the Barossa Valley. There is a 10 minute stroll to interesting shopping, many cafes, and award winning restaurants. Wineries are nearby. '1910' Murray' is a blue stone fronted cottage, built in 1910. The interior has been totally renovated and modernised. The fun of the Vintage Festival Parade, can be enjoyed from the cottage.   Be welcomed with a grazing platter of local products,  and a bottle of Barossa wine. Enjoy luxury Belgian linen on all beds, and Aveda products in the bathrooms. Original paintings by Jacob Logos. Under floor heating in winter. Wide verandah with a hammock, and outdoor eating space in summer. Barbecue Lawned area, gum trees, and bird life. Two modern bathrooms, one with a deep, freestanding bath. Eco cleaning products. Free access of the property. I am available when needed, but give guests privacy and space. Cafes and restaurants are within an easy walking distance. Wineries are in abund
neighborhood_overview: Cafes and restaurants are within an easy walking distance. Wineries are in abundance and close by. A chocolate factory i a five minute drive away.
notes: Barossa Tourism has a wealth of information to enhance your stay, including a calendar of events.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  A new chocolate factory is close by.
transit: Taxis are readily available.
access: Free access of the property.
interaction: I am available when needed, but give guests privacy and space.
house_rules: Please clean the barbecue after using.
host_about: I am a fifth generation Barossa resident. Nigel and I love living in Tanunda!  We would  love to help people experience and enjoy our beautiful Barossa Valley.

name: Copper House Kapunda Bagot Room
summary: Copper House, was built in 1880 and since renovated with elegance and an eye for comfortable accommodation. The verandas wrapping around the front of the house are adorned in ornate lattice and provide a shady terrace to take in views of the garden. This graceful home has three bedrooms with private spa baths, ensuites and two of the bedrooms have private lounge areas. A shared kitchen contains all the modern conveniences. The dining room has a beautiful chandelier and polished floor boards and the RC split system run throughout the home.  The Bagot Room has a Queen sized bed and ensuite with spa bath and faces the front rightside of the house.  The spectacular grounds surround this house with roses, boxed hedges and pathways to meander through and spots to sit and take it all in. A feature is the three tiered water fountain which proudly claims its place in the beauty around it. This stunning accommodation is the perfect, romantic escape, relaxing getaway or handy base for sightseeing

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury  Vineyard  Cottage  Hideaway
summary: Situated in a  little town of Lyndoch in the Barossa Valley, your country cottage offers picturesque view of the Barossa Ranges surrounded by vines. Ideal for couples in need of a relaxing time to chill and relax in a country escape. The interior decoration consist of French antique with a touch of modernism. A perfect place to wake up to sunrise from your front veranda with a cup of espresso and enjoy the sunset from the gazebo with a glass of shiraz!
space: A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Surrounded by beautiful vineyard and surrounding Barossa ranges. You have your own spa and shower, fully equipped  kitchen, lounge room and front verandah to enjoy the views. Close to wineries and award winning restaurants.

name: Fig tree Cottage
summary: Fig tree cottage is a  georgious 1840'S Stone cottage , set in the prettiest township in the Barossa. 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom for up to four people. - Lovingly restored 1840s stone cottage in the township of Angaston. - 2 queen bedrooms - Self-contained, provisions for continental breakfast provided - Wood burning combustion stove  and beautiful cottage garden. - Close to wineries, galleries, antique shops
space: Fig Tree is a charming, stylish, fully renovated two-bedroom cottage centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1840s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard. The rate is based on 2 guests, ( one bed) , an additional $50 will be charged per person for the 2nd bedroom.
description: Fig tree cottage is a  georgious 1840'S Stone cottage , set in the prettiest township in the Barossa. 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom for up to four people. - Lovingly restored 1840s stone cottage in the township of Angaston. - 2 queen bedrooms - Self-contained, provisions for continental breakfast provided - Wood burning combustion stove  and beautiful cottage garden. - Close to wineries, galleries, antique shops Fig Tree is a charming, stylish, fully renovated two-bedroom cottage centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away i
neighborhood_overview: Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley. Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region. Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
notes: Kate and Jonathan have lived locally for many years. They are well known characters. Should any need arise they can assist with suggested itineraries. Otherwise you will have the house to yourselves and will not be disturbed Please do give us a call if you do require anything.
transit: There is a taxi service but no Uber available in the area. As a special offer to our guests we can arrange a private wine tour for the day guided by Jonathan from Barossa Taste Sensations and your host at Fig Tree Cottage. Drawing on over 10 year experience  the tour focuses on the boutique wineries that highlight the diversity of this great wine region. Inquire for availability and our 'guest' rate.
access: Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk.  Our accommodation offers fully equipped  kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas .
host_about:
Hi
We have lived in the Barossa for 25 years.
Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa taste sensations and Kate is a Physiotherapist.
we enjoy introducing our guests to the area and have a wealth of knowledge at our finger tips to help you have a fantastic stay

name: Johann’s Cottage ~ Tanunda, Barossa Valley
summary: "JOHANN'S COTTAGE" located in the world renowned Barossa Valley wine region. Steeped in history this Germanic Cottage dates back to the 1860's and offers boutique self-contained accommodation. Perfectly positioned in the main street of Tanunda only a short walk to restaurants, shops, wine bars, hotels and more.  Central to the entire Barossa wine district. Perfect getaway for the romantic couple. Private front and rear access with plenty of off street parking.
space: Welcome to Johann's Cottage, an 1860s german cottage located at Tanunda in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley, an historic town with a rich german heritage.   The cottage has been completely restored and refurbished with quality furnishings. Two large bedrooms,  a queen size bed in each bedroom with quality linen provided sleeps up to four people. The bedrooms offer high ceilings and generous storage space.   A surprisingly spacious cottage, with a comfortable lounge room, quiet sitting room and study with desk (Website hidden by Airbnb) The modern kitchen is equipped with stainless appliances, water filter and a Caffitaly espresso capsule machine. The bathroom hosts original deep bath tub with shower over bath. Separate toilet and laundry area with european front loader washing machine. Reverse cycle heating and cooling gives you all year round comfort. The courtyard area is perfect for relaxing on the deck with a  glass of your favourite wine. Ample onsite parking is provided.

name: Marananga Cottages - Molly's Courtyard Suite
summary: Marananga  Cottages offer stylish accommodation in 3 self contained self catering suites in a quiet location in the tiny village of Marananga.  These are places for those who appreciate the best. The apartments are spacious, comfortable  well equipped. Each has it's own lounge area, ensuite bathroom, kitchen area. Nothing has been overlooked in offering you a perfect place to stay in the Barossa. Molly's Courtyard Suite looks out to landscaped courtyards.
description: Marananga  Cottages offer stylish accommodation in 3 self contained self catering suites in a quiet location in the tiny village of Marananga.  These are places for those who appreciate the best. The apartments are spacious, comfortable  well equipped. Each has it's own lounge area, ensuite bathroom, kitchen area. Nothing has been overlooked in offering you a perfect place to stay in the Barossa. Molly's Courtyard Suite looks out to landscaped courtyards.
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Angastons Rusty Olive, Barossa Valley B&B
summary: The Rusty Olive is an intimate lovers retreat nestled in the heart of Angaston, one of the most beautiful towns in the Barossa Valley wine region. Come and relax under the rustic pergola area and cook yourself a tasty gourmet breakfast with some local produce supplied, on the outback BBQ.
space: The Rusty Olive offers a functional kitchen with a dishwasher and coffee machine. Provisions are supplied for a  cooked breakfast, made form the best local produce, on the first morning of your stay. Absorb the ambient beauty of the bathroom where you can relax in a Cast Iron, claw foot bath or a spacious shower, alone or together. In the bedroom you will find an inviting king bed for a cosey night stay. Kick back and relax on the comfy lounge with a book or  watch a good movie on the smart TV with Netflix. Two toilets, one indoors and one rustic outhouse.

summary: 1910 Barossa Valley built house (yesteryear) set amongst the vineyards on the floor of the Barossa Valley.
