name: Whiterocks Barossa - classic bungalow
summary: This fabulous new listing is a beautifully presented white sandstone and red brick Bungalow built in 1935 and located within walking distance of the main street of Tanunda.  The impressive main entrance is through a glass door and hallway of grand proportions as is to be expected in a home of this era. The front hallway has an ornate dome and stunning chandeliers giving you a glimpse of what is still to come....
space: The bedrooms are large and there are ornate fireplaces and original features throughout the house, including a window box seat in the master king size bedroom. There is one new bathroom which has underfloor heating plus an additional toilet. The lounge area is a light filled room with a large box seat under the main window. It has a large slow combustion heater and the original stained glass doors and ornate fireplace this room reminds you of the grandeur of the home.  The centrally located dining room comfortably seats six and a wine room flows through from the dining room and into the large cellar.  The kitchen has been newly renovated and has clean modern lines with everything that the discerning chef is looking for including the 900 wide oven with induction cook top and dishwasher. The kitchen window  takes in views overlooking the rear garden.  At the rear of the home is the sun-room which leads you out to the yard with lawns and trees. Your accommodation is only 300 metres to the
description: This fabulous new listing is a beautifully presented white sandstone and red brick Bungalow built in 1935 and located within walking distance of the main street of Tanunda.  The impressive main entrance is through a glass door and hallway of grand proportions as is to be expected in a home of this era. The front hallway has an ornate dome and stunning chandeliers giving you a glimpse of what is still to come.... The bedrooms are large and there are ornate fireplaces and original features throughout the house, including a window box seat in the master king size bedroom. access: Guests have access to the whole property EXCEPT the locked single car garage
interaction: Whiterocks is self-contained. Your hosts do not live on site. Our local manager is just a phonecall away.
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Meander Retreat - relax in the country
summary: Meander Retreat is a small rural property near Eden Valley in the Barossa region, amid vineyards and open pastures.  Your studio is equipped for comfort and there are both sunny and shady places around the property in the olive grove, gardens or mixed orchard to write, paint or just daydream.  Meander will make you meander, change your plans, sleep long and sweet, and just untangle.  The kitchen will be stocked for a great breakfast (with vege/vegans happily catered for).
space: The spacious and sunny guest studio has a king bed, single sofa bed, a fully equipped kitchen and palatial bathroom.   There is car parking directly alongside the studio so you have easy access to the private entrance (where you can arrive at any hour and let yourself in via a passcode). The studio has natural cross-ventilation and a ceiling fan, but also has RC air-conditioning  for year round comfort.  Artists and writers will find this the perfect spot for their creativity and those feeling less inspired can binge on books or Netflix.  Leisure and pleasure are the goals here.  You will have premium local produce to make your own sumptuous breakfast and the kitchen gardens, orchard and chicken house are self-serve if you wish to cook other meals.

neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding.   There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub.  Nearest supermarkets are  20 mins away.
notes: Please contact me (your host and property owner) if you are interested in a long stay to discuss dates and availability (the calendar's availability is based on guest turnaround so doesn't apply to extended stays).
transit: You will need a car to get around as there is no public transportation to Meander.  The property is situated on a main bitumen road connecting Mount Pleasant to Angaston so while access is easy, it is not on a public transport route.  The Adelaide Hills and Barossa Valley are all a short drive away.
access: Your guest suite is your private space with its own parking and private entrance.  The rest of the property is yours to wander.   As your host, I'm likely to be around and there may be others staying at the property in another suite.  Feel free to wander and explore the various places to relax and take in the views.
interaction: As your host, I'm likely to be around to guide you and share a drink on the verandah, or if you prefer, be available only if you need me.  It's up to you.
house_rules: Your entrance key will be in a key safe by the front door for self check-in.  You will need to lock your suite and secure the key in the safe each time you leave the property.

name: Barossa Studio 57 accommodation + Wine Tours
summary: Barossa Valley Studio 57 Accommodation+ Barossa Grange Tours  located in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The Barossa Valley is a world famous region, you will totally enjoy your experiences during your stay. Studio 57 is walking distance to the township of Tanunda. Stroll down the main street to local wineries, hotels, cafe, wine bar and boutique shops. Studio 57 is a well appointed studio, luxury at its best. The master bedroom has a queen bed with comfortable bedding, bedside tables & lamps.

name: The Villas - Barossa. Peace. Beauty. Simplicity.
summary: Located in the heart of iconic Seppeltsfield Road,  The Villas - Barossa provide the perfect home for exploring the nearby cellar doors, premium dining experiences and gin distillery and for walking or cycling in the stunning natural environment.    Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the restful interiors of The Villas, offering a true bush retreat.
space: The Villas offer beautiful, environmentally sensitive accommodation in a striking bush setting. Reflecting the region's agricultural roots, The Villas harmonise unique architectural design with simplicity and warmth, creating a peaceful, secluded Barossa retreat.  Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The decision will be hard to make - explore all that the Barossa has to offer, or curl up with a book, take time to reflect and lose yourself for a while? Perhaps all of the above!! A fully equipped kitchen is stocked with abundant local produce for you to prepare your breakfast, and there are excellent breakfast options in nearby cafes. The Villas are bathed in light, from the first rays of sunrise streaming through the floor to ceiling glass to stunning sunsets retreating to the west. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the restful interiors of The Villas, offering a true bush retreat. Set along a ridge

neighborhood_overview: Marananga is a delight to explore, set amongst beautiful rolling hills and vineyards.  The village is home to numerous cellar doors, five within an easy walk of The Villas.  The award-winning Seppeltsfield Road Distillers are our near neighbours, and the renowned restaurant Appellation at The Louise is also within walking distance. A drive along Seppeltsfield Road's iconic avenue of palms will wind you through the vineyards of the western Barossa with its well-known wine brands and intriguing small batch wine producers.  Historic Seppeltsfield Estate is home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Vasse Virgin, Jam Factory Art & Design Studios and Fino restaurant.  Just around the corner you'll discover Hentley Farm Cellar Door & Restaurant.   If you're looking for some adventure, try ballooning or a Segway, helicopter or trike tour.  Or maybe a sunset cruise in a Mustang? Beyond Seppeltsfield Road, the Barossa is a wonderful playground.  More than 170 wineries, with 80+ cellar doors, amazing culinar
notes: The Villas - Barossa offer a secluded private retreat for couples, rather than a destination for families. Children and infants cannot be accommodated.
transit: The Villas are an easy one-hour drive from Adelaide.   Head north along the Northern Expressway, which becomes the Sturt Highway.  Take the Greenock / Seppeltsfield exit towards Seppeltsfield.  You are now on Seppeltsfield Road.  Continue along approximately 7 km to Marananga village, and look for the roadside number 468.
access: Complimentary wireless broadband internet.
house_rules: Check in is from 3pm, and check out is by 11am. Guests are requested to contact the property at least 24-hours before arrival (contact details are provided in your confirmation e-mail) to arrange check-in.

name: Light Pass House BnB - a nostalgic Barossa  home.
summary: Relax in this comfortable 1930's home decorated with antique furniture and old wares located at Light Pass, 2km from Nuriootpa, Barossa Valley. Sole occupancy catering for 4-6  adults. The house has a lounge with TV/DVD; kitchen with dishwasher, stove/oven, microwave; dining room; bathroom & laundry. Two bedrooms incorporate two queen size beds and a bunk bed.  Ducted reverse cycle air conditioning/wood heater. Breakfast provisions included. NOTE: 2 night minimum booking on long weekends.
space: Self catering breakfast provisions include bacon and eggs, bread/margarine/spreads, cereals, juice, tea/coffeee/milk. Outside there is a BBQ, rose garden, large gazebo and shaded parking is available at the rear of the house.

name: Tanunda's Magpie House
summary: If you want to be close to Tanunda's finest restaurants and within walking distance to bars, shops and Cafes in the main street, you can't get a better location than this! The gates to Tanunda Oval - colloquially known as Magpie Park - are metres away. At Magpie House you will be close to everything and stay in comfort. Leafy garden setting,  fully equipped for short or long stays while you explore the Barossa region.
space: Central location means you can walk to Fermentasian Restaurant, 1918 Bar & Grill, the famous Apex Bakery, The Clubhouse licensed community club and Z Wines (for a wine tasting and platter).  Our favourite shops nearby include Living By Design ,Wohlers Homewares & Furniture ,  Alabaster Barossa,  Elemental and A Time for Seasons. Enjoy our outdoor area with BBQ facilities or head out for meals... it's your choice to relax!
description: If you want to be close to Tanunda's finest restaurants and within walking distance to bars, shops and Cafes in the main street, you can't get a better location than this! Enjoy our outdoor area with BBQ facilities or head out for meals... it's your choice to relax! You have sole use of the house and garden, but note that not all bedrooms can be accessed unless you have booked for the appropriate number of guests. S
neighborhood_overview: We have so much that is special! There is a lovely park right next door or the Oval is metres away. Best of all you can walk to all of our favourite Tanunda places.
notes: We are confident that with this amazing location you will have a fantastic stay!
transit: Yes, we do have several taxi services if you want to head out further and enjoy wine tastings or dinner. There are several self-guided town walks you can do, and a diverse range of tour operators. Rent a car, limo, bus, motorbike, scooter,  hot air balloon  or helicopter!
access: You have sole use of the house and garden, but note that not all bedrooms can be accessed unless you have booked for the appropriate number of guests. Standard occupancy is 2 people accommodated in one Queen bedroom.
interaction: We allow guest to enjoy our property in privacy but are not far away to answer questions or to provide help. We're local so we know Tanunda intimately and want to enjoy our town as much as we do.
house_rules: Please note that base occupancy is for 2 adults in one Queen room.  If 2 people require 2 separate rooms a $50 surcharge will apply per booking. If 3 people require 3 separate rooms a $100 surcharge will apply per booking.
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity to relax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: Strothers Farm House ~ Angaston, Barossa Valley
summary: Strothers Farm House *** Newly Renovated 2018 *** SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION The 100-year-old stone house is set on a hill top on the outskirts of Angaston.  Is ideal if you’re looking to escape for a Romantic Getaway or share with a group of friends. This is the perfect house as a base while exploring the Barossa Valley or to relax in the peace and quiet.
space: Strothers Farm House features 3 spacious queen-sized Bedrooms. Included a full Kitchen/Dining, a luxurious Bathroom with Walk-in shower and Spa Bath, separate Toilet and Wet area. Heating and cooling are catered for with a combustion heater and has a fully ducted air-conditioning throughout the home. Generous provisions will be provided for breakfast for the first morning of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: HISTORY The property is set on 20 acres and was originally set-up as part of the Soldier Settlement Scheme in 1920 by Leslie George Strother (a returned WW1 Soldier). It has had a couple of owners throughout its time including Alan’s Grandparents, and Parents who both farmed the property. Today the property is mainly used for grazing Sheep.

interaction: Your hosts, Alan & Sue have lived in the Barossa Valley for the past 30 years, live nearby on the property and have worked for many years within the wine industry. They are passionate about all things Barossan and more than happy to help you create a memorable stay!
house_rules: All cutlery and crockery is supplied for your use, please clean and put away before departure. Please use water and air conditioning wisely. Combustion Heating is NOT to be used in Bush Fire season ( 1st Nov - 30th April )
host_about: I'm a non drinker that Worked in the Wine industry for over 20 years before retiring. Enjoy holidaying, camping.

name: Barossa Glasshouse - A Luxury Boutique Retreat
summary: Designed by renowned architect Max Pritchard, the award winning Barossa Glasshouse was built in 2012 and quickly became recognised as one of Australia's most iconic houses.
space: Luxury Boutique Retreat... Barossa Glasshouse is a house unlike any other, nestled into the hillside capturing breathtaking panoramic views... enjoy a luxury experience unique to the Barossa Valley region.
description: Designed by renowned architect Max Pritchard, the award winning Barossa Glasshouse was built in 2012 and quickly became recognised as one of Australia's most iconic houses. Luxury Boutique Retreat... Barossa Glasshouse is a house unlike any other, nestled into the hillside capturing breathtaking panoramic views... enjoy a luxury experience unique to the Barossa Valley region. Barossa Glasshouse is nestled on 75 acres of bushland and a working farm. There is no reception office on site. Located near the picturesque Southern Barossa town of Lyndoch, adjacent historic Chateau Yaldara and high on a hill above the North Para River with views over the valley towards the Barossa Ranges. The perfect base for exploring the Barossa Valley, Eden Valley and Adelaide Hills. Driving directions from Adelaide: Take Main North Road (A20) out of Adelaide towards Gawler. When you approach Gawler take the exit to the town centre. In the main street of Gawler turn right towards Lyndoch as indicated. Upon e
neighborhood_overview: Located near the picturesque Southern Barossa town of Lyndoch, adjacent historic Chateau Yaldara and high on a hill above the North Para River with views over the valley towards the Barossa Ranges. The perfect base for exploring the Barossa Valley, Eden Valley and Adelaide Hills.
transit: Driving directions from Adelaide: Take Main North Road (A20) out of Adelaide towards Gawler. When you approach Gawler take the exit to the town centre. In the main street of Gawler turn right towards Lyndoch as indicated. Upon entering Lyndoch take Hermann Thumm Drive on your left. After approx. 800m you will see an unsealed road 'Fuss Road' branch off to the left, take this road as it leads directly to the entrance of Barossa Pavilions & Glasshouse (Please watch for Kangaroos on Fuss Rd in the evenings).
interaction: Barossa Glasshouse is nestled on 75 acres of bushland and a working farm. There is no reception office on site.
house_rules: - Check-in is from 2PM and check-out is by 11AM. - No additional persons are permitted to stay overnight. Guests attempting to accommodate more persons than booked are forewarned they will be turned away, forfeiting the full value of the booking. Should you wish to invite a small number of day time visitors (maximum of 6 day time visitors), please check first with the management. - The Barossa Glasshouse Booking Form & Terms and Conditions will be emailed upon making the booking. Please read, complete, sign, scan and email back to Barossa Glasshouse. - A bond amount of $1,500 is required to be paid 7 days prior to arrival. The bond will be returned within 3 days of departure should the condition of the property be considered satisfactory. - Barossa Glasshouse is located within a secure gated property with private keyless access to accommodation. No reception or permanent staff are located on site. Gate and house entry codes are sent via email on the day before arrival. Guests who do no

name: The Comforter of Hearts - Barossa Valley
summary: We live inside an award winning Merlot Wine vineyard on 5 acres in the beautiful Barossa Valley. The house is rock and mortar built in 1837. We are fairly isolated and are surrounded by amazing fauna and peaceful views of the vines and beyond. We are only 25 minutes from historic Tanunda and busy Nuriootpa by car only and along dirt roads. Wake up to a vast variety of birdsong and idyllic surroundings.
space: We offer a comfortable bedroom with Queen size bed, own fridge, TV, toaster, kettle, and an Italian style, do-it-yourself continental breakfast. You have your own entry door which leads to an outside shared toilet, however we have a mobility toilet you can use in your room. The shower/bathroom is shared, and the bathtub is separate and found inside the laundry. Excess to the bathroom is via the lobby. Use of laundry is free or for an additional $10 we can do it for you. Spa can be used with 24 hours notice at no additional cost.
description: We live inside an award winning Merlot Wine vineyard on 5 acres in the beautiful Barossa Valley. The house is rock and mortar built in 1837. We are fairly isolated and are surrounded by amazing fauna and peaceful views of the vines and beyond. We are only 25 minutes from historic Tanunda and busy Nuriootpa by car only and along dirt roads. Wake up to a vast variety of birdsong and idyllic surroundings. We offer a comfortable bedroom with Queen size bed, own fridge, TV, toaster, kettle, and an Italian style, do-it-yourself continental breakfast. You have your own entry door which leads to an outside shared toilet, however we have a mobility toilet you can use in your room. The shower/bathroom is shared, and the bathtub is separate and found inside the laundry. Excess to the bathroom is via the lobby. Use of laundry is free or for an additional $10 we can do it for you. Spa can be used with 24 hours notice at no additional cost. Own bedroom from outside (coded lock). Toilet and bathroom
neighborhood_overview: We are a part of the majestic Barossa Valley, yet isolated and intimate. Own transport is a must. Taxis into the townships of Angaston, Tanunda, or Nuriootpa are around $50 each way. Unsure of Uber costs.
notes: We have two small breed dogs that will bark in relation to your arrival and movement. They do not bite and are not aggressive. They will be kept separate to you but may be heard barking if they can hear you.
transit: There is no public transportation where we live. Guests need to have access to a vehicle. We also live on a number of dirt roads.
access: Own bedroom from outside (coded lock). Toilet and bathroom via lobby area. Spa area, all outdoor areas.
interaction: We'd like to keep ourselves separate from our guests but are obviously available for emergencies and or questions about the surrounding areas.
house_rules: - We are on tank water, please keep water usage reasonable.
host_about: Friendly, well read, well travelled, lover of life. Married to a wonderful man.

name: Wings Barossa Bird & Bush Retreat - Barossa Region
summary: A 2-Storyed, 3-bedroom country home, a 170-acre getaway that's exclusively yours, ideal for that special alone or to be enjoyed with friends. The perfect location to stay whilst exploring the many wineries & restaurants set amidst the natural beauty of this world-famous area. High in the Barossa Ranges, only one hour's drive through scenic hills from Adelaide CBD. Birdwatching/ Bushwalking on your doorstep. Extensive marked trails with abundant wildlife. A total experience-not just another B&B.

name: BV House - Family Guest House.
summary: Beautiful Family Home with Rustic Charm, located in the Historic town of Tanunda, the heart of the Barossa Valley a Great place to explore. Newly refurbished  with all modern conveniences, high ceilings with raked beams throughout home. BV House is ideal for Families, Friends, Individuals/Couples offering 4 Bedrooms, 2 Bathrooms, main with deep bath. Bathrooms and walk in robe are accessible by all Guests. Open plan living, New Kitchen and Quality Appliances
space: Private Bar and sitting area with 2x drinks fridges and Wine fridge to store those special bottles of Barossa Wine to take home. Fully enclosed private back yard and plenty of parking in the front. The home has R/C Ducted Air Conditioning in every room, a large Gas Log Fire to keep you warm on those cool winter nights. Full Laundry Facilities provided. For the Children - Toys, Games, NetFlix, Sandpit and Cubby. There is alsso a Porta Cot and High Chair on site. BV House is located on the edge of Barossa Valley Way. The main street of Tanunda is a enjoyable 20min stroll via walk/bike trail, meandering past the caravan park, Brasseries Brewery - call in for a drink or a bite to eat. Just a bit further on is the Famous Welcome Arch of Jacobs Creek on entrance to Tanunda.

name: Elizabeth House sleeps up to 8 Guests
summary: This is one of Tanunda's iconic houses which is centrally located in the heart of Tanunda.  Beautifully styled and decorated with many features of the era.  Polished floorboards, ornate ceilings and a sweeping verandah are just many of the features of this beautiful home.  Perfect luxury for that group holiday or family stay.  Walking distance to the town centre and the many restaurants and cafes we have to offer.
space: This is a gorgeous location in a beautiful leafy street amongst other heritage homes. The space has many welcoming features and is your home away from home.  We have a lovely spacious deck to enjoy the gourmet platter of local produce and wine provided on arrival.

Did we mention there is also Barossa Valley Chocolate Company which has just opened.  So many chooses in a our neighbourhood.
notes: Complimentary wine and local produce platter on arrival Linen and towels provided Complimentary Wi-fi TV Shampoo, Conditioner, Soap, Body Lotion

name: The Chapel
summary: Marriage proposals, weddings - it has all happened at The Chapel. Today, The Chapel is an elegantly renovated circa 1849 church in the small town of Lyndoch. The old ironstone exterior, the cathedral ceilings, contemporary decor alongside the  cottage gardens and vistas of the Barossa ranges,  make for a memorable Barossa experience and a great romantic weekend retreat and/or relaxing getaway.
space: The Chapel has two queen beds.     The main bedroom is upstairs with its own ensuite shower and toilet.   It is a loft style bedroom.   The second bedroom is located downstairs in the open plan living room.   It is shared space with one queen bed that can be partitioned off with curtains for privacy. The main living room has  elegant cathedral ceilings, combustion glassfront fireplace, soft carpet floors and contemporary decor and a big comfortable sofa to sink into whilst enjoying a glass of Barossa wine. The sun-filled atrium and  spa room is a great way to relax after a long day exploring the Barossa Valley.    If you love to cook, a fully equipped kitchen is at your disposal.  But the Barossa is known for its foodie culture with its many restaurants and cafes to explore and indulge.   We can even organise  your own private inhouse chef!    Continental breakfast provisions  are provided for one morning. Off street parking is available the beautiful garden is not secure for young chi
description: Marriage proposals, weddings - it has all happened at The Chapel. Today, The Chapel is an elegantly renovated circa 1849 church in the small town of Lyndoch. The old ironstone exterior, the cathedral ceilings, contemporary decor alongside the  cottage gardens and vistas of the Barossa ranges,  make for a memorable Barossa experience and a great romantic weekend retreat and/or relaxing getaway. The Chapel has two queen beds.     The main bedroom is upstairs with its own ensuite shower and toilet.   It is a loft style bedroom.   The second bedroom is located downstairs in the open plan living room.   It is shared space with one queen bed that can be partitioned off with curtains for privacy. The sun-filled atrium and  spa room is a great way to relax after a long day exploring the
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is a delightful country town set in the southern part of the Barossa superbly positioned as the gateway into valley itself .   It is home to some great wineries, historic buildings, cafes and restaurants.
notes: Kate and Jonathan have lived locally for many years. They are well known characters. Should any need arise they can assist with suggested itineraries. Otherwise you will have the house to yourselves and will not be disturbed Please do give us a call if you do require anything.
transit: There is a taxi service but no Uber available in the area. As a special offer to our guests we can arrange a private wine tour for the day guided by Jonathan from Barossa Taste Sensations and your host at The Chapel.    Drawing on over 10 year experience  the tour focuses on the boutique wineries that highlight the diversity of this great wine region. Inquire for availability and our 'guest' rate.
access: Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk.  Our accommodation offers fully equipped  kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas . The rate is based on 2 guests (one bed) - an additional $50 will be charged per person for the second bed .
interaction: We are on call at any time to assist if needed.
host_about:
Hi
We have lived in the Barossa for 25 years.
Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa taste sensations and Kate is a Physiotherapist.
we enjoy introducing our guests to the area and have a wealth of knowledge at our finger tips to help you have a fantastic stay

name: Lucy's House
summary: Heritage Wines has renovated the original cottage on the Heritage Wines estate, which dates back to the 1850’s. Lucy’s House is a self-contained bed and breakfast for 1 couple, with a beautifully appointed bedroom and bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen. Taking in the view of the vineyards and Barossa ranges, all of which can be soaked up through the cottage windows while relaxing in the pioneer cast iron bed.
space: Generous provisions for a continental or cooked breakfast using homemade and local Barossa produce, plus a complimentary bottle of wine is provided. You are welcome to visit the winery to view Lucy’s House anytime. We look forward to any further enquiries. Included in your stay at Lucy's House:  Television Queen sized bed Air Conditioner Full Cooking Facilities Wireless Internet Electric Blankets Underfloor heating in bathroom Complimentary bottle of Heritage Wines wine Access to a decanter of Heritage Wines fortified wine 10% discount in cellar door Vasse Virgin toiletries Full Breakfast Provisions – Apex Bakery bread (Barossa made) – Thornby Fine Meat's bacon (Barossa made) – Jersey Fresh Milk (Barossa made) – Nippy’s Orange Juice (South Australian made) – Scullery Made tea (Barossa made) – Madura tea (Australian made) – Beerenburg Jams (South Australian made) – Fresh eggs (from our chickens)

name: Frond and Farro - The Loft
summary: The Loft is a beautiful 2 storey apartment with loft ceilings, recently renovated to host visitors in the Barossa Valley. The space is light and clean, furnished with modern neutrals and natural textures. All amenities are either organic, locally grown or made.  Located centrally in Tanunda, you are at walking distance to some of the best cafes, restaurants and local shopping in the Barossa.
space: The 2-storey apartment has been beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. Upstairs has 2 bedrooms, one king bed and one queen bed both with natural linen and cotton bedding. The bathroom features a large rose shower head and environmentally sustainable shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap complimentary. Also located upstairs is a toilet and laundry. The open layout downstairs includes a large kitchen with induction cooktop, dishwasher, microwave, coffee machine, kettle, fridge, toaster and large breakfast bar area. Organic teas, milk, eggs, butter, sugar, coffee, locally made bread and jam are provided complimentary. The dining area comfortably hosts 4 people and the lounge area comes with a large flat screen TV, Apple TV and complimentary WIFI so you can stream from your computer. There is also a desk in the lounge area. The second and newly renovated toilet is located downstairs. There are two private outdoor areas, one under cover for inclement weather and the o

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is one of only 4 located on a lovely quiet street, with its own private entrance and parking. Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for great access to all the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.
transit: We have a compendium in the apartment which lists all of our favourite (the best) eateries, wineries and  experiences in the Barossa. We also list the local Taxi service,  private tour operators  and walking/ bike trails for you to navigate your way around during your stay.
access: Guests have access to the whole property.
interaction: Access to the apartment is via self check in, however we are available for you to contact via phone call or text anytime. We are locals in the Barossa so we not too far away if the need arises.

name: Immerse yourself in true Barossa luxury
summary: Nestled on the ridge of Greenock in the famed Western Ridge of the Barossa Valley, The Clyde caters for the exclusive use of 2-6 people and is fully equipped for a weekend trip or a long, relaxing holiday. The main suite boasts an ensuite with rain shower & deep freestanding bath. The stunning, 3 bedroom self-contained boutique accommodation offers you the perfect base to spoil yourself, whether you venture out and immerse yourself in Barossan life, or stay in and indulge in a restful break.
space: Sparkling Inground Magnesium Pool for your private use with alfresco deck. Huge front deck with parkland views. Guests receive a complimentary bottle of Barossa Wine on arrival. The pantry will be laden with an  array of artisan-made, Barossa breakfast provisions, delicious local produce to prepare a platter at your leisure and locally made fudge. Beautiful guest toiletries by Aromatherapy Co. are supplied.  One night stays and last minute bookings may be available on request. Contact Janine on (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) for rate and availability.
description: Nestled on the ridge of Greenock in the famed Western Ridge of the Barossa Valley, The Clyde caters for the exclusive use of 2-6 people and is fully equipped for a weekend trip or a long, relaxing holiday. The main suite boasts an ensuite with rain shower & deep freestanding bath. The stunning, 3 bedroom self-contained boutique accommodation offers you the perfect base to spoil yourself, whether you venture out and immerse yourself in Barossan life, or stay in and indulge in a restful break. Sparkling Inground Magnesium Pool for your private use with alfresco deck. Huge front deck with parkland views. Guests receive a complimentary bottle of Barossa Wine on arrival. The pantry will be laden with an  array of artisan-made, Barossa breakfast provisions, delicious local produce to prepare a platter at your leisure and locally made fudge. Beautiful guest toiletries by Aromatherapy Co. are supplied.  One night stays and last minute bookings may be available on request. Contact Janine on (Ph
neighborhood_overview: The Clyde is perfectly situated for you to explore the charming village of Greenock itself – with 5 cellar doors, micro-brewery, tavern, unique shopping and the renowned El Estanco Café, all within a leisurely stroll.
notes: **Please contact Janine if you are seeking 1 night accommodation - a surcharge will apply for 1 night bookings** **Corporate Deals available for mid week stay for travelling business people. Contact Janine for availablity**
transit: The Clyde doesn't have access to public transport, however there are local taxis.
access: You will have exclusive access to the property. In light of the Covid-19 Pandemic we can certainly resonate with the uncertainty that travellers are feeling. We would like to reassure you that when staying at The Clyde you have exclusive and private access throughout the duration of your stay. We are taking extra precautions in our cleaning regime on top of the absolute thorough process that has always been our priority. (It helps that owner operator Janine has a nursing background and is fully aware of infection control ) In addition, we have now implemented a 48 hour window in between guest bookings to to allow for an uncompromised cleaning program to ensure all guests have complete peace of mind. The Barossa boasts a low population with fresh air, wide open spaces and the most glorious outdoor areas, vineyards, views and experiences!
interaction: The Clyde is exclusive property accommodation, therefore you are given total privacy. However, if you are seeking any advice to make your stay more enjoyable, you are encouraged to ring your host, Janine.
host_about: Janine and Matt have spent the last 2 years lovingly renovating this 1950's beauty. Matt has worked in the wine industry for the last 25 years and is currently a Company Director in a Vineyard Management Company supplying premium grapes to Treasury Wine Estates. Janine is a nurse and together they have 2 boys aged 21 and 15.  They live on just over an acre of land on the outskirts of Greenock.  Janine will be your host during your stay at The Clyde, ensuring you have the most ultimate accommodation experience the Barossa has to offer.

name: 'In The Vines' Guest Cottage, Barossa Valley SA
summary: Welcome Back!  With strict adherence to COVID safe best practices, we’re delighted to once more be open for guests. ‘In The Vines’ Guest Cottage, nestled among long-views of vineyards, villages & church spires. Fully appointed, our private accommodation is ideally placed to explore all that is The Barossa. Minutes from the Barossa Farmers Market, cellar doors, galleries, cafes & award winning restaurants.  Perfect for that romantic getaway, or quiet enough to focus on your business plans.
space: After a lifetime of traveling ourselves, we settled in the Barossa Valley, bought a beautiful house with a vineyard, and renovated our guest cottage.  'In The Vines' Guest Cottage has a fully equipped kitchen, queen sized bedroom with luxury linens, cosy lounge dining area, modern bathroom with walk in monsoon shower, a laundry and free WiFi. We offer you cheese and biscuits to match with the wines you've discovered, great breakfast provisions including muesli, yogurt, freshly baked local bread, homemade preserves, eggs and bacon, great espresso coffee and selection of teas.
description: Welcome Back!  With strict adherence to COVID safe best practices, we’re delighted to once more be open for guests. ‘In The Vines’ Guest Cottage, nestled among long-views of vineyards, villages & church spires. Fully appointed, our private accommodation is ideally placed to explore all that is The Barossa. Minutes from the Barossa Farmers Market, cellar doors, galleries, cafes & award winning restaurants.  Perfect for that romantic getaway, or quiet enough to focus on your business plans. After a lifetime of traveling ourselves, we settled in the Barossa Valley, bought a beautiful house with a vineyard, and renovated our guest cottage.  'In The Vines' Guest Cottage has a fully equipped kitchen, queen sized bedroom with luxury linens, cosy lounge dining area, modern bathroom with walk in monsoon shower, a laundry and free WiFi. We offer you cheese and biscuits to match with the wines you've discovered, great breakfast provisions including muesli, yogurt, freshly baked local bread, homem
neighborhood_overview: The famous weekly Barossa Farmers Market is just a kilometre away, open every Saturday morning - amazing produce, you'll also make friends in the short queue for a superb coffee. Just across from the market is the award winning Vintners Restaurant, and we are situated not far from the four main villages of Angaston, Nuriootpa, Tanunda and  Greenock. From ice creams, handcrafts, boutiques and pubs, we can recommend something to suit your preferences. Likewise, cellar-door tours, balloon flights and more can easily be arranged, all picking up from your cottage. Or just lay in one of our hammocks with a great bottle of wine and a book, we can supply most of your needs until sundown. We want you to become another returning guest, looking forward to your next stay with us - Your home from home, 'In The Vines'.
notes: We even have great mountain bikes with new helmets for daily hire. Just bring yourselves, we've thought of the rest!
transit: With little traffic, no traffic lights for miles, and only one small roundabout five kilometres away, you might enjoy driving yourselves.  However, without a designated driver and fifty or more cellar doors to visit, we can recommend great value tours, in classic cars, motorcycles, or modern limousines. The local taxi companies are also reasonable for return trips back from lunch. We can always arrange to collect your car the following morning. Alternately, ask about our bicycles for hire,  or if you're up for an easy five kilometre walk with five cellar doors on route, you'll be home before you know it - Just ask us how.
access: When staying at 'In The Vines' Guest Cottage, you are welcome to walk around the entire vineyard, ideally keeping to the perimeter tracks. Or, just lie back in one of the hammocks for two!
interaction: Being a working vineyard, we are never far from the property.  Always happy to offer suggestions for cellar doors to discover, perfect local lunch or dinner spots, or almost anything else we can assist you with. Perhaps a glass of wine, a sundowner, if we catch each other. We can also appreciate you might just want some P&Q (peace & quiet), just let us know in your booking, or on arrival.
host_about: Andrew and I are an easygoing couple, enjoying our life out in the country where we grow grapes, tend our fruit trees, and enjoy mixing within the local community spirit that is country Australia. Let us introduce you to some new friends too!

name: Ten on French
summary: At Ten on French you can enjoy modern style living with all amenities. Features include separate lounge, fully equipped self catering kitchen and dining room, LCD TV and DVD player, air-con, gas ‘log fire’ heating. There are 3 bedrooms, two  with queen beds and one single bed with quality linen and quilts. The bathroom has lush towels and modern vanity and shower. Outdoors there is undercover parking, a barbecue/outdoor entertaining area.  There is so much to enjoy within walking distance.

name: Mataro Cottage Tanunda - Stunning Accomodation
summary: Mataro cottage is a renovated 1925 cottage offering 2 bedrooms, separate lounge room with leather lounges, stunning full bathroom with second toilet located off the fully equipped laundry. Beautiful open kitchen with high quality appliances. Separate dining area overlooking the garden.  Fireplace combustion heater in lounge room, combustion heater in kitchen and oil coil heaters in all rooms. Evaporative air-conditioning cooler to all rooms. Outdoors offers a patio area with seating.
space: Mataro Cottage is positioned in the beautiful historic district of Tanunda surrounded by churches and other character homes. Located only 150 metres from the main street of Tanunda it is an easy walk to restaurants, wineries, cafes and retail shops.

name: JHA Stone Cellar
summary: The JHA Stone Cellar is a blend of old and new with thick stone walls and large glass windows for wonderful farm views.  2 king bedrooms, both with en-suite bathroom, (1 bedroom splits to two king singles if required), large living area, butlers pantry, mud room and 3rd toilet. An out door shower, under floor heating, air-conditioning and quality fittings through out giving our guests an exceptionally relaxed experience.
space: The J.H.A. Stone Cellar is a purpose built refurbishment of one of the oldest remaining stone buildings on the property. Sitting on a gentle slope in the north west corner of the farm, looking over the old vine Shiraz vineyard, this two bedroom premium accommodation is the ultimate escape.
description: The JHA Stone Cellar is a blend of old and new with thick stone walls and large glass windows for wonderful farm views.  2 king bedrooms, both with en-suite bathroom, (1 bedroom splits to two king singles if required), large living area, butlers pantry, mud room and 3rd toilet. An out door shower, under floor heating, air-conditioning and quality fittings through out giving our guests an exceptionally relaxed experience. The J.H.A. Stone Cellar is a purpose built refurbishment of one of the oldest remaining stone buildings on the property. Sitting on a gentle slope in the north west corner of the farm, looking over the old vine Shiraz vineyard, this two bedroom premium accommodation is the ultimate escape. Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in) Also a great experience is to v
neighborhood_overview: Angaston township is 10 minutes away by car with specialty shops as well as all the services that might be required. The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike tracks, parks and 2 golf courses.
notes: Hutton Vale Farm has been in our family for 174 years, we welcome sharing an understanding of this land and the wider Barossa with you.
transit: Car is best, push bikes/scooters can be hired in Angaston, cellar door hop on/hop off bus available within the Barossa. Loan car available for fly in guests (prior notice req'd)
access: Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in) Also a great experience is to visit the Barossa Farmers market (10 minute drive) to collect a range of local produce. Every Saturday 7:30am til 11am, but get in early! Hutton Vale Farm Produce currently available: Eggs $5 per doz Lamb Leg Roast (bone in) $14.50/kg (approx. 2-3kg) Lamb Leg Easy Carve $16.99/kg (approx. 2 - 2.5kg) Butterfly Leg $16.50/kg (approx. 2 kg) Lamb Racks $29.00/kg  Slow Roast Shoulder $11.99/kg (approx 2.5 - 4kg) Chutneys $10 each Website, contact details for food orders:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
interaction: We will greet you on arrival to familiarise you with the building and the farm.
house_rules: - Events/Dinner parties are ok for the guests staying on farm only (no additional persons without prior agreement)
host_about: I am part of a mixed family farm in the Barossa, with a strong interest in food and wine.

name: Tomfoolery Winemaker's Cottage - Barossa Valley
summary: Situated at the home of Tomfoolery Wines in the Barossa Valley, this newly renovated cottage is only about an hours drive north of Adelaide. Located on the 20 acre winery property it is complete with all of the luxuries to enjoy your time away, including a king sized bed, a large spa, robes, Sheridan towels, wine and a full lounge area to relax in.
space: Guests are able to walk through the vineyard and stroll through the orchard where they can help themselves to fresh fruit and veggies - season dependent. Also if you visit during the harvest season you are welcome to visit the team at the winery and see the production in full swing, we may even get you to lend a hand. A two night stay has generous inclusions such as free wi-fi, Nespresso Machine, beer, wines, cheese, local muesli, bacon & eggs, juice, Molten Brown and Vasse Virgin amenities, Robes & Slippers, Netflix and much more. There is also an indoor pool which is exclusively for guests and is available to use during warmer months. We also offer our guests 10 percent off all purchases made in the Cellar Door which is adjacent to the cottage and of course can help you freight your goodies home. There is also the option to arrive by Helicopter as the property is equipped with its own helipad!
description: Situated at the home of Tomfoolery Wines in the Barossa Valley, this newly renovated cottage is only about an hours drive north of Adelaide. Located on the 20 acre winery property it is complete with all of the luxuries to enjoy your time away, including a king sized bed, a large spa, robes, Sheridan towels, wine and a full lounge area to relax in. neighborhood_overview: The Farmers' Market which opens every Saturday morning is just up the road so you can explore all the local produce the Barossa has to offer and top up on fresh supplies. The three major towns of the Barossa Valley are all located within 10 minutes of the cottage and there are many other wineries and a variety of restaurants close by making it a fabulous location for a wine region getaway.
transit: There are a number of local tour operators in the region if you are looking for someone to drive you around for the day, please get in touch for further details.
access: Guests have exclusive use of the cottage, pool area, orchard and garden during their stay.
interaction: The place if yours when you arrive and of course we are always available to contact via phone or email leading up to and including your stay to answer any questions you may have and of course the Cellar Door staff are always most helpful and happy to share their local knowledge. We also offer a tour of the winery and tasting with the wine maker (subject to availability) for those who are interested.
host_about:
Hi - I am Sarah. A Mum of 2 who is passionate about making sure our guests have the best stay every time.
We also own and operate a boutique winery in the beautiful Barossa. And we love what we do!

name: Williamstown Bed and Breakfast
summary: BRAND NEW BAROSSA ACCOMMODATION IN WILLIAMSTOWN. The Williamstown B & B is the perfect Barossa getaway for up to 6 guests. Located in the cosy town of Williamstown our beautifully renovated house is full of history and is conveniently located close to shops, bakery, restaurants, wineries and tourist attractions.
space: The 'Old' Cottage have been complete re-furbished for comfortable living -  everything is NEW! Our location is right in the heart of Williamstown on Queen Street which is easy to find and access.   You'll love venturing out for the day to wineries, events and attractions but more so coming home to relax and get comfy.
description: BRAND NEW BAROSSA ACCOMMODATION IN WILLIAMSTOWN. The Williamstown B & B is the perfect Barossa getaway for up to 6 guests. Located in the cosy town of Williamstown our beautifully renovated house is full of history and is conveniently located close to shops, bakery, restaurants, wineries and tourist attractions. The 'Old' Cottage have been complete re-furbished for comfortable living -  everything is NEW! Our location is right in the heart of Williamstown on Queen Street which is easy to find and access.   You'll love venturing out for the day to wineries, events and attractions but more so coming home to relax and get comfy. You have the whole house and back area to enjoy. We live 100m back behing your accommodation and are close by if you require assistance or directions. We live on our property 100m back behind your accommodation.  We share a driveway and you'll see me (Dianne) typically soon after arrival.  You can call me anytime. Being on the main street of Williamstown, you have
neighborhood_overview: Being on the main street of Williamstown, you have shops, eateries and wineries within walking distance.  Our famous mural wall at the local creek is 75 metres away.
notes: We are honey producers and bee keepers (not on the property!) at remote locations for collecting nector.  At the right time of year, we are extracting honey from the hives and we'd love to show you our processing facilities which is a short walking distance from your accommodation. Samples of our honey are complimentary when you stay with us.
transit: There is parking available on the property. There is no public transport. There are local tour operators for wineries and platters!
access: You have the whole house and back area to enjoy. We live 100m back behing your accommodation and are close by if you require assistance or directions.
interaction: We live on our property 100m back behind your accommodation.  We share a driveway and you'll see me (Dianne) typically soon after arrival.  You can call me anytime.

name: Barossa Valley Gundaroo - we offer 1 night stays
summary: Gundaroo retreat is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and set on 50 acres of picturesque land with rolling farmland, trees and hills.  Perfect for a romantic getaway or a girls weekend away.  The cottage is set in a scenic location and provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences.  It has 2 bedrooms with queen size beds a cosy wood fire and a lovely deck to relax and enjoy your morning coffee.  We provide breakfast provisions and a complimentary bottle of wine.
space: The cottage is attached to the main house and separated by an outdoor entertaining area.  We are a working alpaca farm and can offer interaction with the alpacas depending on weather and availability.  Please let us know when booking if you would like to interact with them. We also offer a bottle of wine on arrival and have a Nespresso coffee machine available as well as a range of teas.  We also provide bacon, eggs and milk. We havent been on the property for very long and are renovating and also re establishing the gardens.
description: Gundaroo retreat is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and set on 50 acres of picturesque land with rolling farmland, trees and hills.  Perfect for a romantic getaway or a girls weekend away.  The cottage is set in a scenic location and provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences. We havent been on the property for very long and are renovating and also
neighborhood_overview: There are so many places to visit that are quite close to us.  Birdwood with the motor museum is 5 minutes drive away, Gumeracha with the big rocking horse and wildlife park is 10 minutes.  If you like fishing or kayaking, the Williamstown reservoir is less than 10 minutes down the road.  There is also the Lavender farm at Williamstown and the wineries at Lyndoch are about 20 minutes away.  If you enjoy walking, Mt Crawford forest is also less than 10 minutes away.  There are some beautiful cafes  and local pubs in all of the towns that are close by.  Tanunda wineries are approx 30 minutes away and also the Barossa valley Chocolate Company.  Mount Pleasant is approx 5 minutes away, so if you are going to a horse show we are close by if you want to stay.  Monarto zoo is also approx 40 minutes away.
transit: You need a car to get around here or you could bring bikes and go for a bike ride.  There are nice walking tracks approx 5 minutes drive awayl
interaction: We live on the farm so will be available as much or as little as you would like.  If you would like to be left alone you will hardly see us, if you would like to know a bit about the farm feel free to let us know and we are quite happy to take you for a walk and into the paddocks with the animals.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Finniss, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

name: Ironstone on Jollytown *Contactless Self Check-In*
summary: A characterful ironstone cottage located in the heart of the Barossa. Equipped with all the modern amenities for the most discerning guest. The interior is a mix of contemporary and old to give the cottage a light, bright and airy feel while remaining true to it’s longstanding heritage. Situated on a large block, the garden wraps around the cottage to provide many places in which to relax and unwind.
space: This beautiful ironstone cottage built in the mid 1860’s is located in Lyndoch; a quaint and historic town situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The cottage has been newly renovated with a fresh, modern interior, but is also sympathetic to it’s historical roots with the incorporation of lovely antique pieces sourced from the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. It features all the modern amenities, including a fully equiped kitchen, laundry area with washing machine, split system air conditioning, electric fireplace, large two person spa bath, Wi-Fi connectivity and Netflix enabled Smart TV. The main street of Lyndoch is also within walking distance where you will find Lagana’s General Store, the local butcher, Lyndoch Bakery and other pubs, restaurants and cafes in which to indulge in our famous local produce. Although close to the main street, the property is nestled in a peaceful corner of the lyndoch township. The large cottage style garden is the perfect place to unwind with a good
description: A characterful ironstone cottage located in the heart of the Barossa. Equipped with all the modern amenities for the most discerning guest. The interior is a mix of contemporary and old to give the cottage a light, bright and airy feel while remaining true to it’s longstanding heritage. Situated on a large block, the garden wraps around the cottage to provide many places in which to relax and unwind. This beautiful ironstone cottage built in the mid 1860’s is located in Lyndoch; a quaint and historic town situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The cottage has been newly renovated with a fresh, modern interior, but is also sympathetic to it’s historical roots with the incorporation of lovely antique pieces sourced from the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. It features all the modern amenities, including a fully equiped kitchen, laundry area with washing machine, split system air conditioning, electric fireplace, large two person spa bath, Wi-Fi connectivity and Netflix enabled Smart TV.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is quiet and full of friendly people who always seem to be willing to stop for a chat. The lyndoch hotel is a short 15 minute walk down the road. If you prefer a glass of wine over a beer however, the lovely Reis Creek cellar door is situated just opposite. Lyndoch is a fantastic location as it is central in relation to many wineries and cellar doors. Barossa Chateau, Kies Family Wines, Kellermeister and Chateau Yaldara are all within 5 minutes driving distance of the accomodation. If you are looking to partake in a spot of golf, Sandy Creek Golf Club is a short 5 minute drive, while the Tanunda Pines Golf Club is located only 10 minutes away from the accomodation.
notes: Our garden attracts a lovely array of bird life including Honey Eaters, Willy Wag Tails, Kookaburras, Rosellas and Grass Parrots. The above ground cellar located at the back of the garden is also home to our resident Brushtail Possum ‘Jolly’ and her offspring. Jolly is incredibly friendly and welcomes being hand fed. She and her baby can often be found hanging out in the almond tree around dusk.
transit: Lyndoch is a great central location with quick access to other Barossa townships such as Tanunda, Rowland Flat, Nuriootpa and Angaston. It is also a short trip into Gawler which features many interesting shops, cafes and restaurants as well as access to the train line into the Adelaide CBD. The ‘Link SA’ Angaston to Gawler bus route also runs through Lyndoch, with a bus stop located on Gilbert St.
interaction: We want to ensure that your stay is both a comfortable and enjoyable one. We can offer flexible servicing across extended stays and will be available anytime to answer questions you may have about the accomodation or the local area. We want our guests to leave relaxed and refreshed, so please make yourself at home during your stay and enjoy the all of the ammenities the cottage has to offer.
host_about: Brooke & Peter are Barossa Valley locals. Peter was born in Queensland and moved to South Australia to pursue a career in winemaking. Brooke is a born and bred Barossan who recently traded in her career in the wine industry to become a full time renovator and Air BnB host.

name: Tal Haus - In the heart of the Barossa Valley
summary: In the heart of the Barossa!  This well appointed home is perfectly located in the centre of Tanunda.  Tal Haus is on the main street, and a just a 3 minute stroll to some of the region's finest restaurants and wine bars.   It is an older style home - built in 1928, it is a little piece of Barossa history and a great location to explore all that the region has to offer.   Tal Haus offers all the comforts of home - suitable for couples wanting a relaxed getaway or a family who needs some space.
space: There are two bedrooms with luxury queen beds. The large living space offers dining for up to 8 people and one of the sofas can be converted into a queen bed also.   The kitchen has everything you need, so you can cook up a storm or wander down to one of the local eateries.  Full use of laundry facilities, free WiFi and access to Stan Streaming Service so you can watch all the latest television shows and movies.  There is a cosy nook on the front porch where you can watch the world go by - facing on to the Main Street of Tanunda.  One bathroom with shower and a seperate toilet.

neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is in the heart of the Barossa so you can head in all directions and find lots of things to see and do - including some of the world's best food and wine.  Some of our favourites that are five minutes walk away include.... Ferment Asian - one of Australia's finest modern Asian.  Not only is the food great, the award winning wine list is something to behold - (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Vino Lokal - Wine Bar, Restaurant and Tasting room you can sample some of the region's finest from wine producers.  It is the home of Artisans of the Barossa which includes John Duvall, Hobbs of the Barossa, Spinifex, Sons of Eden and Schwarz Wine Co.  And the food offerings from the Chef, Ryan Edwards are absolutely sensational.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Musque - is the epitome of a modern eatery and bar, they have over 500 gins to sample but you can get a decent bottle of local wine, grab a burger or enjoy a more sophisticated dining experience. (Website hidden by Airbnb)  If these don't flo
notes: Tal Haus is on the main street, which means it is really accessible and easy to get to things but it can be busy during the day.  Also, as mentioned in the amenities section, there is only one bathroom with a seperate toilet.
transit: Tanunda is very walkable and you see a lot without having to go too far but if you would like to explore the Barossa a car is required.  Don't fret if you don't have one - there are plenty of great tour companies that can show you the Valley and the local cab service is very accommodating.  If you are feeling more energetic the Visitor Centre offers bike hire - just a short stroll from Tas Haus
interaction: We have been locals to the Barossa for ten years and you are welcome to call us if you are looking for some suggestions to occupy your time in the Barossa.  There is a detailed portfolio located at the property which gives you some idea of what is on offer - food, wine and culture are in abundance here in the Barossa.  If you are a little unsure n you are welcome to give us a call and we can help you decide.  And of course, if there is any issue with the property or any of the amenities, we are happy to come around and sort things out.
house_rules: - Smoking outside only - The price for a couple includes the use of one bed - if both beds are used an extra linen charge of $40.00 will be requested.   - Talk to us about pets - we can be flexible.
host_about: I am anArts and Cultural Consultant with my own company Play Your Part.  Married, 2 kids living in the beautiful Barossa Valley.  We are not locals but have lived in the region since 2009 and have gotten to know the place really well.  I am a pretty social person - I love a long lunch, visiting galleries and museums or a day out with friends at the pub but could quite happily spend a day at home in front of the fire.

name: Rogasch Cottage
summary: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley and nestled amidst 9 acres of vineyard, this fully renovated 1860's cottage is only 5 minutes walk to Tanunda's coffee shops and restaurants With magnificent vineyard and rural views you can enjoy a glass of wine whilst relaxing in the heated plunge pool or enjoying the comfort of an open fire place. Did we mention there is also access to your own private cellar ;-)
space: The Cottage is adjourning  to our Family home , where you are more than welcome to have a tour of our own micro winery and sample some wine made from the vineyard that you will over look if you wish .  The cottage has access to its own private driving range , plus many many more hidden gems tucked away.

name: Ruby’s Residence: LOCATION - cozy - WIFI - netflix
summary: A sister to Lavender Cottage Barossa. A cozy place in central Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100m from the main street: - under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian  and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre, - easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy, - 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park, - 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum.
space: *A clean modern spacious 3 bedroom house with en-suite as well as a bathroom with a separate bath and shower. *Free WiFi with BOSE internet radio or bluetooth from your phone. *Large screen TV with free NETFLIX and Apple TV. *Quality linen, towels and toiletries. *Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine also washing machine, dryer, hair-dryer and iron. *A secure undercover parking and adjacent free street parking. *Backyard with small garden and Weber BBQ.
description: A sister to Lavender Cottage Barossa. A cozy place in central Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100m from the main street: - under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian  and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre, - easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy, - 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park, - 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum. *A clean modern spacious 3 bedroom house with en-suite as well as a bathroom with a separate bath and shower. *Free WiFi with BOSE internet radio or bluetooth from your phone. *Large screen TV with free NETFLIX and Apple TV. *Quality linen, towels and toiletries. *Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine also washing machine, dryer, hair-dryer and iron. *A secure undercover parking and adjacent free street parking. *Backyard with small garden and Weber BBQ. All areas. Only guests regi
neighborhood_overview: Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.  The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.  We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
notes: IMPORTANT! *Our rate is based on 2 guests (one bed) only and we assume you would like to take our master bedroom with en-suite (Bedroom 1),  unless you request otherwise. After the first 2 guests, there will be an additional $75 per person, per night. *Despite our central location, the neighborhood is very quiet so please  respect other’s privacy. *No cleaning is required on your last day as we have a certain cleaning procedure for our next guests. But please leave the house tidy.  *A complimentary cleaning service+changing linen every 7th day. *A complimentary BASIC breakfast is provided (cereal, juice, coffee, tea, fruits, eggs, butter, milk and jam. For bread, please visit our iconic Barossa Apex Bakery**, which is only 2 houses away). ** APEX Bakery opening hours: Mon to Fri 08.30 - 17.30 Sat 08.00 - 14.00 Sun CLOSED Please also read our GUIDEBOOK which is under LOCATION/map.
transit: SA Link bus stop can be reached within a 10 minute walk. Local taxis are also available at call.
access: All areas. Only guests registered with Airbnb are allowed to stay overnight.
interaction: We live locally and can quickly assist with your enquiries.
house_rules: - Visitors are not permitted to stay overnight with our guests in our property. - Please BYO towels/linens if you think your hair dye and/or fake tan may stain ours. Thank you for your understanding. - No drinking & eating in bedrooms. - No cleaning on your last day as we have our own cleaning procedure for the next guests. - No pet due to allergic issue of friends and family who regularly are staying here. - Please be respectful to our neighbours.
host_about:
We live in Tanunda which my husband has called home for 30+ years and we both enjoy music, food, wine, travel, and much more. 

With these passions, we will try our best to make your stay enjoyable in this lovely wine region. 

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

*Lee-sa

name: Tamu Barossa
summary: Tamu Barossa is a fully self contained guest house with a blend of classic and modern design set on our lush two-acre property a mere 3 minute drive from the quaint little town of Lyndoch, the gateway to the Barossa Valley. It is separate from our main house so you will have full privacy to enjoy our cosy guesthouse. The name ‘Tamu’ means ‘sweet’ in Swahili and ‘guest’ in Malay. A happy coincidence that pays homage to Kenya and Malaysia, where my husband and I originated from.
space: At Tamu you can relax on your private verandah and sip some local wine or enjoy a delectable cup of tea. Take a stroll and wander around our property. We have a variety of young fruit trees, herbs, flowers and there are a lot of established gum trees and cypress pine which attract a number of birds such as the Rainbow Lorikeet, Kookaburra and honeyeaters. You will also be able to meet the kangaroos that hop in and out of our property to graze. Our landscaping is a work in progress so please do bear with us. Our guesthouse can accommodate a maximum of 2 adults and 1 child. Tamu’s amenities include: - Split system heating and cooling units in the Bedroom and     Living Room - Two king single beds that can be separated or put together     to create one large king bed (please advise us of your     preference). -  We can provide a single foam mattress with linen and beddings that can be placed on the floor to be used by your child.  - Portacot with mattress and linen, baby bathtub, changing

It is separate from our main house so you will have full privacy to enjoy our cosy guesthouse. The name ‘Tamu’ means ‘sweet’ in Swahili and ‘guest’ in Malay. neighborhood_overview: We are just a 13 minute drive to Tanunda the cosmopolitan heart of the Barossa with the best restaurants, entertainment and cellar doors.  Award winning winery Kellermeister is just a two minute drive from us. The winery is rated in the top 7% of Australian producers by Australia's acclaimed wine critic, James Halliday. For those who are a bit more adventurous, the Altona CSR Landcare Reserve which is highly rated on Tripadvisor Australia is located just opposite our property. It has a 6km walking track and is a great place to observe the wildlife and vegetation. Or you could wander down on to the Barossa Trail which is a shared cycling and walking path that goes from the outskirts of Gawler through Lyndoch, Rowland Flat, Tanunda, Nuriootpa to Angaston.
house_rules: No shoes or outside footwear to be worn in the house. Please remove your shoes and place them on the shoe rack located in the Entrance/Foyer of the house. You can use the house slippers provided or bring your own house slippers. Please switch off all air-conditioning units, lights and television when you leave the guesthouse. We utilise solar panels and also endeavour to keep our carbon footprint low. The Verandah lights can be left on if you are returning when it is dark.  No consumption of illegal drugs including marijuana on the property. Quiet hours are between 8pm and 10am. No outside visitors or overnight guests without prior approval from your host. Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. This includes downloads. If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. Do not leave any food out that will attract uninvited pests. Our guesthouse is pest-free and we would like to keep it that way with your help.
host_about:
I made the tree change with my husband Kipi and our two children in 2017 having lived half my life in Melbourne's hip and busy inner suburbs and the prior half in Malaysia. Now I enjoy a slower paced life surrounded by beautiful nature and amazing people.  

I love cooking and entertaining friends and family around my table. Our little family also enjoys travelling, particularly back to Malaysia and Kenya to visit our big families.

We renovated and converted the run down pottery studio on our property to a charming little guesthouse for our friends and family to stay when they visit us. We are happy to share our slice of paradise with travellers and holidaymakers. Meeting new people is always a pleasure and I look forward to hosting you and making your stay a comfortable and memorable one.

name: River Cottage★Private Oasis★Fresh Air★Wine★Pets
summary: Relax on the Para River in a renovated 150 yr old cottage with a light filled and spacious extension -- perfect for a peaceful country getaway. Located on 30 acre property with sensational 360 degree rural views.  You have your own private oasis yet your only 5 minutes from the picturesque township of Angaston and your nearest wineries.

neighborhood_overview: The home is located on a 30 acre property in the heart of the Barossa. You are perfectly positioned for easy access to many of  the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.    We are a 5 min drive from the pretty village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  restaurants,  pubs,  supermarket,  butcher, bakeries, specialty retail stores, a medical centre, hospital and post office for your convenience.  We are a short 7 min drive to the famed Barossa Valley Farmers market in the picturesque township of Angaston, which is open on  Saturday mornings from 7.30am.  This is on our must do list.  The nearest winery cellar door is a three minute drive and you are five to fifteen minutes to the major Barossa townships. If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails with some easy bush walks through Kaiser Stuhl National Park.  This is best visited at dusk to do some kangaroo spotting.   Or you coul
notes: **Please advise the following at time of booking: 1. If you wish to use the portacot, or high chair 2. If you require extra linen for the sofa bed in the living area to accommodate extra guests. In the cooler months firewood is provided for the slow combustion heater & the bedrooms have radiators. We don't have central heating.  There is Reverse Cycle heating and cooling in the main living area and fans in the bedrooms.  Please use power & water with respect to the environment & to help keep our accommodation cost low, ie, turn off air conditioning while you are out.
transit: You will need a car to access our home.  There is no public transport in the region other than a taxi cab service and the occasional Uber.

interaction: We are available for you during your stay, but our level of interaction is up to you.    If you need anything, give us a call or reach out through Airbnb. You will be able to self check-in upon arrival.
house_rules: There is an open Cellar close to the entry which may pose a safety hazard to your children if unsupervised whilst outside.  For his reason we accommodate only accommodate children over 7 yrs & Babies (not yet walking). Only the number of guests booked are to stay overnight. Lost keys will incur a charge of AU$200 for replacement. - The house is to be left clean and in the condition it was given. Please wash and put away all dishes. No need to strip the beds, the cleaner will do that. All lights and air conditioning are to be turned off when leaving the property. All doors and windows to property to be closed/locked when leaving. Failure to adhere to these rules may result in immediate eviction and loss of security deposit. You must also acknowledge: Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged the cost of replacement or fixing, a minimum of $300. If you open it, close it; if you borrow it, return it; if you turn it on, turn it off; if you break it, tell us; if you use
host_about:
I've lived with my partner and 3 gorgeous children in the Beautiful Barossa Valley, South Australia for over 40 years. We enjoy spending time outdoors with our family on our 30 acre property.
We have both worked in the wine and Tourism Industry for the last 20 years and understand the importance of great guest experiences. We have travelled extensively and experienced all types of accommodation.  I have been able to use what I have learnt to create a very successful Airbnb business (Air Stay Hosting).
I have a keen interest and passion in real estate and travel and now enjoy combining both by hosting properties through Airbnb. We love creating beautiful, comfortable spaces that our guests can call "home" and pride ourselves in offering a 5 star service. Our aim is that our guests never want to leave!

name: Devitt on French, quiet, romantic, self contained
summary: Devitt on French B&B is a step back to the old charms of yesteryear with the modern amenities that make for the perfect escape to the Barossa Valley. Complete privacy with a magnificent look out from the front verandah for your morning coffee.  Ideally set amongst the oldest houses in Angaston shaded by Jacaranda and fruit trees, this quiet street is an easy walking distance to the main street coffee shops, wine tasting rooms,  popular restaurants, and more.  Check yourself in on arrival.
space: Newly renovated with style and charm this 2 bedroom luxurious cottage was built in the late 1800's from marble quarried on site.  A fully equipped kitchen that will entice you to become the creative chief.    A collection of antiques including crockery that are to be used and enjoyed during your stay to experience high tea at its best.  BBQ facilities available with outdoor fire pit and a bath tub and shower that will exceed all expectations.  Breakfast essentials available; Nespresso Delonghi coffee, tea and more are part of your breakfast hamper on arrival. Enjoy the comfort of the modern  lounge after completing your fine dining at the 1940's dining table set out in style with crockery of the same era.   Enjoy the view from the front verandah for breakfast while overlooking the extended lawn and garden area. Angaston main street is a short 5 min walk away with shops, cafe's, ATM,  bakery, butcher, local parkland, GP rooms, chemist, supermarket open 7 days per week until 8pm and all
