neighborhood_overview: Angaston is known as the Jewel of the Barossa and has many great coffee shops, wine tasting rooms , cellar doors  and restaurants from pizza, Italian cuisine, modern Australian to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company are all a short walk away. Or hire a bike from Angaston Hardware shop to ride the bike tracks of the Barossa or book a Barossa wine tour that can show you the sights and memorable places of the region.
transit: Devitt on French is centrally located so you can walk or ride a bike easily to many venues and visitor locations.  Taxi services are available along with numerous wine tours.  Link SA public transport is available, see their website for details.
access: Guests will have full access to the cottage, front lawn area and back patio area.
interaction: Hosts are available to assist you at any time during your stay (via private phone or email). Access – There is a key safe on  the property for easy access.
house_rules: Please hand wash antique crockery. Use dishwasher for non antiques. No internal fires in fire places they are decoration only. Please leave towels in the bath on leaving.
host_about: I am married with 2 children and live on a farm where we bread Angas Beef cattle and Dorper sheep.  I am an artists and involved in arts and cultural engagement in the Barossa

name: Beautiful guest suite in the Barossa Valley
summary: Our Africa Inspired guest room in the beautiful Barossa Valley has vineyard views,  has a separate entrance and is self contained with a walk in robe and ensuite toilet.  We have a tennis court and swimming pool onsite and available to guests.

name: Greenock's Old Telegraph Station
summary: Escape, Relax, Unwind, Explore..... Experience all that the Barossa Valley has to offer from your home away from home in this restored heritage cottage located in a charming village.
space: The cottage is for your exclusive use when you stay. It offers accommodation for up to five guests. There are two bedrooms (one containing a queen bed, the other a double bed and a sofa bed). The separate lounge room has comfy couches, with television and a selection of DVDs to watch. The self catering kitchen contains a cooktop, microwave, fridge, tea and coffee making facilities. The large bathroom contains a 2 person spa with shower over, hand basin and toilet. There is also a washing machine.  Heating and cooling is provided by reverse cycle air conditioning and a combustion heater.  Outdoors, in the fully enclosed rear garden (pets welcome by negotiation) is a gas barbecue with hood, undercover table and seating.

name: Milk + Honey House
summary: Milk + Honey House is a self-contained cottage offering beautiful rustic French/Hamptons style décor and a range of features for your comfort and enjoyment all year round. The accommodation includes two beautiful double bedrooms both with queen size beds and white sun dried cotton bed linen, plus an additional single bed ottoman in the larger bedroom (designed mostly for the use of a child).
space: You can relax in the gorgeous comfortable lounge room, large eat in kitchen, modern bathroom with MOR toiletries and white fluffy towels. There is a separate toilet with powder room, full laundry facilities, shaded outdoor eating area in a landscaped garden and driveway to undercover parking. The house has reverse cycle air-conditioning in every room, a flat screen television and DVD player, iPod dock, full kitchen facilities including dishwasher, coffee machine and microwave. Continental breakfast provisions along with a bottle of Barossa wine are also included in the price. Exclusively yours, this cottage has the best of both worlds with all the character, warmth and charm of a heritage listed property with the convenience and comfort of a newly renovated cottage. Tariff includes all linen, MOR toiletries, provisions for a continental breakfast along with a  bottle of Barossa wine. A mid-stay refresh service is provided for stays of 6 nights or more. name: Lavender Cottage BAROSSA - Location! Location!
summary: A cozy place centrally located in Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100 metres from the main street: - under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian  and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre, - easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy, - 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park, - 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum.
space: THE SPACE & CONTENTS: *A clean modern spacious 3 bedroom house with en-suite as well as a bathroom with a separate bath and shower. *Free WiFi. *Large screen TV with free NETFLIX and Apple TV. *Quality linen, towels and toiletries. *Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine also washing machine, hair-dryer and iron. *A secure undercover parking and adjacent free street parking. *Backyard with garden and Weber BBQ.

All areas. We live locally and can quickly assist with your enquiries. Elizabeth Street is one
neighborhood_overview: Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.  The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.  We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
notes: *Despite our central location, the neighborhood is very quiet so please  respect other’s privacy. *No cleaning is required on your last day as we have a certain cleaning procedure for our next guests. But please leave the house tidy.  *A complimentary cleaning service+changing linen every 7th day. *A complimentary BASIC breakfast is provided (cereal, juice, coffee, tea, fruits, eggs, butter, milk and jam. For bread, please visit our iconic Barossa Apex Bakery**, which is only 1 house away). **  Mon to Fri 08.30 - 17.30 Sat 08.00 - 14.00 Sun CLOSED Please also read our GUIDEBOOK which is under LOCATION/map.
transit: SA Link bus stop can be reached within a 10 minute walk. Local taxis are also available at call.
access: All areas.
interaction: We live locally and can quickly assist with your enquiries.
house_rules: - Visitors are not permitted to stay overnight with our guests in our property. - Please BYO towels/linens if you think your hair dye and/or fake tan may stain ours. Thank you for your understanding. - No drinking & eating in bedrooms. - No cleaning on your last day as we have our own cleaning procedure for the next guests. - No pet due to allergic issue of friends and family who regularly are staying here. - Please be respectful to our neighbours.
host_about:
We live in Tanunda which my husband has called home for 30+ years and we both enjoy music, food, wine, travel, and much more. 

With these passions, we will try our best to make your stay enjoyable in this lovely wine region. 

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

*Lee-sa

name: Teresa Garden
summary: Teresa Garden vineyard villa situates in the famous wine region - Barossa. It is surrounded in the vineyard and fresh farm atmosphere. It is the perfect location for you, as a group of family or friends to enjoy the peaceful and country lifestyle. No matter you are coming to visit wineries or just enjoy a get-away from your busy daily life, you will definitely love the stay in here.

summary: Kaesler Cottages are centrally located on the Kaesler Vineyard and Winery property. Each new renovated cottage offers 1 bedroom, ensuite with spa, and tea and coffee making facilities. A stunning vineyard setting, sit outside and read a book, and relax.

summary: Very stylish, modern beautiful resort style living in the Heart of the Barossa. name: The Smiths Cottage
summary: In the heart of the Barossa, and within a short stroll of beautiful Angaston, you will find The Smiths Cottage - your perfect home away from home and a great base from which to explore the best of the Barossa.  Come home from a day in the valley to your own cottage where you can put your feet up, pour (another) wine and take in the ambience.  The property consists of a contemporary & spacious two bedroom cottage that sleeps 4 - and a glamping tent that can be booked additionally to sleep 2 more.
space: The stunning glamping tent in the garden is fully decked out with a king size bed and plenty of area to lounge and relax after a day in the valley.  If you would like to include the tent in your booking then you must book for 5 or 6 people.  If you are booking for 4 or less people then the tent will not be included automatically.  If you would like to use the tent - regardless of the number of guests - just pop 5 people in the booking details and it will be made up and ready to go on your arrival.  An additional charge of $50 per person applies.
description: In the heart of the Barossa, and within a short stroll of beautiful Angaston, you will find The Smiths Cottage - your perfect home away from home and a great base from which to explore the best of the Barossa.  Come home from a day in the valley to your own cottage where you can put your feet up, pour (another) wine and take in the ambience.  The property consists of a contemporary & spacious two bedroom cottage that sleeps 4 - and a glamping tent that can be booked additionally to sleep 2 more. The stunning glamping tent in the garden is fully decked out with a king size bed and plenty of area to lounge and relax after a day in the valley.  If you would like to include the tent in your booking then you must book for 5 or 6 people.  If you are booking for 4 or less people then the tent will not be included automatically.  If you would like to use the tent - regardless of the number of guests - just pop 5 people in the booking details and it will be made up and ready to go on your arriv
neighborhood_overview: There are plenty of great places to explore in the Barossa and you will find a list of my favourite places on the bench when you arrive.  But if you are only here for a short time - and you want to experience the best that the Barossa has to offer, then I suggest that you pre book a couple of exceptional experiences.  Vintners Restaurant - an outside table for lunch on a weekend is perfection , Casa Carboni - so special it is only open for dinner on Fridays... or you can book in for a cooking school and double up the experience with a new skill!
transit: You’ll probably want a car during your stay to access the best of the Barossa. The cottage is located conveniently and has two off street parking spaces. There is also a great taxi service if you’re heading out for dinner and want to enjoy a wine or two.
access: Guests have private access to the entire property.  In addition to the indoor spaces there are plenty of beautiful spots in the garden to read a book... listen to the birds... enjoy a quiet drink.  And if you have booked for 5 or 6 people then the glamping tent will be all yours too!
interaction: Guests can touch base with me via phone or email if required at any time in the lead up and during their stay.
host_about:
A tale of two cities... well one is more a small country town!  
I live between Collingwood on the Northside of Melbourne - and the beautiful Barossa Valley in South Australia. I love Collingwood and it's surrounds: the food, the shopping, great coffee and an eclectic community. But I also love the serenity in the valley and it is such a wonderfull contrast and so good for the soul. When I am in either location I pop the other on Airbnb so that I can share all that I love. I am passionate about design which is reflected in my homes, and I love to immerse myself in the local culture of the places that I live and visit. I know the importance of having a home to return to after a day of exploring and have ensured that I have kept my homes as truly liveable spaces.  I am proud to share them with like-minded guests and I know that you will enjoy your stay in either 'the Wood' (Collingwood), or the valley.

name: Barossa Shiraz Estate The Vines
summary: If you are celebrating a special occasion, anniversary or even on your honeymoon, the Vines is the ideal retreat for two.  The open-plan living, kitchen and dining area has picture-book windows with views over the vines, as does the spacious bedroom, which has a king-size bed and beautiful ensuite complete with spa bath.  Or take a glass of wine out to the verandah and watch the sun set over the Barossa Ranges.

name: King Deluxe Room
space: Angaston Vineyards Motel is centrally located in the heart of the Barossa Valley, 2 Km from Angaston, 4 Km from Nuriootpa and 9 Km from Tanunda.   It sits across the road from Vintner's Bar & Grill and the famous Barossa Farmers Market and only 500 metres from Salter's restaurant. The Vineyards Motel offers friendly and professional service and is the perfect base for daily excursions around the Barossa Valley's many cellar doors and other sights.  The Motel has 20 units of various configuration and can take groups up to 52 people. It has a pool area with BBQ facilities overlooking the beautiful Saltram's Vineyards.   Bus Tours to several points of interest can be organised from the reception.

name: Vineyard Views
summary: Vineyard Views, hidden in the ridges of Menglers Hill near Angaston, on a working-vineyard, delivers everything you need for your next weekend getaway in the Barossa. With Angaston a five-minute drive in one direction and world class wineries a five-minute drive in another, Vineyard Views has you covered.  You can stay in and watch the sunset from the deck with a glass of shiraz, or you can use the peaceful location as a base to visit nearby cellar doors and other Barossa attractions.
space: The newly renovated suite was once a part of the original homestead. It now features a large bedroom, a modern bathroom and kitchen with (cook top, toaster, coffee machine) perfect for a solo or couple getaway. The suite sits just in front of the family home but has its own access and entrance, giving you privacy during your stay and uninterrupted views of the valley.  So... don’t just take our word for it, that the sunset view from the deck is one of the most spectacular in the Barossa  -  grab a bottle of wine and come and see for yourself! Your friendly hosts are on hand to help you with any local advice and Jazzy (the dog) and Ginger (the cat) may also come and say hello.

name: Bethany Room
summary: Enjoy a romantic weekend away in one of our three elegant rooms. Enjoy the magnificent Langmeil Room for your Honey-moon. Fernweh Guesthouse is an iconic Tanunda residence (circa 1925) providing elegant hosted accommodation with three luxurious, private and secure bedrooms. The guesthouse is centrally located in the heart of Tanunda, being only a short walk (300m) to popular restaurants, cafes, bars and local wineries.  Fernweh ( we pronounce  fern - way :  is a German word which means a love of travel to far-away places) Breakfast comprises a lavish spread of self-serve cereals, fruits, juices and selected bakery and dairy options in the luxuriously appointed formal dining room. Your hot breakfast is selected from our menu (including the Big Barossa Breakfast and vegetarian/vegan options). Your coffee is prepared by our qualified barista.  An extensive selection of teas are also available.. At Fernweh Guesthouse you have a choice of three intimate,  elegantly presented bedrooms.  Gues
space: The Bethany Room features its own magnificent solid brass queen sized bed and has recently been refurbished to include a new ensuite with underfloor heating. A wood fireplace, air-conditioner and table and chairs complete the room. The Bethany Room is conveniently located just down the hall from the shared Formal Lounge and Dining Rooms where guests have access to a wood fire heater, luxurious mahogany Chippindale furniture and large television and enjoy free wifi, a selection of board games and reading material. Bethany Room guests have full access to the Common Room which includes kitchenette facilities (large fridge, washing machine, microwave, jug and tea / coffee making facilities, cutlery, glasses and crockery), which  is located just down the hallway for you to (Email hidden by Airbnb) plimentary snacks are included.  Our Bethany Room guests have access to the the extensive rear garden and shared outdoor facilities.  Ample free shaded parking  is provided.
description: Enjoy a romantic weekend away in one of our three elegant rooms. Enjoy the magnificent Langmeil Room for your Honey-moon. Fernweh Guesthouse is an iconic Tanunda residence (circa 1925) providing elegant hosted accommodation with three luxurious, private and secure bedrooms. The guesthouse is centrally located in the heart of Tanunda, being only a short walk (300m) to popular restaurants, cafes, bars and local wineries.  Fernweh ( we pronounce  fern - way :  is a German word which means a love of travel to far-away places) Breakfast comprises a lavish spread of self-serve cereals, fruits, juices and selected bakery and dairy options in the luxuriously appointed formal dining room. neighborhood_overview: Eating out. The best restaurants and cafes are 300 metres away. There is no need to drive. Wineries!! Outstanding local wineries offer free wine tasting. German style bakeries and butcher shops. Food and Wine Day Tour. We can book you on our own group day tour or arrange a private tour exclusively for you. Bike hire. We have a pair of electric bikes, great to explore the Barossa (range of up to 80km in one day) with 50% discount for guests. Tennis - we can book a court and you can hire equipment from us. Shopping - second hand shops, excellent furniture stores, supermarket (all within a few minutes walk) Kegel  9 pin bowling across the street in the parklands. Join the fun on Friday night. Further activities are available.
notes: Extra guests are accommodated by booking an extra room. There are three double rooms which accommodate up to 3 couples. Children over the age of 12 are welcome and are required to have their own room. Sharing a room with adults is not permitted. It is possible to book the whole house (3 rooms) contact us for details.
transit: Turning off the main street (Murray Street) in the centre of Tanunda at the water fountain outside FermantAsian Restaurant, head along Elizabeth Street to number 20. We are located across the street from the parklands and the sporting fields pedestrian entry. Fernweh Guesthouse is located right in the heart of Tanunda. 300 metres from the best restaurants, coffee shops, Information Centre, shops and bars. Some of the Barossa's best wineries are within a 15 minute walk from your accommodation.
access: Fernweh Guesthouse is a luxury Bed and Breakfast providing an intimate stay with three bedrooms at three different prices categories. All guests can access the luxurious Lounge Room, beautifully presented Common Room (with refrigerator, sink, microwave, washing machine, cups, crockery,cutlery,  glasses, iron / ironing board, table and chairs), Your full breakfast is served in the formal Dining Room. Other facilities include free WiFi, free car-parking, access to formal gardens, BBQ and outdoor settings,  discounted day tours, electric bike hire (50% discount),
house_rules: Check in is from 14.00 and departure is by 10.00. Any guests requiring their luggage to be stored may contact us directly to arrange a suitable time to drop off luggage.
host_about: Christine and I have a love of travel. Fernweh (pronounced fern-way means a love of travel to far away places). Our travels have taken us throughout Europe and Asia. We are committed to providing an outstanding experience for guests who stay with us. We can assure you of a friendly welcome. Our registered private day tours and electric bike hire allows guests to have some excellent experiences with us.

name: Delightful Heritage Listed Cottage in Angaston.
summary: Stoneleigh Cottage B&B is a heritage listed property located in the historic town of Angaston, in the beautiful Barossa Valley. The cottage is divided into two self-contained units, featuring a bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, lounge and laundry. Each Unit as a private entrance and carport. Stoneleigh Cottage is ideal for couples travelling together who would like to have their own private accommodation. The cottage is within walking distance to shops, restaurants, bakeries and a grocery store.

name: Barossa by the Park for large family or friends
summary: Barossa by the Park is a short driving distance to all of the Barossa wineries and many other sites.  This light filled home welcomes you to relax, cook, wine and dine away at the spacious kitchen and 8-seater dining table.  A Bluetooth receiver and speakers  ensure you can listen to your favourite songs. 3 bedrooms have electric shutters and the 4th has plantation shutters for a calming night’s sleep.  The alfresco is ideal for a barbecue and the enclosed rear garden is secure for children.
space: The kitchen is well equipped. The neighbourhood is very quiet. Modern touches include Smartkey entry and USB ports.
description: Barossa by the Park is a short driving distance to all of the Barossa wineries and many other sites.  This light filled home welcomes you to relax, cook, wine and dine away at the spacious kitchen and 8-seater dining table.  A Bluetooth receiver and speakers  ensure you can listen to your favourite songs. 3 bedrooms have electric shutters and the 4th has plantation shutters for a calming night’s sleep.  The alfresco is ideal for a barbecue and the enclosed rear garden is secure for children. The kitchen is well equipped. The neighbourhood is very quiet. Modern touches include Smartkey entry and USB ports. The entire home, garage and garden are for you and your family or friends to relax and enjoy. We will be readily contactable if needed. You have the entire place to yourself but we can be readily contacted if you would like assistance. Many of the local boutique and larger wineries offer free wine tastings.  We can help with suggestions, plus there is information and pamphlets on loca
neighborhood_overview: Many of the local boutique and larger wineries offer free wine tastings.  We can help with suggestions, plus there is information and pamphlets on local wineries, restaurants, suggested tourist routes and other activities.  The home faces a park which is home to kookaburras and other bird life, and has a flat walking trail for walkers, cyclists and runners. Stroll around the nearby Bush Gardens to see various displays of local native plants including the Sensory Garden. The 5km ParkRun is held in the park each Saturday.
notes: Please read the ‘Directions’ section before arrival, which provides the specific address. The house is located in a new housing estate and (Hidden by Airbnb) maps do not recognise the actual street yet, hence we provided a nearby street name.
transit: You can walk straight into the park and nearby Bush Gardens. It’s a 20 minute walk via the park and linear track to the wonderful Foodland complex. A car is required for most other outings.

name: Under the Vines....a Vineyard Escape!
summary: Under the Vines is a self contained cottage in five acres of vineyard and native bushland, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region. Every window has a vineyard view! (This accommodation is also available with one bathroom at a reduced rate.)
space: The spacious living area  - with comfy sofas, beanbag, cushions and snuggly blanket - is set up with complimentary Wi-Fi and Netflix, a large smart TV, PlayStation & Blu-ray DVD. The main bathroom has a huge double shower and luxurious two-person spa, and a generous selection of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscreen TV/DVD (viewed from the spa). Bathroom 2 features a coloured rainshower. The kitchen has full facilities - oven, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher and coffee machine, and and a great range of regional provisions included for breakfast/brunch. Reverse-cycle aircondioning and a cosy wood fire provide heating and cooling whatever the season. Outdoor furniture settings on the return verandah accommodate the views from every angle, and portable gas heater and a barbecue provide outdoor options, weather permitting! Every window has a vineyard view - experience Barossa living Under the Vines......

neighborhood_overview: Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself! The Barossa Valley offers many unique and rich experiences - food, wine, culture, heritage. Allow time to immerse yourself in some of these....and then come back again for another bite!
notes: Local produce for a country style breakfast Quality linen and towels provided Complimetary WiFi TV/DVD/Playstation/Netflix Combustion heater R/C Airconditioning Laundry facilities BBQ / Outdoor furniture / Gas heater Earth friendly bathroom products Cot and highchair available on request
access: The cottage is yours to enjoy exclusively, along with the 5 acres of vineyard and native bushland. Multiple outdoor furniture settings on the return verandah and around the property provide great options and accommodate the views from every angle, and a portable gas heater, bbq and brazier provide extra outdoor options, weather permitting! If you visit during vintage season (late February - April) you might get a job picking grapes, helping out in the vineyard or doing some winemaking!
interaction: I don't live on the property, but I'm only a few minutes away, and can be contacted by Airbnb message, phone, SMS or email during your stay if there's anything you need assistance with.

name: 10 Murray  Tanunda  feel like a local
summary: 10 Murray St Tanunda is situated in the main street of Tanunda, in the centre of the Barossa Valley. A few doors from the main street enjoy a short and relaxing walk to shops, cafes & award winning restaurants. 10 Murray is a blue stone fronted cottage, built in 1890. The interior has been totally renovated and modernised. With 3 large bedrooms all with king beds. Perfect for a group as the beds split to singles if needed. Stay and feel like a local in our beautiful home you wont want to leave
space: Wonderful diversity of this property with main setup of bedding being 3 kings, all beds can be changed to offer single bedding. Perfect for a group of friends, family or corporate visitors. Under floor heating in winter and reverse air conditioning throughout the house makes your stay super comfortable. We do not supply breakfast provisions as we love the variety of cafes in town and encourage you to explore locally. We do provide a few cooking basics , tea, coffee, milk and treats. So many cafes and restaurants are in walking distance; this location is perfect.The kitchen has everything you need, so you can cook up a storm or wander down to one of the local eateries. The laundry has a washing machine plus dryer. We also have Foxtel and wi-fi.

name: Oldham House. Barossa Valley & Clare  Valleys
summary: Very beautiful restored colonial house. Victorian period fitout with modern conveniences and appliances. Features include a welcome platter of food and wine and a selection of included breakfasts to choose from (fruit & yoghurt - bacon & eggs etc). Large luxuriously furnished rooms; spa hot tub; cooking facilities; restored antique piano to play; patio/verandah. 19th century Australian living brought back to life!
space: Close to the Barossa Valley. 20 minutes from Nuriootpa. 15 minutes from Greenock. Very peaceful and quiet. Local attraction is the old copper mine in Kapunda (Australia's first mine) and wineries in the Barossa Valley.
description: Very beautiful restored colonial house. Victorian period fitout with modern conveniences and appliances. Features include a welcome platter of food and wine and a selection of included breakfasts to choose from (fruit & yoghurt - bacon & eggs etc). Large luxuriously furnished rooms; spa hot tub; cooking facilities; restored antique piano to play; patio/verandah. 19th century Australian living brought back to life! Close to the Barossa Valley. 20 minutes from Nuriootpa. 15 minutes from Greenock. Very peaceful and quiet. Local attraction is the old copper mine in Kapunda (Australia's first mine) and wineries in the Barossa Valley. Front Patio; garden; private lounge; private bathroom with spa; bedroom; dining room; shared kitchen. I am either in and out of the property doing maintenance or approachable by work phone/contact etc. if need be. I have knowledge of tourist attractions in Kapunda and in the Barossa Valley. Kapunda was the first copper mining town in Australia. For that reason
neighborhood_overview: Kapunda was the first copper mining town in Australia. For that reason it is home to some of the oldest houses and cottages Australia, and Oldham house is no exception. We are also fortunate to be close to some of the famous wineries, restaurants and bakeries of the Barossa Valley; being 20 minutes drive from Nuriootpa and some of the big wineries (Penfolds, Wolf Blass, and Yalumba). It is a very peaceful and quiet spot, and on a lucky night the kookaburras will come out for a laugh.
transit: Kapunda and the Barossa Valley are tourist hotspots so there are a lot of tours and buses that pass through; specifically for wine tasting. If you ask I'm sure I could help you source something in advance before your trip.
access: Front Patio; garden; private lounge; private bathroom with spa; bedroom; dining room; shared kitchen.
interaction: I am either in and out of the property doing maintenance or approachable by work phone/contact etc. if need be. I have knowledge of tourist attractions in Kapunda and in the Barossa Valley.
host_about: I'm passionate about many things in life and try to always achieve a better quality in all that I do.  Hopefully that transgresses into a better stay for my guests at Oldham House...

name: Historic Valley House in beautiful Barossa Valley
summary: Our guest suite is a part of our historic home, in the middle of Lyndoch, our lovely little country town. We are in the Barossa Valley and minutes away from world famous wineries and plenty of other attractions. Valley House is a great base to explore Adelaide, the Adelaide Hills and the Barossa Valley. Our guest suite is spacious and a short walk to the local cafe, restaurant, bakery, general store, hotel, pharmacy and several wineries.
space: The guest suite has a spacious lounge/ dining room, bedroom and en suite bathroom. Our fireplaces are NOT operational. Your comfort is assured as we have reverse cycle ducted air conditioning and a ceiling fan in your bedroom. We provide coffee and tea making  facilities, a microwave and small fridge.
description: Our guest suite is a part of our historic home, in the middle of Lyndoch, our lovely little country town. We are in the Barossa Valley and minutes away from world famous wineries and plenty of other attractions. Valley House is a great base to explore Adelaide, the Adelaide Hills and the Barossa Valley. Our guest suite is spacious and a short walk to the local cafe, restaurant, bakery, general store, hotel, pharmacy and several wineries. The guest suite has a spacious lounge/ dining room, bedroom and en suite bathroom. Our fireplaces are NOT operational. Your comfort is assured as we have reverse cycle ducted air conditioning and a ceiling fan in your bedroom. We provide coffee and tea making  facilities, a microwave and small fridge. You are welcome to play our antique piano. Please only if you know how to play as it is a family heirloom. We live on site and will be around if you have any questions but you will have complete privacy as our historic home is very large (it was the old t
neighborhood_overview: We are blessed with an award winning cafe, a delightful bakery, a delicious restaurant, a great country pub, a nice park, a peaceful recreation ground (including tennis courts) and many fantastic wineries within a stone's throw. We also have a walking trail and bicycle trail that runs right through the Barossa Valley (Gawler to Angaston) which is close by.
notes: We have a very large car park (from the days when Valley House was the town library) you are welcome to use. Use either gateway.
transit: Driving is easy with much to see within minutes. There are a number of taxi services within the Barossa Valley and many tour companies so you can visit wineries very comfortably. We also have a walking trail and bicycle trail that runs right through our town and the Barossa Valley.
access: You are welcome to play our antique piano. Please only if you know how to play as it is a family heirloom.
interaction: We live on site and will be around if you have any questions but you will have complete privacy as our historic home is very large (it was the old town library). We look forward to welcoming you and providing keys and information on arrival.
host_about: Along with my wife Lee, I have enjoyed staying at many Air BnB locations. We have a lovely historic home we are looking forward to sharing with others. We enjoy chatting with guests to share what we know of Valley House and the fantastic Barossa Valley.

name: Elevations, an Oasis, in Barossa Goldfields
summary: Our home is on 14 acres. An oasis in the goldfields, with a pond that has a beach, a pool and many places to relax and enjoy the environment. Spectacular Elevated 320 degree views from the top of our hill and beautiful views directly from your bed. Cot can be provided on request. 5 mins to Barossa Goldfields & Whispering wall, 10 to Williamstown, 20 to Tanunda, great location to explore the area. We will mainly keep to ourselves, though you are very welcome to join us during your stay.
space: Family property has 4 bedrooms, on a quiet dirt road, that is only a 10 minute drive to shops, supermarkets, restaurants, wineries etc. Guests have their own private bedroom and bathroom. Additional cot can be provided on request, and included in room charge. Tea and coffee facilities ( incl coffee machine) located in the kitchen. Its largely grassed around the house itself with many seating and relaxing areas, including chairs on the beach. A great place to unwind and relax. Shared living room, TV ( incl Netflix & Stan), kitchen, laundry and outdoor areas, including barbecue. WiFi throughout your stay. Property is 14 acres, of which you can walk all around enjoy the wonderful views at the top of our hill. Children requiring a cot are free, please do not include them as a guest when booking.
description: Our home is on 14 acres. An oasis in the goldfields, with a pond that has a beach, a pool and many places to relax and enjoy the environment. Spectacular Elevated 320 degree views from the top of our hill and beautiful views directly from your bed. Cot can be provided on request. 5 mins to Barossa Goldfields & Whispering wall, 10 to Williamstown, 20 to Tanunda, great location to explore the area. We will mainly keep to ourselves, though you are very welcome to join us during your stay. Family property has 4 bedrooms, on a quiet dirt road, that is only a 10 minute drive to shops, supermarkets, restaurants, wineries etc. Guests have their own private bedroom and bathroom. Additional cot can be provided on request, and included in room charge. Tea and coffee facilities ( incl coffee machine) located in the kitchen. Its largely grassed around the house itself with many seating and relaxing areas, including chairs on the beach. A great place to unwind and relax. Shared living room, TV ( inc
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Goldfields  Bowden Cottage Historic home is only 5 mins drive and as part of the Parra Wirra park there are many walking tracks through the old mining area and beyond. Whispering wall is close by, in fact you can see it from the top of our hill. There is also a little known local lookout just out of Lyndoch that we can share with you. Wineries,coffee shops and cafes are only a short drive away.
notes: You will need to be okay with our 3 little dogs ( large chihuahuas), that spend most of their time outside, doing what dogs do. They have an enclosure for sleeping inside at night, that way they won't disturb you. They are pretty friendly once they feel safe with you.  The house property has 8ft high fences to keep the kangaroos and deer off the grass, so if you can please ensure the front gate is closed after you on entry and exit, thank you.
transit: We are away from public transport, so its best you have a car. There are Taxis and Tour companies but no Uber.  There are walking tracks in the Parra Wirra park and the Barossa bike/walking trail goes all the way from Gawler to Angaston. A walk around our 'block' is an enjoyable undulating 5km.  I can take you on a tour of the Barossa, taking in what is most enjoyable for you or other outlying areas that may take your fancy - Price depends on length of tour.
access: Access to their private bedroom & bathroom, Kitchen, Living room & TV, Dining, Laundry and outside areas including barbeque and pool in warmer months.
interaction: We will be around if you need us.
house_rules: Clean as you stay at home Especially, if you cook in the kitchen or on the barbeque. Thank you this is much appreciated. Keep living room tidy. Elevations at Barossa Goldfields is strictly NO SMOKING indoors
host_about:
My husband and I love to explore new places and cultures, walking, and spending time in the natural environment wherever we go. 
We are very interested in healthy lifestyle, personal development, alternative therapies and experiences of a spiritual nature.

name: Central location with country views
summary: Our 1940's self-contained cottage is located just 5 minutes walk to the main street shops, cafes and playground. Newly listed, this cottage has been freshly painted, includes new linen and bedding with some antique touches. The backyard has a view of the hills and creek, and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind for a weekend away. The ideal combination of location and country setting.
space: The Cottage has been newly furnished and includes some touches of antique furniture to compliment the cottage's heritage. The open-plan living, dining and kitchen is a very spacious area, giving everyone enough room to relax. The kitchen island bench creates a social space and plenty of room for those who like to cook up a storm. The kitchen is fully equipped including a microwave, fridge and dishwasher. There is tea and coffee included with some fresh fruit on arrival, and a few other kitchen staples supplied.  There are two main bedrooms with the third space having a dual-purpose. A cosy seating area where you can read a book and enjoy the view of the hills. Or two single fold out sofas, mostly designed for a child/youth bedroom. The cottage has natural gas heating and reverse cycle cooling. There are also ceiling fans in the two main bedrooms and lounge room.     Some entertainment includes a smart flat screen T.V., Wi-Fi, board games and a bluetooth speaker. The laundry has a washi

The backyard has a view of the hills and creek, and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind for a weekend away. The ideal combination of location and country setting. The open-plan living, dining and kitchen is a very spacious area, giving everyone enough room to relax. The kitchen island bench creates a social space and plenty of room for those who like to cook up a storm. The kitchen is fully equipped including a microwave, fridge and dishwasher. A cosy seating area
neighborhood_overview: There is so much to explore within walking distance; Barossa Valley Cheese company, wine tasting at Taste Eden Valley, several cafes and eateries, playgrounds and walking paths. You will find information on my other Barossa favourites and towns on arrival, including wineries and walking trails. The local Barossa Farmers Markets are held every Saturday morning, only 2 minutes drive away.
transit: There are local wine tour companies to help you explore the Barossa, if you do not wish to self drive. There is also a local taxi company if you need restaurant arrangements. Bicycle hire is also available nearby for those who like to explore on 2 wheels. Maps and information can be found on the table on arrival.
interaction: You will be able to contact me by email during your stay, and prior to arriving.
house_rules: No smoking inside. No pets. Please no excessive noise after 10pm. Stay and enjoy the cottage, but please respect it as you would your own.
host_about:
I have lived in the Barossa for over 26 years. I love to call the Barossa home and enjoy sharing knowledge of what our beautiful region has to offer. I have worked in hospitality and the wine industry for 19 years, and customer service is a passion.
I love to explore other regions and have enjoyed several overseas holidays in the last 5 years, staying in several airbnb accommodation.

name: Cirillo Guest House
summary: In the heart of the Barossa, Cirillo Guest House is set in a tranquil and secluded location for the perfect getaway. The house has been recently refurbished, decorated in bright, clean furnishings. The house sits surrounded by some of the oldest vineyards in the world, planted in 1848 owned and operated by the Cirillo family. The winery estate offers beautiful views of neighbouring vineyards and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind.
space: Exclusively yours to enjoy, the provincial / Hamptons styled house offers three bedrooms along with modern open plan living spaces. The huge kitchen is fully equipped with an oven, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. There is a large island bench for communal dining.  The clean and bright bathroom has a rain shower with a separate second toilet located adjacent to the laundry. The laundry has a washing machine and clothes dryer. There is a fireplace, plus panel heaters in each bedroom for the cooler months. Evaporation cooling throughout the house for summer. Ceiling fans feature in all bedrooms. The property has two queen beds and a double, Sheridan linen and towels, complementary Cirillo Estate wine, beer, personal amenities, and a well-stocked larder with breakfast provisions.  We offer a selection of herbal and black tea & the use of a Nespresso coffee machine. There will be a selection of seasonal produce on arrival. The dining and living areas give you space to spread out a

neighborhood_overview: The property backs onto the Barossa Bike Trail. We are a stone’s throw from the Barossa Farmers Market and a short drive from Barossa’s most popular local restaurants and cellar doors.
notes: You have the entire house to yourself, but as it is a working winery site, there may be a Ute or tractor driving past on the odd occasion! We do still operate out of the winery on the site, (so we may ask you to lend a hand!) There is plenty of parking space and room for a trailer or a caravan. You can pull up and park behind the house in the double carport.
access: Guests will have full access to the house.
interaction: I live locally and available readily for any needs regarding your stay.

name: Tanunda Apartment
summary: A modern spacious self contained apartment with a queen bed, large ensuite with spa bath, kitchenette and ducted reverse cycle air conditioning. Located in the beautiful Barossa Valley, conveniently located just off the main street of Tanunda and within walking distance to quality restaurants, art galleries, antique & craft shops, parks & hotels, making it a superb choice for accommodation.

name: Frond & Farro -The Bungalow
summary: The Bungalow is a 1930's bungalow style house, situated on a half acre block in the heart of Angaston village. When you stay you will receive a selection of seasonal produce such as Frond & Farros own handmade pasta and pesto,  jam, museli and olives, as well a bottle of JC'Own wine and other complimenytary amenities. If you are wanting to explore you are only a short walking distance to local, cafes, restaurants and cellar doors.
space: The Bungalow is furnished with natural textures and homewares, giving a relaxing and warming atmosphere. Inside features 4 bedrooms, all with king beds. Bedroom 1 has a king split which makes up 2 singles. The kitchen is stocked with organic pepper, salt, olive oil, bread, loose leaf tea, compostable coffee pods, coffee machine, eggs, butter and milk. . Many of the plateware in the kitchen is Fond & Farros own homeware which has been designed in colaboration with a local potter. You are welcome access to our pantry cellar which stocks additional wine and Frond & Farro produce and homewares for you to purchase during your stay or you are welcome to purchase and we will pack it all for you and send it to your home or as a present.

neighborhood_overview: The nearby township of Angaston is home to many wonderful places for you to visit. From Casa Carboni for cooking classes, great coffee or handmade italian foods. Hive for your cafe hit and great breakfast. Barossa Valley Cheese, The Real Pantry, The Smokehouse Butcher, Yalumba Winery, Taste of Eden,
transit: There is a new park area nearby which is walking distance, as well as walking, jogging and cycling trails around the townships and in nearby conservation parks. We will also provide you with a list of recommend places for hiring bikes, private and group bus and car tour guides as well as a hop on hop off bus companies.
access: You will have exclusive access to the property and house. However please note that you will only have access to the amount of bedrooms and bathrooms required for your stay. (For example, a booking for 2 people will not have access to 4 bedrooms). You will have access to the outside dining BBQ area and gardens. After you have booked we will send you all the information you require for you to organise your activities and to have a relaxing and comfortable stay.
interaction: You are welcome to contact us via text any time during your stay if you have a question or need any urgent assistance.
house_rules: No Parties No additional guests on property

name: Self Contained Cottage in central Barossa Valley
summary: Located centrally between Nuriootpa and Angaston, Almond Tree Cottage is near local vineyards, the Barossa Bike and Walking track, the renowned Farmers  Market and local wineries. Perfect for a weekend away, the cottage  provides comfort at a reasonable rate and features exclusive use for one or two adult guests. One bedroom with Queen size bed with linen supplied.  Reverse cycle air conditioning. Kitchen has an electric stove. Generous breakfast provisions included. No smoking or pets allowed.
space: Room One:  One bedroom with Queen size deluxe bed, quality linen and electric blanket.  Smart television, DVD player & 2 chairs. The cottage has reverse cycle air conditioning and an overhead fan. Room Two: Kitchen with table and chairs for two, bar refrigerator, electric stove, cooking utensils, wine rack, chopping board, microwave oven.  Pantry items. Room Three: Bathroom with heated towel warmer and shower. Towels are supplied.

neighborhood_overview: Just a 50 minute drive north east of Adelaide, the Barossa is an internationally-acclaimed wine region encompassing the towns of Tanunda, Angaston and Nuriootpa
notes: Private driveway for your motor vehicle. No turning space.  Note you will have to back out to leave, or you can leave your car just outside of the gate (but still inside the property.
transit: Car essential for travel between towns.  Taxi services available.
access: Self contained Cottage with outdoor setting on veranda and driveway.
interaction: Enter via private gravel driveway.  Clean and elegant,  no fuss accommodation with basic amenities.  The Cottage is just behind your hosts' main residence if you need anything.
host_about:
I am a fifth generation born South Australian from German and English ancestors.
I am now retired, but worked for Tax Agents as a bookkeeper for about 30 years.
My husband and I moved to the Barossa Valley in 2012 and love the peace and quiet of our property, situated on the Barossa floor between Nuriootpa and Angaston.  The small cottage on our property was turned into a Guest house just after we moved in.  We look forward to meeting new people and guests and hope you enjoy your stay in this wonderful area the Barossa Valley with its rich history, wines and dining.
